DMAP Programmer’s Guide About This Book12 Main Index About This Book The MSC Nastran 2024.1 D MAP Programmer’s Guide is a replacement for and update of the former Version 2023 .4 DMAP Programmer’s Guide . Contained in this Guide is the introduction to DMAP , syntax and concepts, data block descriptions, and NDDL statement descriptions. The guide also contains material that is more frequently referenced: the DMAP Module descriptions. DMAP Programmer’s Guide Technical Support14 Main Index

Main Index Chapter 1: Direct Matrix Abstraction MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide DMAP Programmer’s Guide 1 Direct Matrix Abstraction Introduction The MSC Nastran DMAP Language Data Blocks Instructions “Output from a Previous Module” Rule Automatic Deletion of Scratch Data Blocks Preface Modules and SOLution 100 Processing of User Errors SubDMAPs DBMGR, DBSTORE, and DBFETCH WHERE and CONVERT Clauses

DMAP Programmer’s Guide Introduction2 Main Index Introduction MSC Nastran DMAP (Direct Matrix Abstraction Program) is a high-level language with its own compiler and grammatical rules. This section provides a summary description of the MSC Nastran DMAP language, rules, and syntax. A DMAP program consists of a series of functional blocks called “modules,” each of which has a unique name and a specific function. Modules are executed sequentially; branching and looping operations are performed by DMAP control statements. Modules communicate through the MSC Nastran Executive System (NES) via logical collections of data called “data blocks” and “parameters.” Data blocks come in two distinct forms: “matrices” that obey the rules of matrix algebra, and “tables” that represent a convenient collection of data items. Data blocks are given arbitrary names (mnemonic names are recommended) and have header and trailer information defining their characteristics. Parameters are scalar items used for specifying control, operation, or system characteristics. Modules can use “input parameters,” “output parameters,” or both. Input parameters affect the internal operation of the modules. Output parameters are used to control DMAP logic and/or to pass scalar information to subsequent modules. Data blocks and parameters can be written onto either scratch or permanent physical files. When the normal MSC Nastran execution is completed, data blocks and parameters written to scratch files are erased, and those written to the permanent physical file are available for future use. The NDDL (MSC Nastran Data Definition Language) designates whether a data block is scratch or permanent. A detailed description of the NDDL statements can be found in Nastran Data Definition Language (NDDL) . MSC Nastran provides the user with a variety of prewritten solution sequences . These solution sequences consist of a series of DMAP statements. MSC Nastran allows the user to modify prewritten solution sequences or to write his or her own solution sequences using DMAP . The compilation, linkage, and execution of a DMAP program is specified by executive control statements in the input file. The creation of and access to databases is specified by file management statements also contained in the input file. File management statements are described in the File Management Statements (Ch. 3) in the MSC Nastran Quick Reference Guide . The MSC Nastran DMAP Language The basic components, or objects, of the DMAP language are: The basic syntax of the DMAP language is: The DMAP language uses free-field input format and is case insensitive.Parameters Scalar quantities used to control the flow of DMAP execution and to communicate options and/or values to modules or functions. Data Blocks Tables or matrices represented by a symbolic name. Instructions Statements or modules that process parameters and/or data blocks as input and/or output.

item.title: User's Manual P100
item.description:
1963 IFT Performs an inverse Fourier transform Main Index Performs an inverse Fourier transform to convert the frequency response solution matrix to the time domain. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters: Purpose: The purpose of this module is to obtain solutions versus time for frequency response for which the forces are only known as functions of frequency. The definition of the inverse transform is (4-55) where is considered to be a known input (frequency response, and is the output (time response). Several approximations will be used for evaluation of (4-55). A special algorithm is to be used for equal ’s, which can result in savings of computation times. A special algorithm will be introduced to provide for a cubic spline fit for between the data points.IFT Performs an inverse Fourier transform IFT UXF,CASECC,TRL,FOL/ UXT,TOL/ IFTM $ UXF Solution matrix from frequency response analysis in d- or h-set. CASECC Table of Case Control command images. TRL T ransient response list. FOL Frequency response frequency output list. UXT Solution matrix from transient response analysis in d- or h-set. TOL T ransient response time output list. IFTM Input-integer-default=1. Fourier transform method. 0 Constant 1 Piecewise linear (default) 2 Cubic spline uit1 —Re 0 u˜ieit d = u˜ ut  u˜

IFT Performs an inverse Fourier transform1964 Main Index Method: General Approach: The integral will be expressed as a finite sum. The input data block UXF has one row for each mode, and a column (complex) for each frequency. The output UXT will have the same number of rows, but with these columns for each time step. Frequencies and times have been selected via standard FREQi and TSTEP Bulk Data entries. Each row of the input matrix is transformed into a row of the output. The basic sum is given by (4-56) (4-57) (4-58) where: (4-59) (4-60) The functions and will be discussed later.=1, 2,…,NTIME

=the complex quantity in the i-th row and the n-th column of UHVF . =the second derivative, found by the method of splines. =the real quantity output on UHVT. Re =“Real part of.” Note: for efficiency uitm1 — Re n1=NFREQ Cmnu˜inDmnu˜·· in + eintm  = u·itm1 — Re n1=NFREQ inCmnu˜inDmnu˜in + eintm  = u··itm1 — Re n1=NFREQ –n2Cmnu˜in eintm  = m n2 fnffrequency =  u˜in u··in u˜itn ReCu ReCuReuImcImu – = Cmnnn1–– 2————————–E2it–mnn1––    =n1+n– 2—————————E2+ itmn1+n–    + Dmnnn1–– 3 24———————————- – Gitm–nn1––   n1+n– 3 24———————————-Gn1+n–  – = E2G

then the special equal frequency intervals methods are to be used. Otherwise, the general case will be assumed. See (4-57) and (4-58). C D  C D  nn1–– 21– – 106–21–  Equal t E21=   0= E212=E21= 12 Dmn0= Dmn0= Cm = m Dmn0= Cmn0= CmDmn m Cm =  2tm2t N 2=t  tt2N = t ntmnmt2nm N——-= = k 0N1–= Ck2kN cos = Sk2kN sin= eintmCkiSk+ =

IFT Performs an inverse Fourier transform1966 Main Index (4-64) The table can be created with recurrence. For unequal , then (4-65) where the COS and SIN subroutines will be called. The funtions and will have special formulas depending upon the size of their argument. (4-66) (4-67) (4-68) (4-69) (4-70) . The alternating series is continued until the last term computed is less than . When IFTM = 2, a spline fit must be made to solve for . This will be done by a backward and forward pass over the frequencies . The same method is used for equal or unequal . On the initializing backward pass, compute real . (4-71)kModnm N=  eintmntmintm sin+ cos = E2G E2i1cos– 1 2— 2———————      isin– 1 2— 2——————–      0 + = = 12 34———- –4 3456————————-+ – +  i 3—5 345——————5 347——————–+ – + –  0 + Gi 2E2iE4i – = E4i2 2—–1cos+– 4 24—————————————3 6—–sin+– 4 24————————————–0 + = = 12 56———- –4 5678————————-+ – +  i 5—3 567——————.5 59————+ – + –  0 + 00.1= 109– u˜··   AnnNFREQ12 – =  NNFREQ0= ANnn1––  2n1+n1–– n1+n– An1+–———————————————————————————————– =

1967 IFT Performs an inverse Fourier transform Main Index For each row, do a backward and forward pass. The and can be stored in the same locations. The backward pass: (4-72) The forward pass: (4-73) Then continue for .Bnu˜··n BNFREQ0= BN6u˜n1+u˜n– n1+n–—————————u˜nu˜n1–– nn1––————————– –    n1+n– An1+Bn1+ – nn1––——————————————————————————————————————————————– = n NFREQ1–  32 = (real and imaginary) u˜··16u˜2u˜1– 21–——————-21–A2B2– 6121–2A2– +——————————————————————- Real Part 0 Imaginary Part 

2NFREQ  u˜··n AnBnu˜·· n1– –  =

ILMP1 Creates unit displacement matrix1968 Main Index Creates a unit displacement matrix on those DOFs that contribute to the monitored components. This matrix will be G-set size rows by contributed DOF in columns. Also creates a CASECC table associated with the columns of the unit displacement matrix and the g-set size column partitoning vector that mark the contributing DOF’s. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:ILMP1 Creates unit displacement matrix ILMP1 EST,BGPDT,EDT,EDT0/ CASEUNIT,UNITDISP,UNITPV,EDTM/ S,N,NCOLUNIT $ EST Element summary table. BGPDT Basic grid point definition table. EDT T able of Bulk Data entry images related to element deformation, aerodynamics, p-element analysis, divergence analysis, and the iterative solver. Also contains SET1 entries. EDT0 T able of archived set of MONPNT2 records to be merged into EDTM. CASEUNIT T able of Case Control parameters requesting to a unit displacements. In addition, the monitor points will be expressed as various sets of output depending on what is being monitored. UNITDISP Unit displacement matrix where each row represents a unit displacement at a degree-of-freedom. Only degrees-of-freedom which participate in the union of all monitor points will contain a unit displacement. UNITDISP has LUSET number of columns. UNITPV Partitioning vector (g-set) with 1.0 at each grid where a unit displacement is requested. (All 6 degrees-of-freedom will be assumed to contribute). EDTM Archival of EDT containing just the monitor records. NCOLUNIT Output-integer-default=-1. Number of unit displacement columns written. If NCOLUNIT<=0 then none were written.

1969 ILMP2 Creates output transformation matrix Main Index Creates the output transformation matrix for a particular OFP table type. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:ILMP2 Creates output transformation matrix ILMP2 EDT,OFP12,OFP22,OFP32/ OTMT,RLABEL/ NCOLMNP2 $ EDT Table of Bulk Data entry images related to element deformation, aerodynamics, p-element analysis, divergence analysis, and the iterative solver. Also contains SET1 entries. Specifically, this module reads the MON PNT2 record. OFPi2 Output table in SORT2 format. OTMT T ranspose of the output transformation matrix. Each column of the matrix will be associated with a single ILMP (and labeled in RLABEL). The rows will be the partition of g-set size DOFs that are contributing (CP defined). RLABEL Monitor point label for each column in OTMT. NCOLMNP2 Input-integer-default=0. Number of degrees-of-freedom associated with the MONPNT2 entries.

ILMPGPF 1970 Main Index Filters the grid point force output table according to the MONPNT3 entries down to a single monitor point. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameter:ILMPGPF ILMPGPF MP3GPF,EDT,BGPDT,CSTM,OGPFB1/ GPFMAT/ NDDLNAME $ MP3GPF T able of monitor point type-3 responses. EDT T able of Bulk Data entry images related to element deformation, aerodynamics, p-element analysis, divergence analysis, and the iterative solver. Also contains SET1 entries. Specifically, this module reads the MONPNT3 and SET1 records. BGPDT Basic grid point definition table. CSTM T able of coordinate system transformation matrices. OGPFB1 T able of grid point forces. GPFMAT Matrix of monitor point force data where each column is a subcase and each row is one component of the monitored forces. NDDLNAME Input-character-default=‘OGF’. NDDL name of the OGPFB1 data block.

1971 IMPFGM Generate GEOM1 datablock with geometric imperfection Main Index Generate IMPDATA record of GEOM1 for imperfection. Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:IMPFGM Generate GEOM1 datablock with geometric imperfection IMPFGM GEOM1,OUG1,BGPDT,CSTM,EDT/GEOM1N/IIMPF/NIMPF/S,IMPFID/S, NOGO $ GEOM1 GEOM1 datablock OUG1 OUG1 datablock read from imperfection input files. BGPDT BGPDT datablock CSTM CSTM datablock EDT EDT datablock GEOM1N GEOM1 datablock containing IMPDATA record IIMPF Input-integer-default=0, sequential imperfection ID IMPFID Output-integer-default, imperfection ID defined in IMPGEOM entry NOGO Output-logical-default=false, error condition, set to true when errors happen.

IMPFIFP Imperfection IFP processing1972 Main Index Read IMPGEOM and IMPFCASE to generate IMPFMAP record of GEOM1 Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:IMPFIFP Imperfection IFP processing IMPFIFP CASECC,GEOM1/GEOM1N/S,NIMPF/S,NOGO $ CASECC Case control GEOM1 GEOM1 datablock containing IMPGEOM and IMPCASE records. GEOM1N New GEOM1 datablock containing IMPFMAP record. NIMPF Output-integer-default=0, number of imperfection cases used in IMPGEOM entries. NOGO Output-logical-default=false, if there are errors, set to true.

1973 IMPFOUG Generate imperfection vector Main Index Generate OUG datablock to express imperfect vector. Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:IMPFOUG Generate imperfection vector IMPFOUG CASECC,GEOM1,CSTM,BGPDTN,OUG1/OUG1IMP /IMPFID $ CASECC CASECC datablock GEOM1 GEOM1 datablock containing IMPDATA record. CSTM CSTM datablock BGPDTN BGPDT datablock OUG1 OUG1 datablock containing displacement or eigenvector. OUG1IMP OUG1 family of datablock to express imperfection vector. IMPFID Input-integer-default=0, imperfection ID

INDXBULK Indexes the Bulk Data table1974 Main Index Indexes the Bulk Data table. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters: None. Remark: 1.INDXBULK only indexes the CORDij, GRID and QSETi records.INDXBULK Indexes the Bulk Data table INDXBULK BULK/BULKINDX $ BULK T able of all sorted Bulk Data entries. BULKINDX T able of all sorted Bulk Data entries with indices.

1975 INPUTT2 Input tables of matrices from a FORTRAN unit Main Index Recovers up to five tables or matrices from a FORTRAN unit. This unit may have been written either by a FORTRAN program or by the companion module OUTPUT2. Format: Output Data Blocks: Parameters: INPUTT2 Input tables of matrices from a FORTRAN unit INPUTT2 /DB1,DB2,DB3,DB4,DB5/ ITAPE/IUNIT/LABL/ S,N,HNAME1/S,N,HNAME2/S,N,HNAME3/S,N,HNAME4/ S,N,HNAME5/S,N,DBKNT/ NDDLNAM1/NDDLNAM2/NDDLNAM3/NDDLNAM4/NDDLNAM5 / S,N,ACTONEOF $ DBi Data blocks to be input from the FORTRAN unit. ITAPE Input -integer -default = 0. ITAPE controls the status of the unit before INPUTT2 attempts to extract any data blocks. The following controls are available. ITAPE Value Action +n Skip forward n data blocks before reading. 0 Data blocks are read starting at the current position. -1 or -11 Rewind before reading and position tape past label (LABL), if any. -3 or -13 Print data block names, rewind before reading, and position tape past label, if any. -5 or -15 Search and output first occurrence of DBi. If none are found, then a fatal warning message is issued. -6 or -16 Search and output final occurrence of DBi. If none are found, then a fatal is issued. -7 or -17 Search and output first occurrence of DBi. If none are found, then a warning is issued. -8 or -18 Search and output final occurrence of DBi. If none are found, then a warning is issued.

INPUTT2 Input tables of matrices from a FORTRAN unit1976 Main Index IUNIT Input -integer -no default. IUNIT is the FORTRAN unit number from which the data blocks are to be read. IUNIT = 0 is not recommended. LABL Input -character -default = ‘XXXXXXXX’. LABL is the label on the FORTRAN unit. A check of the label may or may not be performed based on the value of ITAPE as indicated in the following table. ITAPE Value Tape Label Checked? +n NO 0 NO -1 YES -3 YES -5 YES -6 YES -7 YES -8 YES -11 NO -13 NO -15 NO -16 NO -17 NO -18 NO HNAMEi Output-character-default=’ ‘. Data block name found in the header of DBi on the Fortran unit. DBKNT Output-integer-default=0. Total number of data blocks found on IUNIT . DBKNT is only computed under ITAPE= -3 or -13. NDDLNAMi Input-character-default=blank. NDDL names corresponding to DB1 through DB5. If DBi is a matrix, then the corresponding NDDLNAMi is ‘MATRIX’. Used only to read unformatted (binary) Fortran files created on non-native computers. ACTONEOF Input/output-integer-default=1. Action to take when end-of-file encountered. 0: Issue fatal message and terminate run 1: Issue warning message and continue run. Set ACTONEOF=-1. 2: Issue no message and continue run. Set ACTONEOF=-2

1977 INPUTT2 Input tables of matrices from a FORTRAN unit Main Index Remarks: 1.Any or all of the output data blocks may be purged. Only nonpurged data blocks will be taken from the tape. The data blocks will be taken sequentially from the tape starting from a position determined by the value of the first parameter. Note that the output data block sequence A,B,,, is the same as ,A,,B, or ,,,A,B. 2.The ASSIGN FMS statement is recommended for assigning the FORTRAN unit. Certain FORTRAN units are reserved, see Making File Assignments in the MSC Nastran Installation and Operations Guide for a listing of reserved FORTRAN units. 3.Data blocks will be read from the FORTRAN unit in either binary or neutral format, depending upon the FORM option of the ASSIGN FMS statement. If no ASSIGN FMS statement is specified, then binary input is assumed. 4.The format of the FORTRAN binary file is given in the OUTPUT2 description 5.Factor matrices (forms 4, 5, 10, 11, 13 and 15) cannot be processed by INPUTT2.

INPUTT4 Inputs a matrix from a FORTRAN unit1978 Main Index Reads an ASCII or binary file from a FORTRAN unit and creates a matrix suitable for input to other modules. OUTPUT4 module output may also be used as input. Format: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:INPUTT4 Inputs a matrix from a FORTRAN unit INPUTT4 /M1,M2,M3,M4,M5/NMAT/IUNIT/ITAPE/REFLECT/ UNUSED5/ S,N,HNAME1/S,N,HNAME2/S,N,HNAME3/S,N,HNAME4/S,N,HNAME5$ Mi Matrices NMAT Input -integer -default=1. NMAT is the number of matrices that have been written on the user -supplied unit. Must be less than or equal to 5. If NMAT is 0 then NMAT will be determined automatically. Also, if no matrices are found then System Fatal Message 1222 will not be issued. If NMAT<0 then INPUTT4 module will attempt to input –NMAT matrices without terminating with SFM 1222. IUNIT Input -integer -no default. The value of IUNIT is the FORTRAN unit number on which the user -supplied matrix was written. ITAPE Input -integer -default=-1. ITAPE controls the status of the unit before INPUTT4 tries to extract any matrices as follows: ITAPE Action 0 None. -1 Rewind IUNIT before read. -2 Rewind IUNIT at end. -3 Both.

1979 INPUTT4 Inputs a matrix from a FORTRAN unit Main Index Remarks: 1.Each matrix is read from IUNIT according to its ASSIGN FMS statement, and the BIGMAT as shown in the remarks of the OUTPUT4 description. 2.Each real or complex matrix must have been written on IUNIT according to the format below. For example, in the nonsparse format and binary format (ASSIGN FORM=UNFORMATTED), each matrix could be created (assumed on FORTRAN unit 8) as follows: Record 1-four word record WRITE(8) NCOL,NROW,NF,NTYPE Record 2,3,etc. WRITE(8) ICOL,IROW,NW,(X(I),I=1,NW) If the ASCII format (ASSIGN FORM=FORMATTED) and the nonsparse format is desired, then each matrix must be created as follows: Record 1 WRITE(8,100) NCOL,NROW,NF,NTYPE 100 FORMAT(4I8) Record 2, 3, etc. WRITE(8,200) ICOL,IROW,NW,(X(I),I=1,NW) 200 FORMAT(3I8,(1P,5E16.9)) The format for X(I) above must be (1P,rEw.d), where d is the number of digits in the fractional part, w must be greater than d+7, and r is the integer part of 80/w. The MSC Nastran “util” directory contains a utility subroutine called MAKIDS in a file called mattst.f (or .for) which will write a matrix into the format suitable for INPUTT4. See Building and Using the Sample Programs in the MSC Nastran Utilities Guide .  Zero terms must be explicitly present from the first nonzero in any column to the last nonzero term unless the sparse matrix option is used. Null columns need not be input (they will be properly handled if they are input).REFLECT Input-integer-default=0. Non-zero indicates incoming matrix, if lower triangular, will have its off-diagonal terms “reflected” to generate a full symmetric matrix. This parameter only affects one input matrix per INPUTT4 call. If REFLECT=”i" then the “ith” input matrix will be reflected. If terms are detected in the upper triangle of the input matrix, no action is taken and the matrix is read from the input file as-is. This option is only available for UNFORMATTED file format. UNUSED5 Input -logical -default=FALSE. HNAMEi Output-character-default=’ ‘. The name of the matrix contained in its header on the Fortran unit.

INPUTT4 Inputs a matrix from a FORTRAN unit1980 Main Index 3.The ASSIGN FMS statement is recommended for assigning the FORTRAN unit. Selection of a proper value for IUNIT is machine dependent. If the ASSIGN statement is not provided, then the format of the matrices on IUNIT is assumed to be nonsparse and binary. The ASCII format requires an ASSIGN FMS statement with the FORM = FORMATTED option. Certain FORTRAN units are reserved, see Making File Assignments in the MSC Nastran Installation and Operations Guide or a listing of reserved FORTRAN units. 4.The memory required is from the first nonzero entry in the column to the last nonzero entry. 5.Factor matrices from DECOMP and DCMP (matrix forms 4, 5, 10, 11, 13, and 15) cannot be processed by INPUTT4.

1981 INTERR Generates modal components of base motion from a response spectrum Main Index Generates the modal components of base motion from a response spectrum. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters: Remark: Only FN may be purged, in which case INTERR returns.INTERR Generates modal components of base motion from a response spectrum INTERR CASECC,DIT,DYNAMIC,ZETAH,FN,SPECSEL,PSI/ UHR/ CLOSE/OPTION $ CASECC Table of Case Control command images. DIT Table of TABLEij Bulk Data entry images. DYNAMIC Table of Bulk Data entry images related to dynamics. ZETAH Mass-normalized damping. FN Matrix of natural frequencies (mass normalized stiffness). SPECSEL Response spectra input correlation table. PSI Modal partitioning factor matrix. UHR Modal displacement vector for spectral analysis. CLOSE Input-real-no default. Close natural frequency scale factor. Under the OPTION=‘ABS’ method, close natural frequencies will be summed if the natural frequencies satisfy: fi+1 < CLOSE * fi OPTION Input-character-no default. Response summation method for scaled response spectra analysis only. Possible values are: ‘ABS’ Absolute. ‘SRSS’ Square root of the sum of the squares. ‘NRL’ Naval Research Laboratory (new). ‘NRLO’ Naval Research Laboratory (old).

ISHELL Invokes an external program1982 Main Index Invokes an external program. Format: Input Data Blocks: None. Output Data Blocks: None. Parameters: Remarks: 1.The external program identified by PRGNAME will be passed arguments from MSC Nastran as specified by the ISHELL parameters. The external program can be either a shell script or an executable program. It can either mimic an internal module or provide any user-defined functionality that requires access to MSC Nastran’s data structures. 2.MSC Nastran remains in a “wait” state until the external program is completed.ISHELL Invokes an external program ISHELL //PRGNAME/S,N,IRTN/NOINT/NOREAL/NOCMPX/NOCHAR/ NOUNIT/INT1 /INT2 /INT3 /INT4 / REAL1/REAL2/REAL3/REAL4/ CMPX1/CMPX2/CMPX3/CMPX4/ CHAR1/CHAR2/CHAR3/CHAR4/ IUNIT1/IUNIT2/IUNIT3/IUNIT4 $ PRGNAME Input-character-no default. Name of external program. IRTN Output-integer-default=0. External program return code. -1 indicates failure. NOINT Input-integer-default=0. Number of integer value inputs. NOREAL Input-integer-default=0. Number of real value inputs. NOCMPX Input-integer-default=0. Number of complex value inputs. NOCHAR Input-integer-default=0. Number of character value inputs. NOUNIT Input-integer-default=0. Number of Fortran input units. INTi Input-integers-default=0. Integer values. REALi Input-real-default=-1.0. Real values. CMPXi Input-complex-default=(-1.0,0.0). Complex values. CHARi Input-character-default=‘NULLNULL’. Character values. IUNITi Input-integer-default=0. Fortran unit numbers.

item.title: User's Manual P101
item.description:
1983 ISHELL Invokes an external program Main Index 3.OUTPUT2, OUTPUT4, INPUTT2 and INPUTT4 modules are required to pass tables and/or matrices into the external program. 4.The name of external program must be uppercase and limited to 8 characters. 5.The unit numbers must have associated ASSIGN statements. Based on the ASSIGN statements, the module will automatically pass the physical filenames associated with unit numbers to the external program. These filenames are passed at the positions 31 through 34. 6.Errors encountered in ISHELL will not terminate the MSC Nastran execution. To help debug errors in ISHELL, diagnostic messages may be requested on the nastran command line with “symbol=MSCBGN=ishelln”; where n can be integer value 1 to 9 with 1 giving the lowest level of verboseness and 9 giving the highest. 7.IRTN=-1 indicates a failure during invocation of PRGNAME. It is not related to errors encountered within the invoked script or executable. For example, PRGNAME cannot be found or does not have execute permission. 8.You will need a utility program to parse the arguments for your external program. For example, use set -A argarray “$@” or a similar technique. 9.The FORTIO module must be used with ISHELL to OPEN and CLOSE FORTRAN units referenced by the external program. Example: Invoke user executable DOITPGM: ISHELL //‘DOITPGM’ $

KEXUVEC Computes equivalent loads due to enforced motion1984 Main Index Computes equivalent loads due to enforced motion. Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameters: Remarks: 1.The “x” in the above xDICT, xELM and xJJZ data block names can be any of the following: K Implies stiffness. M Implies mass. B Implies damping KD Implies differential stiffness. KF Implies follower stiffness.KEXUVEC Computes equivalent loads due to enforced motion KEXUVEC GPECT ,XDICT ,XELM ,BGPDT ,SIL , CSTM ,USETD ,YG / PYG /
COLSET /SGNSET $ GPECT Grid point element connection table. XDICT KELM dictionary table. XELM T able of element matrices for stiffness, heat conduction, differential stiffness, or follower stiffness. BGPDT Basic Grid Point Definition Table SIL Scalar index list. CSTM Panel List USETD Degree-of-freedom set membership table for p-set. YG Matrix of enforced motion PYG Equivalent loads due to enforced motion. COLSET Input-character-default=’ ‘. Displacement set used to construct a column partition of xGG. For example, if COLSET=‘M’, then the xGG matrix will have m-set columns and g-set rows. SGNSET Input-character-default=’ ‘. Unused.

1985 KTUPDT Performs tangential stiffness matrix update for nonlinear analysis Main Index Performs tangential stiffness matrix update for nonlinear analysis. Format:KTUPDT Performs tangential stiffness matrix update for nonlinear analysis KTUPDT CASEX, ESTL, MESTNL, CSTMS, MPTS, DITS, GMNEV, ETT, EDT, DEQATN, DEQIND, BGPDTS, GPSNTS, DITID, ESTMG, GRPSTM, MTSTM1, MTSTM2, MTSTM3, MTSTM4, VCCTM, DUPVH, MKELM, MKELMR, N2M, GPECT, SILS, GEOM2S,PMMOFLX, KDICOFLX, KDELOFLX,ACTNODS, MPP, KPPL, ROTORUSE, BGPPF, KCVPPF, BCORPPF, KCNRPPF, USET1X, RGNL, GPLS, GEOM4S, EQEXINS, USETD, USETPS, YSG1, CONTACT, DYNAMICS, PG, PKYG, PBYG, PMYG, YRSG1, USET1V, GMFEV, SLT, DLT0, DLTV, APPLODV, DLT1V, SCSTM, MJJ, GMNV, BPPL1, GPECTS, EST, MPOOL, CPLDIN1, CPLDIN2, HRMSP, EPTS, UPVHY, GPDTS, ECTS, GEOM1S/ KDELML, KDDICTL, KDELMNL, KDDICTNL, MTSTM, MMTXR, MMTX1, NLVECM, GCOMM, KDGG1, KDGGX, KTGG, BGYROPP, KGYROPP, BCORPPX, KCNRPPX, GPLD, USET1Z, GMNZ, SILD,
XUSETD, XDLT, XNLFT, XEQDYN, XAPPLOD, XENFLODK, XENFLODB, XENFLODM, XENFMOTN, XUDEFSFD, XENFMTNR, XGMNE, XGMS, XGMFE, ELDATAH, ZDLT1, GPTT1, ESTLT, DLT1COM, DLT1PRE, KFELM, KFDICT, KFGG, KELMNL, KDICTNL, BELMNL, BDICTNL, BGGNL, K4GGNL, UGNIX, RDEST, RDESTR, RECM, RECMR, RGG, MFEFEZ, BPPL, BPP, KDIOF, KDELF, KPPLZ, S2SCGGNZ, S2SCGGTZ,BGGL1, MUPVNL, UPVNLH, KDFEFE, KDFESNL, KDSSNL, BPPX, KPPT, KPPLX, KFEFE, KFESNL, KSSNL, BFEFE, MMPZ, MSPZ, MBFEPZ, MFEFINVZ/ /DBGLVL/ TSTATOLD/TSTATNEW/NEWP/S,N,NOUE/STEPCUR/LGSET/LPSET/ ////////// //////NLRIGID/ S,N,NORADMAT/LUSETS/TABS/SIGMA/RADMOD/ S,N,MPCF1 /NOOSETX /S,N,NGPSP/1/LGDISP0/ S,N,MSCHGX/NEWK /S,N,GPSP /MSCHG/ S,N,NNEW /S,N,NNEWS/S,N,NNEWM/S,N,MSCHGY/ S,N,ATSPCOLD/RSTRT /RSONLY/ SPCGEN /EPPRT/EPZERO/PRGPST/ LLSET /XAUTOMST / AUTOSPCR /AUTOMSC1 /AUTOMSC2/ STIMEF/‘ROTORID’/‘ROTRSEID’/ NLHEAT/TANALOLD/TANALY/TLSETOLD/ ITIME/S,N,LUSETD/ GNLSTN/DELDBFLG/ASSEMK/LANGLES/S,N,KDFLTGEN/ LOADFACR/FKSYMFAC/N3DCONT/S,N,MSGCNT/LSETID/ PLSETID/NLBUCK/ IANLCHNG/S,N,NLDIFF/NOULNTH/UNUSED/MARCELM/ IRGYRO/GYROTAN/DBGUNIT/ NUMCPLDY/S400S2S /S,N,S2SKPPL /APP /G / W3 /W4 /K6ROT /S,N,MGE /LGDISP / ALPHA2/ S,N,MSCHGX0/CSFLG/ECHG/LNSET/LNESET/ USETPRT/USETSEL/USETSTR1/USETSTR2/ USETSTR3/USETSTR4/FOLLOWK0/ LFESET/FKDIAG/PRDSLV/NOPSET/KDIAG/KDIAGS/MDSTAT/ HTSYMFAC/HTPCONVM/HTSYM/NEWCPLD/ASING/S,N,INITX/ S,N,NRNENC/S,N,OLDM2PP $

KTUPDT Performs tangential stiffness matrix update for nonlinear analysis1986 Main Index Input Data Block: CASEX Subset of CASECC for current STEP case. ESTL Linear element summary table. MESTNL Nonlinear element summary table for matrix update. CSTMS Coordinate system transformation matrices. MPTS Material properties table. DITS Direct input tables. GMNEV Multipoint constraint transformation matrix (m-set by ne-set). ETT Element temperature table. EDT T able used to read RDITER for iterative solver. DEQATN T able of DEQATN for CBUSH1 shock absorber. DEQIND Index table to DEQATN for CBUSH1 shock absorber. BGPDTS Basic grid point definition table. GPSNTS Grid point shell normal table. DITID T able of ID numbers in DIT . ESTMG Advanced nonlinear element connectivity and type data. GRPSTM Advanced nonlinear element group information. MTSTM1 Advanced nonlinear materials data. MTSTM2 Advanced nonlinear materials pointers. MTSTM3 Advanced nonlinear materials flags. MTSTM4 Advanced nonlinear materials dimensioning data. VCCTM Advanced nonlinear VCCT data. DUPVH Displacement increment at the final iteration before exit. MKELM Advanced nonlinear element stiffnesses to be passed to EMG. MKELMR Advanced nonlinear backup-copy of MKELM for bisection. N2M Advanced elements in model. GPECT Grid point element connection table. SILS Scalar index list. GEOM2S T able of bulk data entries related to element connectivity and scalar points. PMMOFLX Element offset processing. KDICOFLX KDELOFLX dictionary table. KDELOFLX T able of element stiffness matrices with updated element offset processing ACTNODS T able of all active nodes. MPP Mass matrix (p-set).

1987 KTUPDT Performs tangential stiffness matrix update for nonlinear analysis Main Index KPPL Stiffness matrix for linear elements (p-set). ROTORUSE Datablock containing rotor RGYRO, RSPINR, RSPINT information. BGPPF Rotor gyroscopic matrix. KCVPPF Circulation matrices due to RAYLEIGH, VISCOUS, and HYBRID (VISCOUS) damping. BCORPPF Family of Coriolis matrices for rotating frame rotor. KCNRPPf Family of centripetal matrices for rotating frame rotor. USET1X One of many USET tables. RGNL Original RG matrix used for LMT transformation. GPLS Grid point list. GEOM4S Constraints, DOF membership and rigid element connectivity table. EQEXINS Equivalence table between external and internal grid/scalar identification numbers for the superelement specified by SEID. USETD Displacement set definition table (p-set). USETPS USET from previous step. YSG1 T otal enforced motion matrix. CONTACT Contact regions specification table. DYNAMICS Table of bulk data entries related to dynamics. PG Static load matrix (g-set). PKYG Matrix of equivalent static loads due to enforced displacement (g-set). PBYG Matrix of equivalent static loads due to enforced velocity (g-set). PMYG Matrix of equivalent static loads due to enforced acceleration (g-set). YRSG1 Matrix of enforced relative displacements (g-set). USET1V USET updated with constraints from upstream superelements. GMFEV Multipoint constraint transformation matrix (m-set by fe-set). SLT Table of static loads. DLT0 Table of dynamic loads from previous loadcase. DLTV Table of dynamic loads. APPLODV Matrix of applied load amplitudes. DLT1V Table of dynamic loads updated for nonlinear analysis. SCSTM Table of global transformation matrices for superelements. MJJ Mass matrix (g-size). GMNV Multipoint constraint transformation matrix. BPPL1 Linear damping matrix

KTUPDT Performs tangential stiffness matrix update for nonlinear analysis1988 Main Index GPECTS Grid point element connection table. MPOOL T able of RADSET, RADLST , and RADMTX Bulk Data entry images. CPLDIN1 Multi-physics input datablock (UPVNLH from other physics). CPLDIN2 Multi-physics input datablock (SILS from other physics). HRMSP Grid point table for Herrmann and/or mDOF heat shell elements. EPTS Element property table. UPVHY T emperature vectors for uncoupled analysis. GPDTS Grid point definition table. ECTS Element connection table. GEOM1S T able of bulk data entries related to geometry.

1989 KTUPDT Performs tangential stiffness matrix update for nonlinear analysis Main Index Output Data Block: KDELML Element Kd-mat for linear elements. KDDICTL Element Kd-mat dictionary for linear elements. KDELMNL Element Kd-mat for non-linear elements. KDDICTNL Element Kd-mat dictionary for non-linear elements. MTSTM Advanced nonlinear ints array, including some materials data. MMTXR Advanced nonlinear element stresses and strains reference state, matching MMTX. MMTX1 Advanced nonlinear element iterative data. NLVECM Advanced nonlinear vectors. GCOMM Advanced nonlinear common blocks. KDGG1 Differential stiffness for linear elements. KDGGX Differential stiffness for nonlinear elements. KTGG Stiffness matrix in g-size. BGYROPP Gyroscopic damping matrix. KGYROPP Gyroscopic stiffness matrix. BCORPPX Family of Coriolis matrices for rotating frame rotor. KCNRPPX Family of centripetal matrices for rotating frame rotor. GPLD External grid/scalar/extra point identification number list. USET1Z USET updated with constraints from upstream superelements. GMNZ Multipoint constraint transformation matrix. SILD Scalar index list ( p-set). XUSETD Degree-of-freedom set membership table (p-set). XDLT Dynamic Loads T able. XNLFT Nonlinear forcing table. XEQDYN Dynamics equivalence internal to external table. XAPPLOD Matrix of applied load amplitudes XENFLODK Matrix of equivalent enforced motion load amplitudes due to stiffness effects. XENFLODB Matrix of equivalent enforced motion load amplitudes due to viscous damping effects XENFLODM Matrix of equivalent enforced motion load amplitudes due to mass effects XENFMOTN Matrix of enforced motion amplitudes XUDEFSFD Auxiliary data for user-defined subroutine for NLRSFD Bulk Data entry. XENFMTNR Matrix of enforced relative displacements (g-set). XGMNE Multipoint constraint transformation matrix (m-set by ne-set). XGMS Multipoint constraint transformation matrix (m-set by s-set).

KTUPDT Performs tangential stiffness matrix update for nonlinear analysis1990 Main Index XGMFE Multipoint constraint transformation matrix (m-set by fe-set). ELDATAH T able of combined nonlinear information data. ZDLT1 T able of dynamic loads updated for nonlinear analysis. GPTT1 Table of grid point temperatures (for transient analysis only). ESTLT Combine ESTL and the temperature load related data from ELDATA. DLT1COM Dynamic load table for follower forces. DLT1PRE T able of previous dynamic loads. KFELM Element FF K-mat for non-linear elements. KFDICT Element FF K-mat dictionary for non-linear elements. KFGG Follower force stiffness. KELMNL Stiffness matrix for nonlinear elements. KDICTNL Element K-mat dictionary for non-linear elements. BELMNL Element B-mat for non-linear elements. BDICTNL Element B-mat dictionary for non-linear elements. BGGNL Nonlinear damping matrix. K4GGNL Nonlinear material stiffness for structural damping. UGNIX Displacement matrix at converged step (g-set). RDEST Radiation element summary table. RDESTR Total RDEST. RECM Radiation exchange coefficient matrix. RECMR T otal RECM. RGG Radiation transfer matrix. MFEFEZ Mass matrix (or radiation matrix for heat transfer), (fe-set). BPPL Damping matrix, or heat capacitance matrix, for linear elements (p-set). BPP Damping matrix, or heat capacitance matrix (p-set). KDIOF Element offset processing. KDELF Matrix of element force for offset. KPPLZ Stiffness matrix for linear elements (p-set). S2SCGGNZ Normal constraint Matrix of segment-to-segment glued contact in g-size. S2SCGGTZ T angential constraint Matrix of segment-to-segment glued contact in g-size. BGGL1 Damping matrix (g-set). MUPVNL Solution matrix from nonlinear response analysis for matrix update (p-set). UPVNLH Solution matrix from nonlinear analysis (p-set). KDFEFE Sum of differential stiffness and follower stiffness (fe-set).

1991 KTUPDT Performs tangential stiffness matrix update for nonlinear analysis Main Index Parameters:KDFESNL Partition of KDFEFE (fe-set by s-set). KDSSNL Partition of KDFEFE (s-set by s-set). BPPX Damping matrix, or heat capacitance matrix (p-set). KPPT Tangential Stiffness (p-set). KPPLX Stiffness matrix for linear elements (p-set). KFEFE Tangential stiffness (fe-set). KFESNL Stiffness matrix due to enforced motion YS (fe-set). KSSNL Stiffness matrix due to enforced motion YS (s-set). BFEFE Damping matrix, or heat capacitance matrix (fe-set). MMPZ Mass matrix (m-set by p-set). MSPZ Mass matrix (s-set by p-set). MBFEPZ Updated mass matrix (fe-set by p-set). MFEFINVZ Inverse of mass matrix (fe-set). DBGLVL Input-integer-default=0. Debug print level. TSTATOLD Input-integer-default=-1. Same as TSTATNEW but for previous STEP . NEWP Output-integer-default=0. New SUBCASE or STEP case FLAG. -1 Current case has not been completed. 1 Current case has been completed. NOUE Input-integer-default=0. USET existence flag. STEPCUR Input-integer-no default. Current STEP case number in current SUBCASE. This value is initialized at the beginning of each SUBCASE. LGSET Input-character. Name of the g-set including Lagrange multipliers. LPSET Input-character. Name of the p-set including Lagrange multipliers. NLRIGID Input-integer-default=0. Lagrangian rigid elements existence flag.

0 Lagrangian elements exist. <1 Lagrangian elements do not exist. NORADMAT Input-integer-default=0. Radiation flag. -2 No radiation -1 Initial radiation 1 Single band radiation with constant emissivity. 2 Radiation with temperature dependent emissivity. 3 Multiple band radiation with constant emissivity.

KTUPDT Performs tangential stiffness matrix update for nonlinear analysis1992 Main Index LUSETS Input-integer-default=0. The number of degrees-of-freedom in the g-set of the current superelement. TABS Input-real-default=0.0. Absolute temperature conversion. For example, set to 273.16 when specifying temperatures in Celsius or 459.69 in Fahrenheit. SIGMA Input-real-default=0.0. The Stefan-Boltzmann constant. Used to compute radiant heat flux. RADMOD Input-character-default =YES. Modify radiation matrix to avoid temperature overshoot. MPCF1 Input-integer-default=-1. OAPWR1 generation flag. +1 OAPWR1 is generated. -1 OAPWR1 is not generated. NOOSETX Input-integer-no default. Number of degrees-of-freedom in the o-set or omitted degree-of-freedom flag. Set to -1 if there are none. NGPSP Input-integer-default=0. GPSP module execution counter. LGDISP0 Input/output-integer-default=0. Large displacement and follower force flag. -1 No large displacement and follower force effects will be considered. 1 Large displacement and follower force effects will be considered. 2 Only large displacement effects will be considered. MSCHGX Input-integer-default=0. MPC or SPC change flag. NEWK Input/output-integer-default=0. Stiffness update flag. -1 Do not update stiffness.

0 Update stiffness and represents the number of consecutive time steps which have shown divergence. If this number reaches 5, the solution process is terminated. GPSP Input-logical-default =false. Grid point singularity processing. MSCHG Input-integer-default=-1 . Boundary condition change flag. ≤ 0 No change 0 changed NNEW Input-integer. The number of new m-set and s-set degrees-of-freedom NNEWS Input-integer. The number of new s-set degrees-of-freedom. NNEWM Input-integer. The number of new m-set degrees-of-freedom. MSCHGY Input-integer-default=0. MPC or SPC change flag. ATSPCOLD Output-character-default=’ ‘. Previous value of AUTOSPC. RSTRT Input-integer-default=-1. Restart flag. ≤ 0 Cold start. = 1 Restart

1993 KTUPDT Performs tangential stiffness matrix update for nonlinear analysis Main Index RSONLY Input-logical-no default. Residual structure only flag. FALSE Superelements are specified. TRUE Superelements are not specified. SPCGEN Input-integer-default=0. SPC Bulk Data entry punch flag. If set to >0, then singularities identified are written to the PUNCH file as SPC Bulk Data entries. EPPRT Input-real-default=0.0. Singularity print parameter. Singularities greater than EPPRT will not be printed if PRGPST=‘YES’. EPZERO Input-real-default=1.E-8. Singularity test parameter. Singularities greater than EPZERO will not be constrained. PRGPST Input-character-default=‘YES’. Singularity summary print flag. If set to ‘YES’, then the summary is printed. LLSET Input-character. Name of the l-set including Lagrange multipliers. XAUTOMST Input-character. AUTOMSET selection flag. If YES, then the dependent degree-of- freedom specifications on MPC and rigid element Bulk Data entries will be rearranged to avoid exclusive DOF set conflicts. Usually input by user parameter. AUTOSPCR Input-character-default=NO. Requests that stiffness singularities and near singularities be automatically constrained after all residual SPC and MPC constraints are processed. AUTOMSC1 Input-real-default=10.0. Scaling value for AUTOMSET. AUTOMSC2 Input-real-default=0.01. LMT transformation. STIMEF Output-real-default=0.0. Time to update follower stiffness. NLHEAT Input-logical-default =false. Heat transfer analysis flag. TANALOLD Input-character-default=’ ‘. Analysis type of previous step. TANALY Input-character-default=’ ‘. Type of nonlinear analysis. ‘NLTR’ Nonlinear transient ‘NLST’ Nonlinear statics ‘LNST’ Linear statics ‘STATICS’ SOL 101 Linear statics TLSETOLD Output-integer-default=0. Previous TEMPERATURE(LOAD or BOTH) set identification. ITIME Input-real-default=0.0. Initial time step at the beginning of a current STEP case. LUSETD Input-integer-default=0. The number of degrees-of-freedom in the p-set. GNLSTN Input-integer-no default. Geometric nonlinear strain flag. Usually input by user parameter. 0 Small strain 1 Green strain

KTUPDT Performs tangential stiffness matrix update for nonlinear analysis1994 Main Index DELDBFLG Input-integer-default=0. Datablock deletion flag. ASSEMK Input-integer-default=0. Flag used in conjunction with CASI solver that determines whether the older technique of having assembled global stiffness matrix and partitions present or the new technique of having only element matrices available is used during LMT operations. If ASSEMK<0, assembled matrices are available. LANGLES Input-integer-default=1. Large rotation calculation method. 1 Gimbal angle 2 Left rotation vector 3 Right rotation vector KDFLTGEN Input-integer-default=0. Filtered differential stiffness matrix flag. LOADFACR Input-real-default=1.0. Load factor in nonlinear static analysis. Same as LOADFAC except real. FKSYMFAC Input-real-default=1.0. Follower stiffness symmetry actor tolerance. Usually input by user parameter. N3DCONT Input-integer. N3Dcont=-1 if BCONTACT exists. MSGCNT Input-integer. The maximum number of the same error message to be printed. LSETID Input-integer-default=0. LOAD set ID. PLSETID Input-integer-default=0. Previous LOAD set ID. NLBUCK Input-integer. Nonlinear Buckling flag. IANLCHNG Input-integer-default=0. Analysis chaining type. NLDIFF Input-integer-default=0. Flag to determine whether the differential stiffness matrix and follower force stiffness are to be computed for nonlinear elements NOULNTH Input-integer-default=0. ULNTH presence flag. MARCELM Input-logical-default =false. Flag for the presence of advanced nonlinear elements in the analysis. IRGYRO Input-integer-default=0. ID of the RGYRO entry. GYROTAN Input-integer-default=-1. Control flag for gyroscopic terms in nonlinear transient rotordynamic analysis. Default is to include gyroscope effects. DBGUNIT Input-integer-default=6. Debug output unit number. NUMCPLDY Input-integer-default=1. Number of multi-physics passes in subcase. S400S2S Input-logical-default =false. Signal of SOL400. S2SKPPL Input-logical-default =false. Segment-to-segment p-set stiffness flag.

1995 KTUPDT Performs tangential stiffness matrix update for nonlinear analysis Main Index APP Input-character-no default. Analysis type. Allowable types are: ‘STATICS’ Linear statics ‘REIG’ Normal modes ‘FREQRESP’ Frequency repsonse ‘TRANRESP’ T ransient response ‘NLST’ Nonlinear static G,W3,W4 Input/output-real-default=0. Scale factors for use in preparing damping matrix (CASI). K6ROT Input-real. Scaling factor of the penalty stiffness to be added to the normal rotation for QUAD4 and TRIA3. MGE Input/output-integer-default=0. Multiple structural damping flag. for PSHELL, PBUSH and PBUSHT property entries. LGDISP Input-integer-default=0. Large displacement flag input by user. ALPHA2 Output-real. Scale factor for stiffness portion of Rayleigh damping. MSCHGX0 MSCHGX Input-integer-default=0. MPC or SPC change flag. CSFLG Input-integer-default=0. Coupled solution control flag. ECHG Input-logical-default=false. Parameter that indicates whether the UE-set length has changed. LNSET Input-character. Name of the n-set including Lagrange multipliers. LNESET Input-character. Name of the ne-set including Lagrange multipliers. USETPRT Input-integer-default=-1. Controls the tabular printout of the structural DOF sets. USETSEL Input-integer-default=0. Specifies the sets which will be printed in the row sort. USETSTR1 Input-character-default’ ‘. Specifies the sets that will be printed by the specification of parameters USETPRT and USETSEL. USETSTR2 Input-character-default’ ‘. Specifies the sets that will be printed by the specification of parameters USETPRT and USETSEL. USETSTR3 Input-character-default’ ‘. Specifies the sets that will be printed by the specification of parameters USETPRT and USETSEL. USETSTR4 Input-character-default’ ‘. Specifies the sets that will be printed by the specification of parameters USETPRT and USETSEL. FOLLOWK0 Input-Integer. Follower force stiffness parameter. LFESET Input-character. Name of the fe-set including Lagrange multipliers. FKDIAG Input-integer-default=0. Follower stiffness null diagonal flag. Similar to KDIAG. PRDSLV Input-integer-default=0. Control flag for Pardiso solver.

KTUPDT Performs tangential stiffness matrix update for nonlinear analysis1996 Main Index NOPSET Input-integer-default=0. P-set existence flag. KDIAG Input-real-default=-1.0. Eliminates spurious mechanisms and singularities in the nonlinear stiffness matrix. KDIAGS Input-integer-default. Local saved value of KDIAG. MDSTAT Input-logical-default=false. DOMAINSOLVER STAT flag. HTSYMFAC Input-real-default=0.0. Heat transfer matrix symmetrization coefficient. HTPCONVM Input-integer-default=0. Heat transfer matrix symmetrization flag. HTSYM Input-integer-default=0. Controls the decomposition method for SOL 400 thermal analysis. NEWCPLD Input-integer-default=0. Flag to indicate change in multi-physics pass. 0 No change 1 Change in Physics ASING Input-integer-default=0. Specifies the action to take when singularities (null rows and columns) exist in static or dynamic matrices. INITX Input-logical-default=false. Flag for the presence of mass matrix. NRNENC Output-integer. Set to -1 if the number of null rows does not equal the number of null columns. OLDM2PP Input-integer-default=0. M2PP direct mass input in case control.

1997 LAMX Eigenvalue Table Editor Main Index Modifies, creates, or converts to matrices the LAMA (real eigenvalues) and CLAMA (complex eigenvalues) tables. Formats: Modify LAMA: Create LAMA from a matrix: Convert LAMA into a matrix: Create CLAMA from a matrix: Convert CLAMA into a matrix: Generate new LAMA table based on diagonals of a stiffness and mass matrix: Input Data Blocks:LAMX Eigenvalue Table Editor LAMX EMAT, LAMA/LAMAX/NLAM/RESFLG $ LAMX FREQMASS,/LAMA/NLAM/RESFLG $ LAMX ,,LAMA/LMAT/-1/RESFLG $ LAMX CLAMMAT,/CLAMA/-1 $ LAMX ,,CLAMA/CLAMMAT/-2 $ LAMX KXX,MXX/LAMAX,LAMMAT/-3/RESFLG /IMPFID/FLUID $ EMAT Matrix of editing parameters. See Remark 1. LAMA Normal modes eigenvalue summary table. FREQMASS Matrix of frequencies and generalized masses. See Remark 2. CLAMA Complex eigenvalue summary table. CLAMMAT Diagonal matrix with complex eigenvalues on the diagonal. KXX Stiffness matrix in any set. Usually generalized. MXX Mass matrix in any set. Usually generalized.

LAMX Eigenvalue Table Editor1998 Main Index Output Data Blocks: Parameters: Remarks: 1.The EMAT matrix has three rows and one column for each mode which are used to modify the frequency and generalized mass. If then the frequency

and generalized mass LAMAX Modified LAMA table. LAMA Normal modes eigenvalue summary table created from FREQMASS. LMAT Normal modes eigenvalue summary table converted to a matrix. See Remark 3. CLAMMAT Diagonal matrix with complex eigenvalues on the diagonal. LAMMAT Diagonal matrix with real eigenvalues on the diagonal. NLAM Integer-input-default=0. The maximum number of modes in the output data block LAMAX. If NLAM = 0, the number of modes in LAMAX will be the same as that of LAMA or FREQMASS. If NLAM = -1, the matrix LMAT is produced instead. RESFLG Integer-input-default=0. Subheading print flag used by the OFP module for residual vector eigenvalues. 1 Print “BEFORE AUGMENTATION OF RESIDUAL VECTORS". 2 Print “AFTER AUGMENTATION OF RESIDUAL VECTORS”. 0 No print. IMPFID Input-integer-default=0. Imperfection ID. FLUID Input-logical-default=false. TRUE if fluid eigensolution. R1j R2j R3j3Number of Modes R3j0 f j0 m j0

1999 LAMX Eigenvalue Table Editor Main Index will be extracted from LAMA and modified accordingly: •Frequency: Fixed shift: Fractional change: •Generalized mass: Then eigenvalue, radians, and generalized stiffness are based on the modified frequency and generalized mass: radians: eigenvalue: generalized stiffness: If , then mode j is not copied to LAMAX. If , and , then mode j is copied from LAMA to LAMAX without modification. 2.The FREQMASS matrix has three rows and one column for each mode. The first row contains the frequencies and the third row contains the generalized masses. The second row is null. Then eigenvalue, radians, and generalized stiffness are computed as in Remark 3. 3.In the LMAT matrix each row corresponds to a mode. Each column corresponds to eigenvalue, radians, frequency, generalized mass, and generalized stiffness.fjRij1.0R2j+ fj0+ = R1jshift and R2j1.0– = = R1j0.0 and R2jfraction = = mjR3jif R3j0  mj0if R3= 0  = j2fj= jj2= Kjjmj= R3j1–= R1j0= R2j0= R3j0= fj 0.0 mjNumber of Modes 3

LAMX Eigenvalue Table Editor2000 Main Index 4.Under NLAM=-3: a.The frequency is computed: b.KXX and MXX may be vectors. c.If a diagonal in MXX is null then the corresponding entry in LAMA table will be null. d.If MXX is purged then an identity matrix is assumed. e.If KXX is purged the module returns with no output. f.LAMAX or LAMMAT may be purged. Examples: 1.For LAMA (real) tables: Assume that 10 modes are defined in the LAMA table. It is now desired to modify the frequency data of the LAMA table in the following way: Mode(s) Desired Modification DMl Format for EMAT 1 through 3 none — 4 multiply by 0.8 DMI,EMAT,4,2,-0.2 5 none — 6 delete DMI,EMAT,6,3,-1.0 7 replace by 173.20 DMI,EMAT,7,1,173.20,-1.0 8 replace by 2.98 DMI,EMAT,8,3,2.98 9 none — 10 delete DMI,EMAT,10,3,-1.0iifiMiki ·
·
·
· Number of Modes5 Freq 0.5 Pi diag (KXX) diag (MXX)———————————- = f4 f7 m8

2001 LAMX Eigenvalue Table Editor Main Index The DMI header record entry is also required: DMI,EMAT,0,2,1,1,,3,10 The DMAP is: DMIIN DMI,DMINDX/EMAT,,,,,,,,, $ LAMX EMAT,LAMA/LAMB/9 $ EQUIVX LAMB/LAMA/ALWAYS $ Create a LAMB table with f j = 10.0, 20,0, 30.0, 40, and m j = 1.0, 1.0, 1.0, 2.0. DMI, FREQMASS, 0, 2, 1, 1, , 3, 4 DMI, FREQMASS, 1, 1, 10.0, 00, 1.0 DMI, FREQMASS, 2, 1, 20.0, 0.0, 1.0 DMI, FREQMASS, 3, 1, 30.0, 0.0, 1.0 DMI, FREQMASS, 4, 1, 40.0, 0.0, 2.0 The DMAP is: DMIIN DMI,DMINDX/,,,,,,,,,$ LAMX FREQMASS,/LAMB $ OFP LAMB//$ Generate a matrix LMAT from a LAMA table. The DMAP is: LAMX, ,LAMA/LMAT/-1 $ 2.For CLAMA (complex) tables: Create a CLAMA table with eigenvalues -1.0, -1.0, -2.0, -2.0, and -3.0, +1.0. The DMI data for CLAMMAT would be: DMI, CLAMMAT, 0,6,3,3, ,3,3 DMI, CLAMMAT, 1,1,-1.0,-1.0 DMI, CLAMMAT, 2,2, -2.0, -2.0 DMI, CLAMMAT, 3,3, -3.0, +1.0 The DMAP is: DMIIN DMI,DMINDX/CLAMMAT,,,,,,,,,/$ LAMX CLAMMAT,/CLAMB/-1 $ Generate a matrix CLAMMAT from a CLAMA table. The DMAP is: LAMX, ,CLAMA/CLAMMAT/-2 $

LCGEN Expands Case Control table based on LSEQ Bulk Data entries2002 Main Index Expands the Case Control table based on LSEQ Bulk Data entries. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters:LCGEN Expands Case Control table based on LSEQ Bulk Data entries LCGEN CASECC,SLT,ETT,DYNAMIC,GEOM4/ CASESX/ NSKIP/APP $ CASECC T able of Case Control command images. SLT T able of static loads. ETT Element temperature table. DYNAMIC T able of Bulk Data entry images related to dynamics without DAREA entry images. LCGEN reads the RLOADi and TLOADi records to determine unique DAREA identification numbers. GEOM4 T able of Bulk Data entry images related to constraints, degree-of-freedom membership and rigid element connectivity. LCGEN matches the SPCD and SPC identification numbers with TLOADi and RLOADi images for possible enforced motion. CASESX Expanded Case Control table. NSKIP Input-integer-default=0. Subcase record number to read in CASECC for the LOADSET set identification number. APP Input-character-no default. Analysis type. Specifies which records to use in creating equivalent static loads from dynamic loads. Allowable types are: blank Not dynamics. ‘FREQRESP’ Frequency response – use RLOADi record. ‘TRANRESP’ T ransient response – use TLOADi record. ‘REIG’ Real eigenvalue analysis – use both RLOADi and TLOADi record.

item.title: User's Manual P102
item.description:
2003 LCNTSTAT Monitors and controls the child process in linear contact solution Main Index Monitors and controls the child process in linear contact solution. Format: Input Data Blocks: None Output Data Block: None Parameters: Remarks: None.LCNTSTAT Monitors and controls the child process in linear contact solution LCNTSTAT LCNTSTAT //RETVAL $ RETVAL Input integer default =0, return value of the linear contact solution.

LCNTSTAT Monitors and controls the child process in linear contact solution2004 Main Index

2005 M3DCONT1 Data preparation for contact Main Index MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Prepares contact data for contact, including the glued contact. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks:M3DCONT1 Data preparation for contact M3DCONT1 CASECC, CONTACT, GEOM1, GEOM2, GEOM4, EPT, BGPDT, CSTM, MPT, DIT, HRMSP, ACGINFO, TRNB2G ,EDT,GEOM2O/ ACTNOD, OGEOM1, OGEOM2, OFCON3D, OCONTACT, OUGSTRS0, OCNTCHK0, OBCNURB0 ,OFPMDPOS / S,N,C3DFLG/UNUSED1/UNUSED2/UNUSED3/MRCMSG1/ MRCMSG5/MRCREVR/HEXIST/WRSTPHY /LGDISP/IFMPFID / MODID/S,N,NPAIR $ CASECC Table of Case Control commands CONTACT Table of Bulk Data entry images related to contact GEOM1 Table of Bulk Data entry images related to geometry GEOM2 Table of Bulk Data entry images related to element connectivity and scalar points GEOM4 Table of Bulk Data entry images related to constraints, degree-of-freedom membership and rigid element connectivity EPT Element property table BGPDT Basic grid point definition table CSTM Table of coordinate system transformation matrices MPT Material property table DIT Table of TABLEij Bulk Data entry images HRMSP Table of Herrmann elements’ Scalar Points ACGINFO Automatic Contact Table TRNB2G T ransformation Matrix from Basic Coordinate to Global Coordinate EDT Table of EDT datablock GEOM2O The original geom2 datablock, GEOM2 is the datablock with some shell normal may be adjusted by module MCNGBCSF . ACTNOD Table of contact data, including active contact nodes and the glued contact information OGEOM1 Updated GEOM1 table OGEOM2 Updated GEOM2 table

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Data preparation for contact2006 Main Index Parameters:OFCON3D T able of initial contact status information OCONTACT T able of contact pairs if BCONTAT=AUTO OUGSTRS0 OUG-type table of geometry adjustment by initial stress-free contact OCNTCHK0 OUG-type table of contact check of active nodes status and distance OBCNURB0 T able of analytical contact surface spline OFPMDPOS OFP data position data for modules C3DFLG Input/output-integer-no default. As input:
C3DFLG=0; SOL 101 or SOL 400; C3DFLG=1; Other solutions that run the glued contact. As output: C3DFLG=0; No contact is activated C3DFLG=-1; Contact is activated UNUSED1 Input-integer-default=0. Unused UNUSED2 Input-character-default=’PEID’. Unused UNUSED3 Input-integer-default=-1. Unused MRCMSG1 Input-integer-default=0. Contact debugging parameter for touching, sliding and separations of contact grids MRCMSG5 Input-integer-default=0. Contact debugging parameter for touching, sliding and separations of contact grids plus Marc T19 file MRCREVR Input-integer-default=0. Rigid body surface modification flag HEXIST Input-logical-no default. Flag for adaptive meshing WRSTPHY Input-integer-no default. Multi-physics flag LGDISP Input-integer-default=-1. User input Large Displacement IFMPFID Input-integer-default=0. Imperfection ID. MODID Input-integer-default=0. Module ID, used only when modules are present NPAIR Output-integer-default=0. Number of pairs detected, used by automatic contact generation.

2007 MAKAEFA Extracts data specified on AEDW, AEPRESS and AEFORCE Bulk Data entries Main Index Extracts data specified on the AEDW, AEPRESS and AEFORCE Bulk Data entries that reference UXVEC, DMIJ and DMIK Bulk Data entries. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks:MAKAEFA Extracts data specified on AEDW, AEPRESS and AEFORCE Bulk Data entries MAKAEFA EDT,MATPOOL,AECTRL,AEBGPDTJ*,AEBGPDTI*,AEBGPDTK*/ AEDWIDX,UXVW,AEDW,AEIDW,AEPRSIDX,UXVP,AEPRE, AEIPRE,AEFIDX,UXVF,AEFRC/ MACHNO/SYMXZ/SYMXY /DUBLAT $ EDT Table of Bulk Data entry images related to aerodynamics. MATPOOL Table of Bulk Data entry images containing DMIJ, DMIJI and DMIK entries. AECTRL Table of aeroelastic model controls. AEBGPDTJ* Family of basic grid point definition tables for the js-set aerodynamic degrees of freedom. AEBGPDTI* Family of basic grid point definition tables for the interference js-set aerodynamic degrees of freedom. AEBGPDTK* Family of basic grid point definition tables for the ks-set aerodynamic degrees of freedom. AEDWIDX Index to the AEDW tables. UXVW Matrix of UXVEC vectors defined by the AEDW Bulk Data entries. AEDW Matrix of downwash vectors contained on DMIJ Bulk Data entries referenced by the AEDW entries. AEIDW Matrix of interference downwash vectors contained on DMIJ Bulk Data entries referenced by the AEDW entries. AEPRSIDX Index to the AEPRESS tables. UXVP Matrix of UXVEC vectors defined by the AEPRESS Bulk Data entries. AEPRE Matrix of pressure vectors contained on DMIJ Bulk data entries referenced by the AEPRESS entries. AEIPRE Matrix of interference pressure vectors contained on DMIJ Bulk data entries referenced by the AEPRESS entries. AEFIDX Index to the AEFORCE tables.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Extracts data specified on AEDW, AEPRESS and AEFORCE Bulk Data entries2008 Main Index Parameters: Remarks: None.UXVF Matrix of UXVEC vectors defined by the AEFORCE Bulk Data entries. AEFRC Matrix of force vectors contained on DMIK Bulk data entries referenced by the AEFORCE entries. MACH Input-real-no default. Mach number. SYMXZ Input-integer-no default. Aerodynamic x-z symmetry flag. SYMXY Input-integer-no default. Aerodynamic x-y symmetry flag. DUBLAT Input- logical-d efault = TRUE, on input set to TRUE if there are internal aerodynamics and FALSE if there are only external aerodynamics.

2009 MAKAEFS Generates an index and associated matrices Main Index Generates an index and the associated matrices based on the AEFORCE Bulk Data entry with MESH=‘STRUCT’. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters: Remarks: None.MAKAEFS Generates an index and associated matrices MAKAEFS EDT,AECRTL,SLT,PG/ AEDBIDX,UXVST,PGVST,PVPERQ/ MACH/SYMXZ/SYMXY $ EDT Table of Bulk Data entry images related to aerodynamics. AECTRL Table of aeroelastic model controls. SLT Table of static loads. PG Static load matrix for the g-set. AEDBIDX Index table consisting of the triples. UXVST Aerodynamic extra point displacement matrix. PGVST Static load vector matrix (g-set). PVPERQ Partitioning vector for the V columns of PGVST into those to be scaled by Q (=1) and those that are absolute (=0). MACH Input-real-no default. Mach number. SYMXZ Input-integer-no default. Aerodynamic x-z symmetry flag. SYMXY Input-integer-no default. Aerodynamic x-y symmetry flag.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Creates hinge moment (HM) monitor points2010 Main Index Creates hinge moment (HM) monitor points and merges with previously defined monitor points if present. Also generates a new full vehicle (COEF) monitor point. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters: Remarks: None.MAKAEMON Creates hinge moment (HM) monitor points MAKAEMON AERO,EDT,AEMONOLD/ AEMONPT,MONITOR/ AECONFIG $ AERO T able of control information for aerodynamic analysis. EDT Element deformation table. Contains aerodynamic model records, specifically AESURF and AESURFS. AEMONOLD T able of HM monitor points. AEMONPT T able of aerodynamic monitor points (COEF and HM only). MONITOR T able of structural monitor points (COEF and HM only). AECONFIG Input-character-default=‘REFCSTOT’. Aerodynamic configuration.

2011 MAKCOMP Extracts components from EDT Main Index Extract components from EDT and merge with previously defined components if OLDCMP is present. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters: Remarks: None. Remarks: None.MAKCOMP Extracts components from EDT MAKCOMP EDT,AECOMP,AECMPOLD/ / MESH $ EDT Element deformation table. Contains aerodynamic model records, specifically monitor and component input. AECOMP Aerodynamic component definition table (CAEROi Bulk Data entries). AECMPOLD Previously generated AECOMP . AEROCOMP Table of aerodynamic components when MESH=‘AERO’. STRUCOMP Table of structural components when MESH=‘STRU’. MESH Input-character-no default. Mesh type.AEROCOMP STRUCOMP   

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Reads the IFPDAT and creates IBULK(s) with path HBULK2012 Main Index Reads the IFPDAT and creates IBULK(s) with path HBULK. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters:MAKEBULK Reads the IFPDAT and creates IBULK(s) with path HBULK MAKEBULK IFPDAT,IFPFLAG/ HBULK/ S,N,NOGOBULK/DDLNAME/QUAL1/QUAL2/MODNAME/KEY $ IFPDAT File containing all Bulk Data entries. IFPFLAG Family of tables of post-NEWIFP module execution flags and errors for each instance of Bulk Data sections instantiated by BEGIN keyword=value Case Control statement. HBULK NDDL data block with path HBULK=BULKNAM,IBULK NOGOBULK Output-logical-default=FALSE. Error flag. Set to TRUE if error encountered. DDLNAME Input-character-default=’IBULK*’. NDDL name of the output data block HBULK QUAL1 Input-character-default=’BULKNAME’. First qualifier in HBULK’s path. QUAL2 Input-character-default=’BULKID’. Second qualifier in HBULK’s path. KEY Input-integer-default=0. Path ID within the IFPFLAG data block. 0 : A family of HBULK will be created

0 : One HBULK is created with path ID=KEY MODNAME Input-character-default=’ ’. Name of the module where a selective HBULK needs to be created. If blank (default), then all records are written to HBULK. If MODNAME=’BDRYINFO’, the following records, if they exist, are written to HBULK: ACCSSPT , CORD2C, CORD2R, CORD2S, GRID, QSET1, QSET

2013 MAKEKOF Make tables from static forces and moments of rotor Kink and Offset Main Index To convert static forces and moments from Kink and Offset to DAREA and RLOAD1 bulk data entries for rotordynamics analysis. This module is used in SOL 400 after the first STEP has done the NLSTATIC analysis. DLT and DYNAMICS tables will be updated. CASECC table may also be updated if DLOAD case control did not exist. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters:MAKEKOF Make tables from static forces and moments of rotor Kink and Offset MAKEKOF DLT, DYNAMICS, CASECC, TRANSROT, KOFORCES, CSTM, BGPDT/ DLTnew, DYNAMICn, CASEnew/ s,n,xDLT/ s,n,xDYNAMIC/ s,n,xCASECC/FILTER $ DLT Dynamic Load Table DYNAMICS Dynamic Data Table, includes 3-D rotor definitions. CASECC Case Control T able for the current STEP . KOFORCES Matrix containing the static forces created in STEP 1 of kink and offset analysis. TRANSROT A table related to ROTBENT entry, with one record of transformation matrices and another record with rotor grids. CSTM Coordinate System T ransformation Matrices. BGPDT Basic Grid Point Definition Table DLTnew Updated DLT table DYNAMICn Updated DYNAMICS table. CASEnew Updated CASECC table. xDLT Output-logical. A flag to indicate whether DLT has been modified or not. It’s TRUE if DLTnew is created. xDYNAMIC Output-logical. A flag to indicate whether DYNAMICS has been modified or not. It is TRUE if DYNAMICn is created. xCASECC Output-logical. A flag to indicate whether CASECC has been modified or not. It is TRUE if CASEnew is created. FILTER Input-integer-default=1.E-8. Filter used to remove small terms in the load when creating DAREA entries.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Converts tables from pre-Version 69 to Version 69 (or greater) format2014 Main Index Converts tables from their pre-Version 69 format to their Version 69 (or greater) format. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters: Remarks: 1.The allowable values for NEWNAMi and OLDNAMi are:MAKENEW Converts tables from pre-Version 69 to Version 69 (or greater) format MAKENEW OLDDB1,OLDDB2,OLDDB3,OLDDB4,OLDDB5/ NEWDB1,NEWDB2,NEWDB3,NEWDB4,NEWDB5/ OLDNAM1/OLDNAM2/OLDNAM3/OLDNAM4/OLDNAM5/ NEWNAM1/NEWNAM2/NEWNAM3/NEWNAM4/NEWNAM5 $ OLDDBi Output table in pre-Version 69 format. See Remarks. NEWDBi Input table in the current version’s format. See Remarks. OLDNAMi Input-character-default=’ ‘. The generic name of the corresponding output; e.g., OLDNAM3 corresponds to OLDDB3, etc. See Remarks. NEWNAMi Input-character-default=’ ‘. The generic name of the corresponding input table; e.g., NEWNAM3 corresponds to NEWDB3, etc. See Remarks. AXIC T able of axisymmetric and fluid Bulk Data entries. BGPDT Basic grid point definition table. CSTM T able of coordinate system transformation matrices. EPT T able of element properties. EQEXIN Equivalence table between external and internal grid/scalar identification numbers. EST Element summary table. GEOM1 T able of Bulk Data entry images related to geometry. GEOM2 T able of element connectivity. GEOM3 T able of static loads. GEOM4 T able of degree-of-freedom set assignments. GPDT Grid point definition table.

2015 MAKENEW Converts tables from pre-Version 69 to Version 69 (or greater) format Main Index 2.The inputs, outputs, and parameters can be specified in any order as long as the parameters are in the same positions as their respective inputs or outputs. For example, the following specifications are equivalent. MAKENEW GEOM1,AXIC,,,/NGEOM1,NAXIC,,,/ ‘GEOM1’/‘AXIC’///‘GEOM1’/‘AXIC’ $ MAKENEW AXIC,GEOM1,,,/NAXIC,NGEOM1,,,/ ‘AXIC’/‘GEOM1’///‘AXIC’/‘GEOM1’ $ 3.In order to create BGPDT, EST, and CSTM, MAKENEW requires multiple inputs. For example, MAKENEW BGPDT,EQEXIN,SIL,GPL,/NBGPDT,,,,/ ‘BGPDT’/‘EQEXIN’/‘SIL’/‘GPL’//‘BGPDT’ $ MAKENEW EST,EQEXIN,SIL,,,/NEST,,,,/ ‘EST’/‘EQEXIN’/‘SIL’///‘EST’ $ MAKENEW CSTM,EQEXIN,GPL,,,/NCSTM,,,,/ ‘CSTM’/‘EQEXIN’/‘GPL’///‘CSTM’ $ 4.The generation of the new data organization on 32 bit platforms does not increase the precisional values of the data items. 5.Heat transfer in EST cannot be processed by MAKENEW.GPL External grid/scalar point identification number list. SIL Scalar index list.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Converts tables from Version 69 (or greater) to pre-Version 69 format2016 Main Index Converts tables from their Version 69 (or greater) format to their pre-Version 69 format. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters: Remarks: 1.The allowable values for NEWNAMi and OLDNAMi are:MAKEOLD Converts tables from Version 69 (or greater) to pre-Version 69 format MAKEOLD NEWDB1,NEWDB2,NEWDB3,NEWDB4,NEWDB5/ OLDDB1,OLDDB2,OLDDB3,OLDDB4,OLDDB5/ NEWNAM1/NEWNAM2/NEWNAM3/NEWNAM4/NEWNAM5/ OLDNAM1/OLDNAM2/OLDNAM3/OLDNAM4/OLDNAM5 $ NEWDBi Input table in the current version’s format. See Remarks. OLDDBi Output table in pre-Version 69 format. See Remarks. NEWNAMi Input-character-default=’ ‘. The generic name of the corresponding input table; e.g., NEWNAM3 corresponds to NEWDB3, etc. See Remarks. OLDNAMi Input-character-default=’ ‘. The generic name of the corresponding output; e.g., OLDNAM3 corresponds to OLDDB3, etc. See Remarks. AXIC T able of axisymmetric and fluid Bulk Data entries. BGPDT Basic grid point definition table. CSTM T able of coordinate system transformation matrices. EPT T able of element properties. EQEXIN Equivalence table between external and internal grid/scalar identification numbers. EST Element summary table. GEOM1 T able of Bulk Data entry images related to geometry. GEOM2 T able of element connectivity. GEOM3 T able of static loads. GEOM4 T able of degree-of-freedom set assignments. GPDT Grid point definition table.

2017 MAKEOLD Converts tables from Version 69 (or greater) to pre-Version 69 format Main Index 2.The inputs, outputs, and parameters can be specified in any order as long as the parameters are in the same positions as their respective inputs or outputs. For example, the following specifications are equivalent. MAKEOLD GEOM1,AXIC,,,/OGEOM1,OAXIC,,,/ ‘GEOM1’/‘AXIC’///‘GEOM1’/‘AXIC’ $

MAKEOLD   AXIC,GEOM1,,,/OAXIC,OGEOM1,,,/
          'AXIC'/'GEOM1'///'AXIC'/'GEOM1' $

3.If BGPDT is specified as input then MAKEOLD creates four tables BGPDT, EQEXIN, SIL, and GPL. For example, MAKEOLD BGPDT,,,,/OBGPDT,OEQEXIN,OSIL,OGPL,/ ‘BGPDT’/////‘BGPDT’/‘EQEXIN’/‘SIL’/‘GPL’ $ 4.Heat transfer in EST cannot be processed by MAKEOLD.GPL External grid/scalar point identification number list. SIL Scalar index list.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Generates transformation matrix for support point degrees-of-freedom2018 Main Index Generates transformation matrix to transform forces from the support point degrees-of-freedom to the reference point. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters:MAKETR Generates transformation matrix for support point degrees-of-freedom MAKETR AERO,CSTMA,BGPDT,USET,TRX/ TR,PRBDOFS,URDDIDX,URDDUXV,TRANTR/ AUNITS $ AERO T able of control information for aerodynamic analysis. CSTMA T able of aerodynamic coordinate system transformation matrices for g-set + ks-set grid points. BGPDT Basic grid point definition table. USET Degree-of-freedom set membership table for g-set. TRX Acceleration selection matrix for the list of aerodynamic extra-points (6 rows by NX columns). TR Matrix to transform forces from the support point to the aerodynamic reference point. PRBDOFS Partitioning matrix to partition the “active” URDDI from the “inactive”. Active URRDI are assigned a 1.0 value and are connected to the SUPORT degrees-of- freedom. URDDIDX An instance of an ADBINDX that describes the acceleration entries. URDDUXV UX vector states for the active URDDi. These are rows of TRX that are non-null. Null rows occur either because the USER didn’t define AESTAT, URDDi, OR because the associated URDDi is invalid for this symmetry condition (e.g., URDD1,3,5 are invalid for antisymmetric analysis). TRANTR T ranspose of TR where the number of columns of TR matches the URDDUXV states of TRX. Both are reduced to just the active origin rigid body degrees-of- freedom. AUNITS Input-real-no default. Used to convert accelerations expressed in gravity units to units of length per time squared.

2019 MAKETR Generates transformation matrix for support point degrees-of-freedom Main Index Example: Excerpt from subDMAP AESTATRS: DBVIEW STBGPDT=BGPDTS WHERE (MODLTYPE=‘STRUCTUR’) $ DBVIEW STUSET=USET WHERE (MODLTYPE=‘STRUCTUR’) $ MAKETR AERO,CSTMA,STBGPDT,STUSET/TR $

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Builds table of monitor points2020 Main Index Builds a table of monitor points. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameter:MAKMON Builds table of monitor points MAKMON EDT, , / ,MONDISP,MONGRP,MP3LAB,MP3GPF/ MKERRCHK /MONSUM/SEID $ EDT Element deformation table. Contains aerodynamic model records, specifically monitor and component input. AEROCOMP T able of aerodynamic components when MESH=‘AERO’. STRUCOMP T able of structural components when MESH=‘STRU’. AEMONPT T able of aerodynamic monitor points. MONITOR T able of structural monitor points. MONDISP Monitor points table for displacements. MONGRP T able of monitor point groups. MP3LAB T able of monitor point type-3 labels. MP3GPF T able of monitor point type-3 responses. MKERRCHK Input-logical-default=FALSE. Error check flag. TRUE: Perform check FALSE: Do not perform check MONSUM Input-logical-default=TRUE. If TRUE then process MONSUM. SEID Input-integer-default=0. Superelement ID.AEROCOMP STRUCOMP   
AEROCOMP    AEMONPT MONITOR   

2021 MAPMODES Mode Mapping Main Index To map the order of the modes of the current run to that of a baseline run. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:MAPMODES Mode Mapping MAPMODES OLDMODES,MASS,NEWMODES,LAMA,LAMARES/ MODEMAP,BESTFIT,LAMANEW,MDSMAPD,NEWEIGM/ MINORTHO/S,N,MATCH/SMALLEST $ OLDMODES Baseline eigenvectors from a baseline run. MASS Mass matrix from current run for the set of DOF in the eigenvectors. NEWMODES Eigenvectors from the current run (mass normalized). LAMA Lama table from the current run. LAMARES Lama table for the residual vectors only (required only when the new modes contain residual vectors). MODEMAP Matrix mapping the new modes onto the original ones each column is associated with an old mode and contains only one term (1.0) the term will be in the row with the best fit new mode. If there is no match for a mode, the associated column will be null. BESTFIT Similar to MODEMAP , but this matrix has the cross-orthogonality terms rather than 1.0. LAMANEW Updated LAMA table with the new modes mapped into the same order as the baseline modes. Will only contain data for the new modes which have been mapped into the order of the baseline modes. MDSMAPD Matrix containing the new modes mapped into the order of the baseline modes. Note this will only contain the number of modes that are in the baseline modes. If a match for more of the baseline modes is unable to be found, this matrix will not be created. NEWEIGM Matrix containing the eigenvalues of the mapped modes (in the same order as they are mapped onto the baseline modes). Once again this will only contain as many eigenvalues as there are baseline modes and will not be created if it is not possible to map to one or more baseline modes. MINORTHO Input-real-default=0.9. Value of the minimum acceptable cross orthogonality for the elastic modes.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Mode Mapping2022 Main Index Method: MAPMODES will internally scale the baseline modes using the input mass matrix so that the diagonal terms in TM are 1.0, then it will calculate the cross-orthogonality between the baseline modes and the new modes. It will then look for the best fit between the new modes and the baseline modes and create the mapping matrix (MODEMAP) containing 1.0 for the best fit modes and the BESTFIT matrix containing the cross-orthogonality terms for the best fit modes. If the BESTFIT term for any mode is less than MINORTHO, then MATCH will be set to FALSE, otherwise it will be set to TRUE.MATCH Output-logical=FALSE. Set to TRUE if a match can be found for all baseline modes. Set to FALSE otherwise. SMALLEST Output-real-default=0.0. Smallest term in the mapping matrix (minimum acceptable cross orthogonality found when mapping the modes).

item.title: User's Manual P103
item.description:
2023 MASSCOMB Adds family of mass matrices Main Index Adds together a family of mass matrices controlled by the MASSET Bulk Data and CASECC commands. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters: Example:MASSCOMB Adds family of mass matrices MASSCOMB EDT,MGG*/ MGGCOMB/ MASSETID/MASSQUAL $ EDT Table of Bulk Data entry images related to element deformation, aerodynamics, p-element analysis, divergence analysis, and the iterative solver. Also contains SET1 entries. Specifically, this module reads the MASSINC record. MGG* Family of MGG (g-set mass) matrices. MGGCOMB Combined mass matrix. MASSETID Input-integer-default=0. Identification number of the MASSSET Case Control command. MASSQUAL Input-character-default=‘MASSID’. Name of the qualifier used to qualify the MGG*. PARAML CASECC/‘SET’/1/453//S,N,MASSSET DBVIEW MGIN=MHH WHERE(MASSID=*) $ MASSCOMB EDT,MGIN/MHH/MASSSET $

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Matrix generator2024 Main Index To generate different kinds of matrices for subsequent use in other matrix operation modules. Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameters: Remarks: The operation performed by MATGEN depends on the option selected by parameter P1. The following sections describe the corresponding operation for each P1 parameter value. List of OptionsMATGEN Matrix generator MATGEN T/MAT/P1/P2/P3/P4/P5/P6/P7/P8/P9/P10/P11/P12/P13 $ T Optional tabular data for use in generating the matrix. MAT Matrix data block. P1 Input -integer -no default. Option selection parameter as described below. P2 through P11 Input -integer -default=0. Provide parametric data depending on P1. P12 Input-character-default=‘A’. See Option P1 = 11. P13 Input-character-default=‘L’. See Option P1 = 11. P1 Description Option P1 = 1 Generate a real identity matrix. Option P1 = 2 Generates an identity matrix trailer. Option P1 = 3 Generate a data block of prescribed size. Option P1 = 4 Generate a pattern matrix. Option P1 = 5 Generate a matrix of pseudorandom numbers. The numbers span the range 0 to 1.0, with a uniform distribution. Option P1 = 6 Generate a partitioning vector for use in PARTN or MERGE. Option P1 = 7 Generate a null matrix. Option P1 = 8 Generate a matrix from equations based on its indices. The matrix is in single precision.

2025 MATGEN Matrix generator Main Index Option P1 = 1 Generate a real identity matrix. Format: Input Data Blocks: None.
