Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters:MATMOD GEOM2,CASECC,,,,/GEOM2R,/37/ ELEMSET/GRIDSET/S,N,NOGEOM2 $ GEOM2 Table of Bulk Data entry images related to element connectivity and scalar points and indexed by the IFPINDX module. See Remark. CASECC Table of Case Control command selections. GEOM2R GEOM2 table with reduced element record. ELEMSET Input-integer. SET Case Control command identification number which contains a list element identification numbers. GRIDSET Input-integer. SET Case Control command identification number which contains a list SPOINT identification numbers. NOGEOM2 Output-integer. Processing status flag.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Matrix modification2084 Main Index Remarks: 1.GEOM2 must be indexed with IFPINDX module before being used as input to this MATMOD option: FILE GEOM2=APPEND $ IFPINDX /GEOM2 $ MATMOD GEOM2,CASECC,,,,/GEOM2R,/37/ ELEMSET/GRIDSET/S,N,NOGEOM2 $ 2.It is recommend that GEOM2 be converted by the SECONVRT module and then used as input to MATMOD. Option P1 = 38 Reduce the records in the EST table to the entries corresponding to element numbers specified in a Case Control set. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters:+1 No element and SPOINTs found in GEOM2 matching the contents in ELEMSET and GRIDSET . 0Some elements and SPOINTs in GEOM2 were found in ELEMSET and GRIDSET. -1 All elements and SPOINTs in GEOM2 were found in ELEMSET and GRIDSET. MATMOD EST,CASECC,,,,/ESTR,/38/ ELEMSET/GRIDSET/S,N,NOEST $ EST T able of Bulk Data entry images related to geometry and indexed by the IFPINDX module. CASECC T able of Case Control command selections. ESTR EST table with reduced records. ELEMSET Input-integer. SET Case Control command identification number that contains a list element point identification numbers. GRIDSET Input-integer. SET Case Control command identification number which contains a list grid point identification numbers. NOEST Output-integer. Processing status flag. +1 No element found in EST matching the contents of ELEMSET.

2085 MATMOD Matrix modification Main Index Remarks: 1.EST must be indexed with ESTINDX m odule before being used as input to this MATMOD option: FILE EST=APPEND $ ESTINDX / EST $ MATMOD EST,CASECC,,,,/ESTR,/38/ ELEMSET/GRIDSET/S,N,NOEST $ Option P1 = 39 Remove and identify explicit zero terms in a matrix. Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Blocks: Parameter: Option P1 = 40 Replace the value of, or add a value to, a single term in a matrix. If the input matrix is not purged, the output matrix is the same type as the input matrix while the input term is governed by TYPE. Format: Input Data Block:0 Some elements in EST were found in ELEMSET. -1 All elements and SPOINTs in EST were found in ELEMSET. MATMOD I1,,,,,/O1,O2/39/S,N,NOXPLZER $ I1 Any matrix. O1 Matrix I1 with explicit zero terms removed. O2 Matrix containing a 1.0 at the row and column, where an explicit zero was found in I1. NOXPLZER Output-integer. Explicit zero existence flag. Set to -1 if no explicit zeros are found. MATMOD I1,,,,/O1,/ 40/ICOL/IROW/TYPE/REAL//NCOL/NROW/ ////////REALD/CMPLX/CMPLXD $ I1 A matrix. May be purged. See NCOL.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Matrix modification2086 Main Index Output Data Block: Parameters: Example: In matrix A, add 10.5 to the value at column 2 and row 3: Remarks: If the input matrix is real and TYPE is -4, -3, 3, or 4, only the real term from CMPLX or CMPLXD will be used.O1 Modified I1 matrix. ICOL Column number. IROW Row number. TYPE T ype of value to be replaced or added. -1Replace current value with REAL. -2Replace current value with REALD. -3Replace current value with CMPLX. -4Replace current value with CMPLXD. 1Add REAL to current value. 2Add REALD to current value. 3Add CMPLX to current value. 4Add CMPLXD to current value. REAL Real single precision value. NCOL Number of columns in O1 if I1 is purged. Default=ICOL. NROW Number of rows in O1 if I1 is purged. Default=IROW. REALD Real double precision value. CMPLX Complex single precision value. CMPLXD Complex double precision value. MATMOD A,,,,,/A1,/40/2/3/-1/10.5 $

2087 MATMOD Matrix modification Main Index Option P1 = 41 Reorder the rows of a rectangular matrix. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters: None. Option P1 = 42 Permute a sparse square matrix. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters: None. Option P1 = 43 Not implemented. Option P1 = 44 Creates EQEXIN table based on g-set partitioning vector.MATMOD GRDRM,I1,,,,/O1,/41 $ GRDRM Permutation matrix. I1 Rectangular matrix. O1 Reordered rectangular matrix. MATMOD GRDRM,I1,,,,/O1,/42 $ GRDRM Permutation matrix. I1 Square matrix. O1 Permuted matrix.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Matrix modification2088 Main Index Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: EQEXINR EQEXIN reduced by VG. Parameters: None. Option P1 = 45 Permute matrix according to a row permutation. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameter: Option P1 = 46 Convert a sparse partial decomp matrix into a regular matrix datablock. Format: MATMOD EQEXIN,VG,,,,/EQEXINR,/44 $ EQEXIN Equivalence table between internal and external grid identification number s. VG Partitioning vector with 1.0 desired degrees-of-freedom. MATMOD I1,RPERM,,,,/O1,/45/PERMOPT $ RPERM T able of row permutations. I1 Square matrix. O1 Permuted matrix. PERMOPT Input-integer. Permutation option. 1Gather. 2Scatter. MATMOD KTTP,,,,,/KTTS,/46/NOOSET $

2089 MATMOD Matrix modification Main Index Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameter: Example: Option P1 = 47 Perform null row search on a matrix. Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameter:KTTP Sparse partial decomp update matrix. KTTS KTTP converted to standard matrix format. NOOSET Input-integer. Number of degrees-of-freedom in the o-set. PUTSYS(1,277) $ Force partial decomp DCMP USET ,SILS,EQEXINS,KFFX,VFO,VFOX/ LFO,KTTSP ,/3///MAXRATIO/‘F’ $ PUTSYS(0,277) $ MATMOD KTTSP ,,,,,/KTTREG,/46/NOOSET $ DIAGONAL KTTREG/KTTDIAG/‘SQUARE’ $ TRNSP KTTREG/KTTTRAN $ ADD5 KTTREG,KTTTRAN,KTTDIAG,,/KTT///-1.0 $ MODTRL KTT////6 $ MATMOD I1,,,,,/O1,/47///P4 $ I1 Any matrix. O1 Column vector which has 1.0 at those rows where I1 has null rows if P4>0 or non-null if P4 < 0. If I1 is purged, then O1 is purged. If I1 is null, then O1 will be full. P4 Input-integer-default=0. See O1.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Matrix modification2090 Main Index Option P1 = 48 Creates a new BGPDT (Basic Grid Point Definition Table) changing CID to zero while leaving the rest of the entries unchanged. Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameter: None. Remarks: The CID for all GRID points, including those associated with fluids (for which CID=-1), and all scalar points (SPOINT) will be set to zero. Option P1 = 5 0 Search for NLPARM or NLSTEP entry in MPT referenced by NLPARM or NLSTEP Case Control command selection in CASECC and extract values of selected fields. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: None.MATMOD BGPDT/BGPDTN/48 $ BGPDT Any Basic Grid Point Definition Table. BGPDTN Basic Grid Point Definition Table with all CID values set to zero. MATMOD CASECC,MPT,,,,/,/50/ SID///S,N,NLPMR//S,N,NFOUND/ICASE/S,N,NLPMI/// S,N,NLPMFLD $ CASECC Table of Case Control command selections MPT Table of Bulk Data entry images for NLPARM, NLSTEP and material properties.

2091 MATMOD Matrix modification Main Index Parameters: Remark: This option will search first for an NLPARM entry and if an NLPARM entry is not found then it will search for an NLSTEP entry. Option P1 = 51 Partition FRL table or FOL table and loads matrix for DMP processing. Format:SID Input-integer-default=0. If positive, the SID of the desired NLPARM or NLSTEP entry. NLPMR Output-real-default=0.0. Extracted real value from the NLPARM or NLSTEP entry. NFOUND Output-integer-default=0. NLPARM or NLSTEP entry found flag. 0 Found selected entry. -1 Selected entry not found. ICASE Input-integer-default=1. The record number in CASECC which contains the NLPARM or NLSTEP command selection. NLPMI Output-integer-default=0. Extracted integer value from the NLPARM or NLSTEP entry. NLPMFLD Input/output-character-default=’ ‘. On input NPMFLD is the field name on an NLPARM or NLSTEP entry. See the Quick Reference Guide for field names. For NLPARM, values of all field names may be extracted. For NLSTEP , only the values of fields in the “MECH” option may be extracted. On output NPMFLD is the value of a field which contains a character string value. MATMOD INTAB1,INTAB2,,,,/OUTTAB1,OUTTAB2/51/NPROC/PROCID/IOPT $

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Matrix modification2092 Main Index Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters: Remarks: 1.The partition algorithm is given by the following DMAP code fragment, where NFREQT is the total number of forcing frequencies in the problem. ISTART is the first process-specific frequency, and NFREQ is the number of frequencies for local process PROCID. NF = NFREQT / NPROC $ NLEFT = MOD( NFREQT, NPROC ) $ IF (PROCID .GT. NLEFT) THEN $ NFREQ = NF $ ISTART = NLEFT*(NF+1) + (PROCID-NLEFT-1)NF + 1 $ ELSE $ NFREQ = NF + 1 $ ISTART = (PROCID-1)(NF+1) + 1 $ ENDIF $ For example, if NPROC=4 and NFREQ=15, the frequencies are partitioned according to the following table. Option P1 = 52 Convert frequency response displacement vectors to velocity or acceleration vectors. Format: INTAB1 FRL or FOL, as indicated by IOPT. INTAB2 Load matrix data block for FOL processing (IOPT<>-1). OUTTAB1 INTAB1 divided by frequency across DMP processes. OUTTAB2 INTAB2 divided by frequency across DMP processes. NPROC Number of DMP processes in the job (no default). PROCID DMP process ID (no default). IOPT If IOPT=-1, INTAB1 is the FRL table. Otherwise, INTAB1 is the FOL table.
Default=0. PROCID ISTART NFREQ 1 1 4 2 5 4 3 9 4 4 13 3 MATMOD MATMOD I1,FOL,,,,/O1,O2/52 $

2093 MATMOD Matrix modification Main Index Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameter: Remarks: 1.Velocity vectors are computed by multiplying each term of a column of I1with corresponding . 2.Acceleration vectors are computed by multiplying each term of a column of I1with corresponding Option P1 = 53 This option is specific to the 2018 new ACMS code. It creates the MDGOQ matrix for domain “MDSEID” from a table. Format: where Input Data Block: Output Data Block:I1 Any displacement matrix. (Real or complex). FOL Forcing frequency list for frequency response analysis. O1 Velocity matrix (complex). O2 Acceleration matrix (Real or complex). P4 Input-integer-default=0. See O1. MATMOD MDGOQX, ACMSINFO,,,,/MDGOQ,/53/MDSEID OR MATMOD MDGOQX, ACMSINFO,,,,/MDGOQ,/53/MDSEID/JFLAG////NCOL/NROW MDGOQX table containing all family members in special format ACMSINFO table with ACMS information MDSEID input parameter; domain for which matrix MDGOQ is requested JFLAG if jflag = -1 then the output data block will not be generated; only the output parameters “NCOL” and “NROW” NCOL number of columns in the MDGOQ matrix corresponding to domain “MDSEID” NROW number of rows in the MDGOQ matrix corresponding to domain “MDSEID” MDGOQ datablock: MDGOQ matrix for “MDSEID"i 2–

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Matrix modification2094 Main Index Option P1 = 54 This option is specific to the 2018 new ACMS code. It creates the MDGOT matrix for domain “MDSEID” from a table. Format: where Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Option P1 = 55 This option create EPSSE table from stiffness, loads, and displacements. See SSG3 module description of EPSSE. Format 1: Format 2: Format 3:MATMOD MDGOTX, ACMSINFO,GOTINFO,,,/MDGOT,/54/MDSEID OR MATMOD MDGOTX, ACMSINFO,GOTINFO,,,/MDGOT,/54/MDSEID/JFLAG////NCOL /NROW MDGOTX data block: table containing all family members in special format ACMSINFO data block: table with ACMS information GOTINFO data block: table on non-null GOT columns per domain. MDSEID input parameter; domain for which matrix MDGOT is requested JFLAG if jflag = -1 then the output data block will not be generated; only the output parameters “NCOL” and “NROW” will be set. For any other value of JFLAG, this parameter is ignored. NCOL number of columns in the MDGOT matrix corresponding to domain “MDSEID” NROW number of rows in the MDGOT matrix corresponding to domain “MDSEID” MDGOT data block: MDGOT matrix for “MDSEID” MATMOD KLL,PLI,ULX,LRSEQ/EPSSE/55/NSKIP $ MATMOD EPSSE//55//PONLY $ MATMOD EPSSE//55 //-3//S,N,MAXEPS $

2095 MATMOD Matrix modification Main Index where Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameter: Option P1 = 56 Build Master Frequency Matrix from Lists in FRLFRQ and MFREQ in CASECC for frequency dependent material. Format 1: where Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameter:KLL Stiffness matrix reduced to the l-set PLI Stiffness matrix reduced to the l-set ULX Displacement matrix reduced to the l-set LRSEQ Resequencing matrix based on internal resequencing of KLL in DCMP EPSSE Table of epsilon and external work NSKIP The record number in CASECC corresponding to the first subcase of the current boundary condition. PONLY Print EPPSE only if PONLY < 0, except -3. MAXEPS Output, Real. When PONLY = -3, skip print EPSSE and return maximum epsilon value to MAXEPS. MATMOD CASEXX,FRLFRQ,/MSTFRQ,/56/S,N,MFRQID$ CASEXX Case Control for MFREQ Case FRLFRQ Frequency Response List from FRLGEN MSTFRQ Matrix of master frequencies corresponding to KFRQF/MFRQF/BFRQF MFRQID Output, Integer. Integer representing current master frequency

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Matrix modification2096 Main Index Option P1 = 57 Convert single column matrix of load factors, frequencies or times into a table suitable for input to data recovery modules like SDR2, etc. Format 1: where Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameter: None. Option P1 = 58 Build reduced frequency response solution vectors based on original and reduced frequency list. Format: where Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameter: None. Option P1 = 59 Convert the coordinates in GEOM1 table to the basic coordinate system .MATMOD FACT/OLB/57$ FACT Single column matrix of load factors, frequencies or times. OLB T able of load factors, frequencies or times. MATMOD FOLO,FOLS,MAT1 / MAT1R / 58 $ FOLO Original frequency list FOLS Reduced frequency list MAT1 Solution vectors based on FOLO MAT1R Solution vectors based on FOLS

2097 MATMOD Matrix modification Main Index Format: where; Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Option P1 = 60 Convert PEM trim component table from Actran to Nastran format. Format: where; Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameter: Remark: 1.Change is to split 7-DOF grid point coming from Actran to 1-DOF acoustic point and 6-DOF structural point. Option P1 = 61 Form a new BGPDT by removing the fluid grid point information. Format: MATMOD GEOM1,BGPDT/GEOM1B/59 $ GEOM1 Table of Bulk Data entry images related to geometry BGPDT Basic grid point definition table GEOM1B Same as GEOM1 with coordinates and converted to the basic coordinate system. MATMOD TABLEA,,,,,/TABLEN,/60/S,N,NZERO $ TABLEA Table generated by Actran containing acoustic trim information for PEM. TABLEN Equivalent table to be used for processing in Nastran. NZERO Output, Integer. Number of unchanged entries in TABLEN MATMOD BGPDT/BGPDTN/61 $

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Matrix modification2098 Main Index where; Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Option P1 = 62 Divide frequency lists for DMP processing for Nastran PEM. Format: where; Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameter: Remark: 1.For PEMDMP processing, frequency lists must be identical for all Trim Components. 2.If FOLFFALL is purged, processing operates only on the FRLTRALL data block to distribute Trim Master Frequencies to DMP processes. If FOLFFALL is present, Forcing Frequencies are also distributed to DMP processes; additionally, User Information Messages 10544 and 10545 are printed.BGPDT Basic grid point definition table. BGPDTN New BGPDT table without fluid grid point MATMOD FRLTRALL,FOLFFALL,,,,/FRLTRI,/62/NDMP/ PROCID//////S,N,NFREQI/S,N,ISTART $$ FRLTRALL FRL table containing T rim Master Frequency list for PEM trim components. See Remark 1. FOLFFALL FOL table containing all Forcing Frequencies. May be purged. See Remark 2. FRLTRI FRL table containing T rim Master Frequency list to be processed by this DMP process. NDMP Input, integer. Number of DMP processes. PROCID Input, integer. Process ID of this DMP process. NFREQI Output, integer. Number of Forcing Frequencies for this DMP process. ISTART Output, integer. Index into global Forcing Frequency list pointing to minimum frequency for this DMP process.

2099 MATMOD Matrix modification Main Index Option P1 = 63 Extract information specified on DOMAINSOLVER Executive System entry. Format: where; Input Data Block: None Output Data Block: None Parameter: Option P1 = 64 Summarize Key Warning Messages Format: where;MATMOD ,,,,,/,/63/S,N,OUTINT///S,N,OUTREAL///////MODEL/ ITEM/S,N,OUTCHAR $ OUTINT Output-integer-default=0. Value of ITEM where ITEM is of type INTEGER. OUTREAL Output-real-default=0.0. Value of ITEM where ITEM is of type REAL. MODEL Input-char8-default=‘STRUCT’. Model must be ‘STRUCT’ or ‘FLUID’. Specifies which MODEL values to extract. ITEM Input-char8-default=blank. Specifies the DOMAINSOLVER item to be returned. Valid ITEM codes: OUTCHAR Output-char8-default=blank. Value of ITEM where ITEM is of type CHARACTER. MATMOD ,,,,,/,/64/S,N,MSGNUM $ITEM TYPE UPFACT Real TIPSIZE Integer MINDOF Integer XFACT Real XFACTX Real

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Matrix modification2100 Main Index Input Data Block: None Output Data Block: None Parameter: Remark: 1.Option 64 consults a database of User Warning and System Warning Messages and reprints the message identifiers in a single convenient location in the printed output (F06) file. Messages reprinted are especially relevant to possible causes of numerical problems during an eigensolution, including ACMS. Option P1 = 65 Extracts rightmost column of a QR matrix datablock for use as a prediction vector in nonlinear operations (namely ROTOR for now). Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameter: None Remark: 1.Option 65 extracts rightmost column of a QR matrix datablock for use as a prediction vector in nonlinear operations (namely ROTOR for now). Option P1 = 66 Update SPCFORCE, MPCFORCE, GPFORCE, and GPKE output requests in CASEDR (output from the SEDR module) for Module 0 when the MDSET Case Control command is present. Format: MSGNUM Input-integer-default=0. Message number. Reserved for future use. MATMOD QR/TAN/65 $ QR Output matrix from the QR decomposition TAN Right most column of the QR matrix MATMOD CASECC,CASEDR/CASEDRN/66/S,N,UPDATED $

2101 MATMOD Matrix modification Main Index Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameter:CASECC SEDR’s Case Control input CASEDR SEDR’s Case Control output for Module 0 CASEDRN Updated CASEDR UPDATED Output-integer. Update flag. Set to 1 if CASEDRN was updated.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Prints matrix similar to DISPLACEMENT output2102 Main Index Prints a matrix in the format similar to DISPLACEMENT output with a user-defined column label and page header. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: MATOFP Prints matrix similar to DISPLACEMENT output MATOFP MAT,BGPDT,OL,USET/ OMAT1/ APP/ROWNAM/PRNTOPT/TCODE/PUNCH/IPRINT/ LCOLLBL1/LCOLLBL2/LCOLLBL3/LCOLLBL4/ RCOLLBL1/RCOLLBL2/RCOLLBL3/RCOLLBL4/ HDRLBL1/HDRLBL2/HDRLBL3/HDRLBL4/ HDRLBL5/HDRLBL6/HDRLBL7/HDRLBL8 $ MAT Matrix (real or complex). The rows of the matrix must correspond to the g-set DOFs. BGPDT Basic grid point definition table. OL List of values for column labeling on left corner of page. The contents of OL depend on the value of APP: APP OL ‘REIGEN’ ‘FREQRESP’ ‘TRANRESP’ ‘CEIGEN’ ‘BKL1’ ‘NLST’ ‘USERLIST’ LAMA FOL TOL CLAMA BLAMA COMB Matrix column of user defined values If OL is purged, then the left corner will not be labeled. USET Degree-of-freedom set membership table for the g-set. OMAT1 MAT converted to OFP-suitable table in SORT1 format.

item.title: User's Manual P107
item.description:
2103 MATOFP Prints matrix similar to DISPLACEMENT output Main Index Parameters: Examples: Example 1:APP Input-character-default=‘USERLIST’. Analysis type. See OL above. ROWNAM Input -character -default = ’ ‘. Set name for rows in MATRIX. If ROWNAM is blank, then it defaults to COLNAM. PRNTOPT Input -character -default = ’ALL’. Must be one of the following values: Option Action NULL Only null columns will be identified. ALL Print all nonzero terms in matrix. ALLP Print numbers converted to magnitude/phase. TCODE Input-integer-default=1. T able code. PUNCH Input-logical-default=FALSE. Punch file write control flag. IPRINT Input-integer-default=0. Print control flag. 0: print <>0: do not print LCOLLBLi Input-character-default=(depends on APP). Label with up to 32 characters to be printed left-justified in upper left corner of each page. The default values depends on APP: APP LCOLLBLi ‘TRANRESP’ ‘FREQRESP’ ‘REIGEN’ ‘CEIGEN’ ‘USERLIST’ TIME FREQUENCY FREQUENCY FREQUENCY LABEL RCOLLBLi Input-character-default=‘COLUMN’ (followed by column number). Label with up to 32 characters to be printed right-justified in upper right corner of each page. COLLBLi is then followed by column number. HDRLBLi Input-character-default=‘MATRIX’ (followed by matrix name). Header with up to 64 characters to be printed and centered at the top of of each page. MATOFP GCF,BGPDT,,USET/ $
