Number of fluid modes to output. OUTSMP Input-integer-default=0. Number of structure modes to output. FMPFEPS Input-real-default=0.0. Threshold for filtering out small fluid factor magnitudes. SMPFEPS Input-real-default=0.0. Threshold for filtering out small structure factor magnitudes. MPFSORT Input-integer-default=11. Sort flag. 10 Sort on absolute value (magnitude). 20 Sort on real portion. 30 Sort on complex portion. 40 Sort on phase angle (must convert). 1 Descending sort. 2 Ascending sort. NOMPF2E Input-integer-default=-1. 0 Generate. -1 Do not generate. FMODE Input-integer-no default. The lowest structure mode number resulting from user parameter input of LMODES, LFREQ, and HFREQ and also MODESELECT(STRUCTURE) Case Control input. FMODEF Input-integer-no default. The lowest fluid mode number resulting from user parameter input of LMODESFL, LFREQFL, and HFREQFL and also MODESELECT(FLUID) Case Control input.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Updates PACABS and PACABR Bulk Data entry records2176 Main Index Updates PACABS and PACABR Bulk Data entry records based upon data on TABLEDi Bulk Data entry records. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameter: Remarks: 1.MODEPT does not terminate the run if an error is detected in the Bulk Data entries. NOGOMEPT should be checked before proceeding to the GP1 module. 2.MODEPT must appear after the IFP. Example: See the example in the IFP module description.MODEPT Updates PACABS and PACABR Bulk Data entry records MODEPT EPT,DIT/EPTX/S,N,NOGOMEPT $ EPT T able of Bulk Data entry images related to element properties; in particular, PACABS and PACABR entries. DIT T able of TABLEij Bulk Data entry images. EPTX Copy of EPT except PACABS and PACABR entries are updated with TABLEij references. NOGOMEPT Logical-output-default=FALSE. Set to TRUE if an error is detected in the Bulk Data entries.

2177 MODEPTFS Modify EPTF or EPTSP data block Main Index Modify EPTF or EPTSP data block for models with frequency or spatial dependent material or element properties. Updated properties include PAXSYMH, PBAR, PBEAM, NSM and NSM1 records. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:MODEPTFS Modify EPTF or EPTSP data block MODEPTFS EPT,EPTFS/ OEPTFS/ S,N,MDEPT/IOPT $ EPT Element Property T able EPTFS Frequency or Spatial Dependent Element Property Table OEPTFS Modified Frequency or Spatial Dependent Element Property Table MDEPT Output logical. False if OEPTFS is not generated. IOPT Input Integer. Option of processing NSM and NSM1. 1: yes, 2: no.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Select a subset of the structural modes after the eigenvalue solution2178 Main Index Select a subset of the structural modes after the eigenvalue solution. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters: Method: The MODESLCT module uses the MODESELECT Case Control command (only option 1) to select a subset of the modes. It creates an updated eigenvalue summary table and a partition vector to be used to partition the mode shapes.MODESLCT Select a subset of the structural modes after the eigenvalue solution MODESLCT CASES,LAMA/PARTVEC,NEWLAMA/S,N,DIDIT $ CASES Case control table LAMA Eigenvalue summary table PARTVEC Partition vector for retained modes NEWLAMA Updated eigenvalue summary table containing only the retained modes DIDIT Output-integer-default=0. Set to -1 if MODESELECT command found and processed, set to 0 otherwise.

2179 MODGM2 Create table entries for PLPLANE and PLSOLID Bulk Data Main Index Creates internal records in the element connectivity table based on the presence of PLPLANE and PLSOLID Bulk Data entry records. Internal records are also created from fluid elements defined on the PSOLID Bulk Data entry. Format: Input Data Blocks:MODGM2 Create table entries for PLPLANE and PLSOLID Bulk Data MODGM2 EPT,GEOM2,GEOM1,GEOM4,BGPDT,CSTM,MPT,EDT,DYNAMIC,RLIST,EPTF SP,MPTFSP ,CASEXX,CSTMX / GEOM2X,GEOM1X,GEOM2DCW,EPTX,MPTX,GEOM4X,HARMELPT,ROT3ELPT , TRANSROT/ S,N,ACFLAG/OSWPPT/OSWELM/S,N,ISWPPT/S,N,NSWPPT/ S,N,ISWELM/S,N,NSWELM/S,N,SWEXIST/S,N,NOGOMGM2/ S,N,RGDEXIST/RIGID/ORIGID/S,N,NLRIGID/ LMFACT/PENFN/NONLNR/CWRANDEL/CWDIAGP/ CFRANDEL/CFDIAGP/S,N,NOEPT/S,N,NOMPT/S,N,NOGEOM1/ SOFFSET/CSRANDEL/CSDIAGP/STOCHQA/SEID/MODGM4/ISUPER /DBLEPT/ DBLMPT/TGDSTRT /S,N,NOGOMG2X /ADAMSF/MDID/TOTLMDOF $ EPT Table containing element properties Bulk Data entry records. GEOM2 Table containing element connectivity Bulk Data entry records. GEOM1 Table of Bulk Data entry images related to geometry. GEOM4 Table of Bulk Data entry images related to constraints, degree-of-freedom membership and rigid element connectivity. BGPDT Basic grid point definition table. CSTM Table of coordinate system transformation matrices for only Connector elements . MPT Table of Bulk Data entry images related to material properties. EDT Table for SET3 entries (used for VCCT in ta0nlem). DYNAMIC Table of Bulk Data entries related to Dynamics. RLIST Fist number of list of rigid elements in residual structure EPTFSP Spatial Dependent Element Property Table (double-key) MPTFSP Spatial Dependent Material Property T able (double-key) CASEXX Table for Case control records. CSTMX Table for all coordinate system transformation matrices of entire model.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Create table entries for PLPLANE and PLSOLID Bulk Data2180 Main Index Output Data Block: Parameter s:GEOM2X GEOM2 table related to axisymetric conical shell, hydroelastic, acoustic cavity, and spot weld element analysis. GEOM1X GEOM1 table related to axisymmetric conical shell, hydroelastic, acoustic cavity, and spot weld element analysis. GEOM2DCW GEOM2 table containing the deleted CWELD elements. EPTX Copy of EPT updated for converted CSHEAR elements. MPTX Copy of MPT updated for converted CSHEAR elements. GEOM4X Modified GEOM4 table related to constraints, degree-of-freedom membership and rigid element analysis. HARMELPT Element property table for axisymmetric harmonic elements. ROT3ELPT Element property table for 3D Rotors TRANSROT ROTBENT transformation matrix and updated GRID info. ACFLAG Integer-output-default=0. ACFLAG>0 indicates fluid elements: 0 No fluid elements. 1 Fluid elements. 2 Fluid/structure coupling. OSWPPT Input-integer-default=0. Offset for spot weld projection point identification numbers. OSWELM Input-integer-default=0. Offset for spot weld element identification numbers. ISWPPT Starting ID of spot weld projection points. NSWPPT Output-integer-default=0. Current spot weld projection point identification number. ISWELM Starting ID of spot weld elements. NSWELM Output-integer-default=0. Current spot weld element identification number. SWEXIST Output-logical-no default. Spot weld element existence flag. Set to TRUE if spot weld elements exist. NOGOMGM2 Output-logical-no default. MODGM2 module error return flag. Set to TRUE if an error is found or CHKRUN=1 on SWLDPRM entry . RGDEXIST Output-logical-default=FALSE. Flag, if TRUE, indicates there are rigid elements that need further processing in MODGM4. RIGID Input-character-default=’ ‘. Sub-method type for the combined Lagrange and elimination method, ‘LAGR’, ‘LGEL’, or ‘LNEL’ . Usually input by user parameter. ORIGID Input-integer-default=0. Offset for rigid element Lagrange multiplier identification numbers. Usually input by user parameter. NLRIGID Output-integer-default=0. Nonlinear rigid element flag. Overrides system cell 377.

2181 MODGM2 Create table entries for PLPLANE and PLSOLID Bulk Data Main Index < 0 No nonlinear rigid element exists and use linear elimination. = 0 Nonlinear rigid elements exist and the Lagrange multiplier method is used to obtain the solution.

0 Nonlinear rigid elements exist and the eliminaton method is used to obtain the solution. LMFACT Input-real-default=0.0. Lagrange multiplier scale factor Usually input by user parameter and overrides system cell 374. PENFN Input-real-default=0.0. Lagrange multiplier penalty function. Usually input by user parameter and overrides system cell 375. NONLNR Input-logical-default=FALSE. Nonlinear solution sequence flag. Set to TRUE if nonlinear solution sequence is being executed. CWRANDEL Input-real-default=0.0. Rate (percentage) at which CWELD elements are removed from the model. Usually input by user parameter. CWDIAGP Input-character-default=’ ‘. Flag, if ‘YES’, to write diagonistics of CWELD element deletion. Usually input by user parameter. CFRANDEL Input-real-default=0.0. Rate (percentage) at which CFAST elements are removed from the model. Usually input by user parameter. CFDIAGP Input-character-default=’ ‘. Flag, if YES, to write diagonstics of CFAST element deletion. Usually input by user parameter. NOEPT Output-integer-default=-1. EPTX generation flag. 0 Generated -1 Not generated NOMPT Output-integer-default=-1. MPTX generation flag. 0 Generated -1 Not generated NOGEOM1 Output-integer-default=-1. GEOM1X generation flag. 0 Generated -1 Not generated SOFFSET Input-real-default=100. Stiffness ratio for equivalent CBEAM generated for the offsets. CSRANDEL Input-real-default=0.0. Rate (percentage) at which CWSEAM elements are removed from the model. Usually input by user parameter. CSDIAGP Input-character-default=’ ‘. Flag, if YES, to write diagnostics of CWSEAM element deletion. Usually input by user parameter STOCHQA Input-integer-default=0. STOCHQA > 0 indicates random deletion of elements. SEID Input-integer-default=0. Identification number of superelements. MODGM4 Output-logical-default=FALSE. Modification flag. TRUE if GEOM4 is modified.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Create table entries for PLPLANE and PLSOLID Bulk Data2182 Main Index Remarks: 1.MODGM2 must appear after the IFP. 2.The following GEOM2 Bulk Data entry records are replaced by the internal records in GEOM2X: Example: See the example in the IFP module description.ISUPER Input-integer-default=-1. From SEP1 and set to >0 if grid list superelements are present in which case grid points that are connected to rigid elements with RIGID=LAGR and assigned to a superelement will be reassigned to the residual structure. Otherwise isuper=-1. DBLEPT False if EPTX is single key; T rue if EPTX is double key. DBLMPT False if MPTX is single key; T rue if MPTX is double key. TGDSTRT Start virtual grid ID for 3D thermal shell. NOGOMG2X Output-logical-default=FALSE. Set to TRUE only if errors are encountered. ADAMSF Input-integer-default=0. Flag, if 1, to write GEOM2 without fluid element (CHEXPR, CPENPR, CTETPR, CPYRPR) information for ADAMSMNF Case Control. MDID Input-integer-default=-1. Module ID. Used when processing Modules in local IDs TOTLMDOF Input-integer/output-default=0. Total number of Lagrange multiplier degrees of freedom GEOM2 RecordGEOM2X Record Fluid Hyperelastic CQUAD4 n/a QUAD4FD CQUAD8 n/a QUAD8FD
CTRIA3 n/a TRIA3FD
CTRIA6 n/a TRIA3FD
CQUAD n/a QUADFD
CTRIAX n/a TRIAXFD
CQUADX n/a QUADXFD
CHEXA HEXPR HEXAFD
CPENTA PENPR PENTAFD
CTETRA TETPR TETRAFD

item.title: User's Manual P111
item.description:
2183 MODGM3 Retrieve temperature data from a solution matrix. Main Index Retrieve temperature data from a solution matrix and perform time/space mapping if necessary. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:MODGM3 Retrieve temperature data from a solution matrix. MODGM3 CASECC ,GEOM3 ,BGPDT ,RSMPH ,BGPH , ECTH ,UPVH ,TOL ,MPT / OCASECC ,OGEOM3 ,OUPVH ,OTOL / S,N,MDCASE/S,N,MDGM3/NUMCPLD $ CASECC Case Control List GEOM3 Table of Bulk Data entry images related to static loads. BGPDT Basic grid point definition table RSMPH Nonlinear restart map table of thermal model BGPH Basic grid point definition table of thermal model ECTH Element connectivity table of thermal model UPVH T emperature matrix results of thermal model TOL Time step list MPT Matrix of Panel Partitioning Vectors (Structural g-Set) OCASECC Modified CASECC OGEOM3 Modified GEOM3 OUPVH Modified UPVH OTOL Modified TOL MDCASE Output-logical-default=FALSE. OCASECC creation flag. Set to TRUE if OCASECC is created. MDGM3 Output-logical-default=FALSE. OGEOM3 creation flag. Set to TRUE if OGEOM3 is created. NUMCPLD Input-integer-default=0. Number of physics.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Reads SPCs and SPCDs and generates unique SPC and SPCD records2184 Main Index Reads the SPCs and SPCDs that were defined by GMBC, GMSPC, SPC, SPC1, or SPCD Bulk Data entries and generates the unique SPC and SPCD records. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:MODGM4 Reads SPCs and SPCDs and generates unique SPC and SPCD records MODGM4 CASECC,GEOM2M,GEOM4M,DEQATN,DEQIND,DIT,BGPDTM, EPT/ GEOM4P/ GNSTART/S,N,MODGM4/ UNUSED3/ S,N,NSWELM/ SWEXIST/RGDEXIST $ CASECC T able of Case Control command images. GEOM2M T able of Bulk Data entry images related to element connectivity and scalar points . GEOM4M T able of Bulk Data entry images related to constraints, degree-of-freedom membership and rigid element connectivity . DEQATN T able of DEQATN Bulk Data entry images. DEQIND Index table to DEQATN data block. DIT T able of TABLEij Bulk Data entry images. BGPDTM Basic grid point definition table . EPT T able containing element properties Bulk Data entry records. GEOM4P T able of Bulk Data entry images related to constraints, updated for the constraints applied by SPC, SPC1, or SPCD Bulk Data entries. GNSTART Input-integer-default=0. First grid identification number in GEOM1M. MODGM4 Output-logical-default=FALSE. GEOM4P update flag. Set to TRUE if GEOM4M is updated. UNUSED3 Input-integer-no default . NSWELM Output-integer-default=0. Current spot weld element identification number. SWEXIST Input-logical-default=FALSE. Spot weld element existence flag. Set to TRUE if spot weld elements exist. RGDEXIST Input-logical-default=FALSE. Flag, if TRUE, indicates there re rigid elements that need further processing in MODGM4.

2185 MODMDCNT Convert MDCONCT Bulk Data entries Main Index Convert MDCONCT Bulk Data entries with XYZ option to GRID option and create new GEOM1 with GRID entries to be contained in a surrogate module. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:MODMDCNT Convert MDCONCT Bulk Data entries MODMDCNT GEOM1/ GEOM1X,GEOM1Y/ S,N,SURMID/S,N,SURGID/S,N,MDCNTXYZ/ DEBUG /S,N,NGRID $ GEOM1 Geometry table containing MDCONCT Bulk Data entry images. GEOM1X Same as GEOM1 except that XYZ option on MDCONCT record replaced by surrogate grid point ID. GEOM1Y Contains only a GRID record with surrogate grid points based on XYZ locations from the MDCONCT record. SURMID Input/output-Integer-Default=0. Surrogate Module ID. If SURMOD=0 then SURMID will be set to 99999999. SURGID Input/output-Integer-Default=0. Surrogate Grid ID offset: Grid ID = SURGID + MDCONCT ID. If SURGID=0 then SURGID will be set to 900000000. MDCNTXYZ Output-Integer-Default=none. Number of MDCONCT entries with XYZ for reference GRID. DEBUG Input-Integer-Default=0. Debug flag. Set to 64 to obtain debug print. NGRID Output-Integer-Default=0. Number of surrogate grids created.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Augments GEOM1, GEOM2 and GEOM4 with q-set definitions2186 Main Index Augments GEOM1, GEOM2 and GEOM4 records with q-set degrees-of-freedom definition to account for the component modes computed for all superelements. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:MODQSET Augments GEOM1, GEOM2 and GEOM4 with q-set definitions MODQSET GEOM1,GEOM2,GEOM4/ GEOM1W,GEOM2W,GEOM4W/ NOQSETT/QSETREC/QSETID $ GEOM1 T able of Bulk Data entry images related to geometry. GEOM2 T able of Bulk Data entry images related to element connectivity and scalar points. GEOM4 T able of Bulk Data entry images related to constraints, degree-of-freedom membership and rigid element connectivity. GEOM1W GEOM1 augmented with dummy GRID entries to represent the fluid superelement modes. GEOM2W GEOM2 augmented with SPOINT entries to represent all of the non-fluid superelement component modes. GEOM4W GEOM4 augmented with dummy SEQSET1 entries to represent the fluid superelement modes and QSET1 for all other non-fluid superelement component modes. NOQSETT Input-integer-default=0. Total number of component modes computed for all superelements including the residual structure. NOQSETF Input-integer-default=0. Number of component modes in the fluid superelement. QSETREC Input-integer-default=0. Records to use in defining the q-set degrees-of-freedom:

=0: No records are written =-1: SENQSET record to GEOM1W =-2: SPOINT record to GEOM2W and QSET1 record to GEOM4W QSETID Input-integer-default=0. Starting q-set identification number for QSETREC=-2.

2187 MODTRK Reorders eigenvalues and eigenvectors to be consistent with previous design cycle Main Index Compares the mode set of the current design cycle with those of the previous design cycle, identifies or tracks these modes, and reorders the eigenvalues and eigenvectors to be consistent with the previous design cycle. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks:MODTRK Reorders eigenvalues and eigenvectors to be consistent with previous design cycle MODTRK CASECC,EDOM,R1TABR,LAMA,MGG,MAA,PHG,PHA,PHGREF, PHAREF/MTRAK,LAMA1,PHG1,PHA1,PHGREF1,PHAREF1/ DESCYCLE/S,N,NOTRACK $ CASECC Table of Case Control command images. EDOM Table of Bulk Data entries related to design sensitivity and optimization. R1TABR Table of retained first level (direct) (DRESP1 Bulk Data entry) attributes. LAMA Normal modes eigenvalue summary table. MGG Mass matrix in g-size. MAA Mass matrix in a-set. PHG Normal modes eigenvector matrix in the g-set. PHA Normal modes eigenvector matrix in the a-set. PHGREF Designed normal modes eigenvector matrix in the g-set from the prior design cycle output of MODTRK. PHAREF Designed normal modes eigenvector matrix in the a-set from the prior design cycle output of MODTRK. MTRAK Table of updated DRESP1 Bulk Data entry images corresponding to the new mode numbering. LAMA1 Normal modes eigenvalue summary table updated for mode tracking. PHG1 Normal modes eigenvector matrix in the g-set updated for mode tracking. PHA1 Normal modes eigenvector matrix in the a-set updated for mode tracking. PHGREF1 Designed normal modes eigenvector matrix in the g-set updated for mode tracking. PHAREF1 Designed normal modes eigenvector matrix in the a-set updated for mode tracking.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Reorders eigenvalues and eigenvectors to be consistent with previous design cycle2188 Main Index Parameters: Remarks: MODTRK prints a report on mode switching activity for the current design cycle and punches out updated DRESP1 Bulk Data entries that correspond to the new mode positions. Example: Excerpt from subDMAP FEA: DESITERP=DESITER-1 $ DBVIEW PHAREF0=PHAREF WHERE (DESITER=DESITERP) $ DBVIEW PHGREF0=PHGREF WHERE (DESITER=DESITERP) $ MODTRK CASEM,EDOM,LAMAS,MGG,MAA,PHG,PHSA,PHGREF0,PHAREF0/ MTRAKS,NEWLAMA,NEWPHG,NEWPHA,PHGREF,PHAREF/ DESCYCLE/S,N,NOTRACK $DESCYCLE Input-integer-no default. Design cycle analysis counter. NOTRACK Output-logical-default=FALSE. Mode tracking success flag. Set to TRUE if mode tracking was successful.

2189 MODTRL Modify trailer Main Index Modify data block trailer data. Format: Input Data Block: Parameters: Remarks: 1.Negative parameters are ignored. Nonnegative parameters cause the corresponding word of the data block trailer to be replaced by the value of the parameter. 2.MODTRL should be scheduled immediately after the functional module that generates the data block. For example: ADD I1,I2/O1 $ MODTRL O1////6 $ EQUIVX Ol/O2/ALWAYS $ 3.If MODTRL is used to increase the number of columns in a matrix, then the resulting matrix is unusable in most modules, including MATPRN and ADD. 4.The correspondence between the parameters and the content of a matrix trailer is as follows: For matrices, P4 and P6 must be -1 or unspecified. See Examples 2 and 3. 5.For table trailer contents, see Data Blocks (Ch. 2).MODTRL Modify trailer MODTRL DB//P1/P2/P3/P4/P5/P6/P7 $ DB Data block with trailer that is to be modified. P1 through P6 Input-integer-default=-1. New value for i-th trailer word. See Remark 4. P7 Input-integer-default=0. T railer bit number (header word 2 from an IFP table record). If p7>0 then set the p7th trailer bit. If p7<0 then clear the p7th trailer bit. Parameter Matrix Trailer P1 Number of columns P2 Number of rows P3 Form P5 Number of nonzero words

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Modify trailer2190 Main Index Examples: 1.To make KAA symmetric (form=6) (MPYAD will label it square (form=1)): MPYAD GO,KOA,KAAB/KAA/1 $ MODTRL KAA////6/ $ 2.In order to change the precision of a matrix, use ADD5. If the new precision does not match the machine precision specify PUTSYS (newprecision,55) before ADD5. For example, on a double-word machine: Single to double ADD5 SINGLE,,,,/DOUBLE $ Double to single PUTSYS(1,55) $ ADD5 DOUBLE,,,,/SINGLE $ PUTSYS(2,55) $ 3.In order to change the type (complex or real) of a matrix, use ADD to convert real to complex and MATMOD(34) for complex to real. For example, Real to complex ADD REAL,/CMPLX//(0.,1.) $ Complex to real MATMOD CMPLX,,,,,/REAL,/34 $

2191 MODUG Modifies UG vector to incorporate displacements of piercing points for connector elements Main Index Computes displacements of piercing points for connector elements and incorporates them into the modified UG vector. Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameters:MODUG Modifies UG vector to incorporate displacements of piercing points for connector elements MODUG UG,BGPDT,EST,CSTM,GPECT,USET,CASECC/ OUG/S,N,MDUG $ UG Displacement vector. BGPDT Basic grid point definition table. EST Element summary table. CSTM Coordinate system transformation table. GPECT Grid point element connection table. USET Set definition table. CASECC Case control command table. OUG Modified displacement vector. MDUG Output, Logical, default=FALSE. Modification flag. Set to TRUE if UG is updated.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Modifies the degree-of-freedom set membership table (USET)2192 Main Index Modifies the degree-of-freedom set membership table (USET). Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters:MODUSET Modifies the degree-of-freedom set membership table (USET) MODUSET EDITVEC,USET/ USETM/ USETOP/MAJOR/SET0/SET1/USETADD/UNUSED6/UNUSED7 $ EDITVEC Vector with zeros in rows to be removed under USETOP=‘FILTER’ or USETOP=’NEWMSET’ or USETOP=’REPLACE’. See Remark 1. USET Degree-of-freedom set membership table for g-set. USETM Modified degree-of-freedom set membership table for g-set. USETOP Input-character-default=‘UNION’. Name of desired operation. USETOP Operation UNION Combine SET0 and SET1 into MAJOR. COMP0 Form SET0 from compelement of MAJOR and SET1. COMP1 Form SET1 from compelement of MAJOR and SET0. DELETE Remove degrees-of-freedom from MAJOR. TURNON Add degrees-of-freedom from MAJOR. COPY Copy degrees-of-freedom from SET0 to MAJOR. EXPAND Extend uset length by USETADD. MOVE Move SET0 degrees-of-freedom to MAJOR.

2193 MODUSET Modifies the degree-of-freedom set membership table (USET) Main Index Remark: 1.EDITVEC may be purged if and and . Examples: 1.Scalar degrees-of-freedom 1 through 5 will be defined in the u1-set and u3-set and scalar degrees-of- freedom 6 through 10 in the u2-set and u3-set. SOL … COMPILE … ALTER … MODUSET ,,USET/USET1 $ CEND BEGIN BULK SPOINT,1,THRU,10 USET1,U1,0,1,THRU,5 USET1,U3,0,6,THRU,10 2.The u1-set will be empty. The u2-set will contain the a-set and the u3-set will contain the f-set. MODUSET ,,USET/VSET/‘COMP0’/‘F’ /‘U1’/‘A’ $ MODUSET ,,VSET/WSET/‘COMP1’/‘F’ / /‘U2’ $FILTER Remove degrees-of-freedom from USET that correspond to zero rows in EDITVEC. NEWMSET Rewrite the m-set according to partition vector EDITVEC. USETADD is the new m-set size. REPLACE Replace degrees-of-freedom set of MAJOR by SET0 corresponding to 1.0 rows in EDITVEC. AP , RV, and Ui set membership will not change. For example, a degree-of-freedom in the AP set with 1.0 in its corresponding row in EDITVEC will both remain in the AP set and also be assigned to SET0. MAJOR Input-character-default=‘U3’. Name of the major set. The major set must be larger then the subsets defined by SET0 and SET1. SET0 Input-character-default=‘U2’. Name of the “zeros” subset of MAJOR. SET1 Input-character-default=‘U1’. Name of the “ones” subset of MAJOR. USETADD Input-integer-default=1. USET length extension. If USETOP=‘EXPAND’ or USETOP=’NEWMSET’ then extend the size of the USET by this amount. UNUSED6 Input-integer-default=0. Unused. UNUSED7 Input-integer-default=0. Unused.USETOP Operation USETOPFILTER  USETOPNEWMSET  USETOPREPLACE 

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Modifies the degree-of-freedom set membership table (USET)2194 Main Index MODUSET ,,WSET/XSET/‘UNION’/‘U3’/‘U1’/‘U2’ $ 3.The following alter puts all degrees-of-freedom automatically constrained by GPSP into the sg-set. COMPILE SEKR0 ALTER ‘GPSP’(,-1) $ BEFORE GPSP $ MOVE DOF IN SET SB INTO SET U3 MODUSET, ,USET0/VSET/‘MOVE’/‘U3’/‘SB’/ $ EQUIVX VSET/USET0/ALWAYS $ MESSAGE //‘SB SET SHOULD NOW BE EMPTY - CHECK BELOW’/ $ TABPRT USET0,EQEXINS//‘USET’/11 ALTER ‘GPSP’ $ AFTER GPSP MESSAGE //‘SB SET SHOULD NOW BE ONLY AUTOSPC DOF - CHECK BELOW’/ $ TABPRT USET,EQEXINS//‘USET’/11 $ MOVE CURRENT SB (ALL FROM AUTOSPC) INTO SG MODUSET, ,USET/VSET1/‘MOVE’/‘SG’/‘SB’/ $ MESSAGE //‘SB SET SHOULD NOW BE EMPTY,SG SHOULD BE PS + AUTOSPC’/ $ TABPRT VSET1,EQEXINS//‘USET’/11 $ NOW MOVE SET U3 BACK INTO SB MODUSET, ,VSET1/VSET2/‘MOVE’/‘SB’/‘U3’/ $ EQUIVX VSET2/USET/ALWAYS $ MESSAGE //‘SB SET SHOULD NOW BE ONLY SPC DOF’/ ’ SG SHOULD BE PS + AUTOSPC’/ $ TABPRT USET,EQEXINS//‘USET’/11 $

2195 MONPARS Processes MPT for finding MONCARL with user provided SID to return the Mass and Fluid Variabilities related to this SID. Main Index Processes MPT for finding MONCARL with user provided SID to return the Mass and Fluid Variabilities related to this SID. Format: Input Data Block: Parameters:MON PARS Processes MPT for finding MONCARL with user provided SID to return the Mass and Fluid Variabilities related to this SID. MONPARS MPT/SID/VARTYP/M SVAR/KSVAR/BSVAR/MFVAR/KFVAR/BFVAR MPT Material property table. SID Input-integer-no default. SID of MONCARL Entry Selected by user VARTYP Output-integer-default=0. Variability type selected by user: 0 Alpha variability 1 Delta variability MSVAR Output-real-default=0.0. Structural mass variability. KSVAR Output-real-default=0.0. Structural stiffness variability. BSVAR Output-real-default=0.0. Structural dmaping variability. MFVAR Output-real-default=0.0. Fluid mass variability. KFVAR Output-real-default=0.0. Fluid stiffness variability BFVAR Output-real-default=0.0. Fluid dmaping variability.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Process MONSUM monitor point data.2196 Main Index Process MONSUM monitor point data. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters: None.MONSUM Process MONSUM monitor point data. MONSUM MON1 ,MON2 ,MON3 ,MON4 ,CSTM / MONS1 ,MULT1 ,MONS2 ,MULT2 ,MONS3 , MULT3 ,MONS4 ,MULT4 MONi T able of Monitor points including MONSUM entries. CSTM T able of coordinate system transformation matrices. MONSi T able of MONITOR points with ONLY MONSUM entries. MULTi Multiplier matrix to produce the MONSUM results.

2197 MONVEC Forms monitor point rigid body vectors Main Index Forms rigid body vectors for monitor points. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters: None.MONVEC Forms monitor point rigid body vectors MONVEC AEMONPT Table of aerodynamic monitor points. MONITOR Table of structural monitor points. AEROCOMP Table of aerodynamic components when MESH=‘AERO’. STRUCOMP Table of structural components when MESH=‘STRU’. AEBGPDT Basic grid point definition table for the aerodynamic degrees-of-freedom. CSTMA Table of aerodynamic coordinate system transformation matrices for g-set + ks-set grid points. SRKS Matrix of monitor point rigid body vectors.AEMONPT MONITOR     SRKS $ , AEROCOMP STRUCOMP     , AEBGPDT , CSTMA /

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Process type 3 monitor points2198 Main Index

Process type 3 monitor points. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters: None.MONVEC3 Process type 3 monitor points MONVEC3 MP3LAB,STRUCOMP,BGPDT,CSTM,KDICT, DSPT1/ MN3VEC*,KDICT3*, DSPT1F*$ MP3LAB T able of monitor point type 3 labels . STRUCOMP T able of structural components when MESH=‘STRU’. BGPDT Basic grid point definition table. CSTM T able of coordinate system transformation matrices . KDICT KELM dictionary table . DSPT1 Design Sensitivity processing table. one for each MONPNT3 entry. MN3VEC* Family of monitor point vectors; one for each MONPNT3 entry. KDICT3* Family of KDICT tables; one for each MONPNT3 entry. DSPT1F* Family of DSPT1 tables,

2199 MPLBLXS Processes Monitor Point Label Tables for External Superelements Main Index Purpose: 1.Create dummy MONPNTi label tables for EXTSEOUT(MATOP4) 2.Convert MONPNTi label tables to DTI entries for EXTSEOUT(DMIGPCH) creation run. 3.Merge the data in META and MP*LAB to form the complete monitor label tables for EXTSEOUT(DMIGPCH) assembly run. Format 1: OPTION=‘MATOP4’ Format 2: OPTION=‘DTIOUT’ Format 3: OPTION=‘DTIIN’ Input Data Blocks:MPLBLXS Processes Monitor Point Label Tables for External Superelements MPLBLXS /MPIDUM,MP2DUM/‘MATOP4’ $ MPLBLXS MP1LAB,MP2LAB,MP3LAB,MPDLAB //‘DTIOUT’ $ MPLBLXS MP1LAB,MP2LAB,MP3LAB,MPDLAB,META / MP1LABO,MP2LABO,MP3LABO,MPDLABO /‘DTIIN’ $ MP1LAB MONPNT1 label table containing all but NAME and LABEL MP2LAB MONPNT2 label table containing all but NAME and LABEL MP3LAB MONPNT3 label table containing all but NAME and LABEL MPDLAB MONDSP1 label table containing all but NAME and LABEL META METADATA records containing NAME and LABEL

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Processes Monitor Point Label Tables for External Superelements2200 Main Index Output Data Blocks: Parameters:MPIDUM Dummy table for MP1LAB, MP3LAB, and MPDLAB MP2DUM Dummy table for MP2LAB MP1LABO Complete MONPNT1 table MP2LABO Complete MONPNT2 table MP3LABO Complete MONPNT3 table MPDLABO Complete MONDSP1 table OPTION Input-character-default=‘MATOP4’. ‘MATOP4’: For EXTSEOUT(MATOP4) option to create dummy monitor point label tables in outputs three through seven as placeholders for OUTPUT2. ‘DTIOUT’: For EXTSEOUT(DMIGPCH) to create DTI entries from the monitor label tables. ‘DTIIN’: Merge the data in META and MP*LAB to form the complete monitor label tables. META and DTI record originate from the external SE creation with EXTSEOUT(DMIGPCH).

2201 MPP Prints monitor point results Main Index Prints monitor point results for either trim subcase or for any one UXDAT instance or for any one UXDAT instance by interpolation of the UXV. Format: Input Data Blocks:MPP Prints monitor point results MPPAECTRL,UXDAT, , , , ,MPSIR,MPSRP ,MPSERP ,MP2S,STRPLB,UXV,INDX,CASEA/ MPOUT ,OMONPNT/MACH/Q/AECONFIG/SYMXY/SYMXZ/MESH/LPSAV E/LPRINT/MASSID $ AECTRL Table of aeroelastic model controls. UXDAT Table of aerodynamic extra point identification numbers, displacements, labels, type, status, position and hinge moments. MONITOR Monitor point table AEMONPT Aerodynamic monitor point table MPSR Rigid aerodynamic loads on structural monitor points at trim (excluding inertial loads and static applied loads). MPAR Rigid aerodynamic loads on aerodynamic monitor points at trim. MPSER Elastic restrained loads on structural monitor points at trim (excluding inertial loads and static applied loads). MPAER Elastic restrained loads on aerodynamic monitor points at trim. MPEU Elastic unrestrained loads on monitor points either at trim or across ADB/AEDB. MPSIR Inertial loads on structural monitor points at trim. MP3EQ For MONPNT3, equivalent static load (elastic restrained - inertial + elastic restrained due to applied loads). MPSRP Rigid loads on structural monitor points due to static applied loads. MPSERP Elastic restrained loads on structural monitor points due to static applied loads. MP2S Table of MONPNT2 responses at trim STRPLAB Labels for MONCNCM data contained in the AEMONPT data block. UXV Control state matrix for ADB or AEDB. ADBINDX Index of ADB or AEDB. MONITOR AEMONPT   MPSR MPARMPSER MPAER MPEU MP3EQ

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Prints monitor point results2202 Main Index Output Data Blocks: Parameters: Examples: 1.Print structural monitor point loads at trim. 2.Print aerodynamic monitor point loads at trim. Remarks: None.MPOUT T able of monitor point outputs. OMONPNT OFP type table of monitor point outputs. MACH Input-real-no default. Mach number. Q Input-real-no default. Dynamic pressure. AECONFIG Input-character-no default. Aerodynamic configuration. SYMXY Input-integer-no default. Aerodynamic x-y symmetry flag. SYMXZ Input-integer-no default. Aerodynamic x-z symmetry flag. MESH Input-character-no default. Mesh type. LPSAVE input-logical-default=true. Set to true when data are to be written to mpout. LPRINT input-logical-default=true. Set to true when data are to be printed to the .f06 file. MASSID input-integer-default=-1. Mass case identification. MPP AECTRL,UXDAT,MONITOR,MPSR,MPSER,,MPSIR,MPSRP,MPSERP,,// MACH/Q/AECONFIG/SYMXY/SYMXZ/‘STRUCT’ $ MPP AECTRL,UXDAT,AEMONPT,MPAR,MPAER,,,,,,// MACH/Q/AECONFIG/SYMXY/SYMXZ/‘AERO’ $

item.title: User's Manual P112
item.description:
2203 MPPSTATC Process monitor point data for static analysis Main Index Process monitor point data for static analysis. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters:MPPSTATC Process monitor point data for static analysis MPPSTATCCASECC ,MPDB ,MPMAT ,MPMATI / MPOUT / MONTYP /LPSAVE /LPRINT $ CASECC Case Control table. MPDB Table of monitor point information. MPMAT Matrix containing monitor point results. MPMATI Matrix containing monitor point results related to inertia relief. Only used in conjunction with MONPNT1 entries. MPOUT Table of monitor point results MONTYP Input-character-default=’ ‘. Monitor point type: MONPNT1, MONPNT2, MONPNT3 or MONDSP1. LPSAVE Input-logical-default=TRUE. MPOUT save flag. If TRUE save data to MPOUT . LPRINT Input-logical-default=TRUE. MPOUT print flag. If TRUE print MPOUT .

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Prints monitor point data for frequency response aeroelasticity2204 Main Index Prints monitor point data for frequency response aeroelasticity. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters: Remarks: None.MPPTRAN Prints monitor point data for frequency response aeroelasticity MPPTRAN CASECC,MPDB,OL,MAT1,MAT2,MAT3,MAT4/OMONPNT/MATTYPE/MO NTYPE/LPSAVE CASECC T able of Case Control specifications MPDB T able of monitor point information OL T ransient response time output list or frequency response frequency output list. MATi Input matrices. See MATTYPE. OMONPNT OFP data block containing monitor point results MATTYPE Input-character-default=’ ’. Input matrix type flag. Value Input Matrix Description ’MONDSP1’ X1=Displacement matrix X2 thru X4 are ignored and may be purged. ’MONPNT1’ X1=Inertia loads matrix X2=External Loads matrix X3=Flexible Increments matrix X4=Rigid Gust loads matrix MONTYPE Input-character-default=’ ’. Monitor point type. ’STRUCTUR ’ Structural monitor points ’AERODYNA’ Aerodynamic monitor points LPSAVE Input-logical-default=’FALSE’. Save monitor point results flag. ‘TRUE’ Write monitor point results to OFP data block, OMONPNT ‘FALSE’ Do not save monitor point results data

2205 MPYAD Matrix multiply and add Main Index Perform the multiplication of two matrices and optionally, the addition of a third matrix to the product. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters:MPYAD Matrix multiply and add MPYAD A,B,C/X/T/SIGNAB/SIGNC /PREC/FORM /DODMP/SENDIN/SENDOUT $ A Left-hand matrix in the matrix product. B Right -hand matrix in the matrix product. C Matrix to be added to the product. X Matrix product. T Integer-input-default = 0. T ranspose flag. T = 1, perform T = 0, perform T = 2, perform where is the complex conjugate of A. Only meaningful when A is complex. T = 3, perform where is the Hermitian conjugate of A. Only meaningful when A is complex. SIGNAB Integer-input-default = 1. Sign of product flag. SIGNAB = +1, perform SIGNAB = -1, perform SIGNC Integer-input-default = 1. Sign of flag. SIGNC = +1, add SIGNC = -1, subtract PREC Integer-input-default = 0. Precision. PREC = 1, element of [X] will be output in single precision. PREC = 2, elements of [X] will be output in double precision. PREC = 0, element of [X] will be output in the precision of the computer.ATB AB AB A AHB AH AB A–B C C

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Matrix multiply and add2206 Main Index Remarks: 1.If no matrix is to be added, C must be purged. A may be Form 3. 2.A, B, and C must be all different data blocks. 3.If A or B is purged, and is purged, then [X] is purged. A may not be Form 3. 4.If A and/or B is purged, but C exists, the purged matrices are equivalent to null matrices, and [X] will be output. 5.X may not be purged. 6.System cell 66 can be set to values 1, 2, 4, or 8, to force the selection of methods DENSE, SPARSE, SPARSE-DENSE, or DENSE-SPARSE, respectively. In order to deselect a method, the user can set isys(66) to 32-n, where n is any of the above numbers. For example, to force method sparse, use “isys(66)=2”. To force MPYAD use any method other than SPARSE-DENSE and DENSE-SPARSE, use “isys(66)=20” (=32 – 4 – 8). Or suppress method 7.In order to use SMP-parallelization, simply add “smp=n” to the command line or “Nastran PARALLEL=n” in the input deck, where “n” is the number of threads. Examples: 1. MPYAD A,B,C/X $ 2. MPYAD A,B,C/X/1// -1 $ 3. MPYAD A,B,/X/3/ -1 $FORM Integer-input-default = 0. Form of [X]. FORM = 0, form of [X] will be 1 (square) or 2 (rectangular). DODMP Input-integer-default=0. Distributed Memory Parallel (DMP) method selection 0: perform in serial 1: perform distributed memory parallel method 1 2: perform distributed memory parallel method 2 SENDIN Input-logical-default=TRUE. If TRUE, with Distributed Memory Parallel (DMP), then broadcast input matrices from the parent process to the child process. SENDOUT Input-logical-default=TRUE. If TRUE, with Distributed Memory Parallel (DMP), then broadcast the output matrices from the parent process to the child process. X ABC+ = X ATBC– = X AHB–=

2207 MRGCOMP Merges two existing aerodynamic or structural component tables Main Index Merges two existing aerodynamic or structural component tables. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameter: Remark: Duplicate component names will cause a fatal message to be issued unless COMPRPLC is true.MRGCOMP Merges two existing aerodynamic or structural component tables MRGCOMP COMP1,COMP2/ COMP/ COMPRPLC $ COMPi Table of aerodynamic or structural components. COMP Merged table of components. COMPRPLC Input-logical-default=FALSE. If TRUE then components with duplicate names will be copied from COMP1 into COMP .

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Merges families of coordinate system defintion tables (CSTM)2208 Main Index Merges families of coordinate system defintion tables (CSTM). Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameter: Remark: None.MRGCSTM Merges families of coordinate system defintion tables (CSTM) MRGCSTM CSTM1*,CSTM2*,CSTM3*,CSTM4*,CSTM5*/ CSTMX/S,N,NOCSTMX $ CSTMi* Family of CSTM tables. CSTMX Merged table of CSTMi. NOCSTMX Output-integer-default=0. CSTMX creation flag. 0 CSTMX not created 1 CSTMX created

2209 MRGMON Merges two monitor point tables Main Index Merges two monitor point tables and optionally output their associated matrices. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameter: L Remarks: 1.Duplicate monitor points will cause a fatal message to be issued unless MONRPLC is true. 2.SZR1, SZR2, and SZR may be purged. 3.SZR is created only if both SZR1 and SZR2 exist.MRGMON Merges two monitor point tables MRGMON MON1,MON2,SZR1,SZR2/ MON,SZR/ MONRPLC $ MONi Monitor tables. SZRi Associated monitor matrices. MON Merged monitor table. SZR Merged monitor matrices. MONRPLC Input-logical-default=FALSE. If TRUE, then components with duplicate names will be copied from MON1 into MON.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Write the contents of a file to a sequential Fortran file2210 Main Index Write the contents of a file, written in MESSAGE module format, to a sequential FORTRAN file. Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Block: None. Parameter: L Remarks: 1.One line will be created for each record in the input file. The only conversion done is from integer to A4/A8.MSG2EXT Write the contents of a file to a sequential Fortran file MSG2EXT MSGFILE//UNIT $ MSGFILE File written in MESSAGE module format UNIT Input-integer-no default. Fortran unit number.

2211 MSGHAN Passes message number for processing by MSGPOP API Main Index Passes the message number of a message for processing by the MSGPOP API. Format: Input Data Blocks: None. Output Data Blocks: None. Parameters:MSGHAN Passes message number for processing by MSGPOP API MSGHAN //MSGNUM/MSGINP1/MSGINP2/S,N,MSGOUT $ MSGNUM Input-integer-default=0. Message number. MSGINP1 Input-integer-default=0. Optional integer input. MSGINP2 Input-integer-default=0. Optional integer input. MSGOUT Output-integer-default=0. Optional integer output.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Create augmented matrices for differential stiffness matrix2212 Main Index Create augmented stiffness and mass matrix from the differential stiffness matrix with rigid mode eigenvector. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:MTFLT Create augmented matrices for differential stiffness matrix MTFLT KAA,MAA,PHI,RX/KAAX,MAAX,GXNX,RX1/NEWXSIZE/ KAA Structural stiffness matrix MAA Fluid stiffness matrix PHI Eigenvector for rigid body modes RX Partition vector for rigid body modes KAAX Augmented stiffness matrix MAAX Augmented mass matrix GXNX Partition vector for augmented matrix RX1 New partition vector for rigid body modes NEWXSIZE Output-integer-default = 0. Size of the augmented matrix.

2213 MTMD65 Implement MATMOD option 65 Main Index Extract rightmost column from QR solution factor matrices, for use in nonlinear prediction vector. Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameters:MTMD65 Implement MATMOD option 65 MTMD65 QRIN, PF, RZ, NZ QRIN GINO file number for input matrix data block PF GINO file number for output data block RZ Real work array NZ Size of RZ

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Converts DMIG entries to matrices2214 Main Index Converts matrices input on DMIG Bulk Data entries to matrix data blocks. Format: Form 1 – Simplified (CASECC is purged) . (IOPT = 0) Form 2 – Case Control Command Selection of stiffness, mass, and damping (or square) matrices (IOPT=1 for K2GG, etc., and IOPT=0 for K2PP , etc., and TF). Form 2a with EQDYN or EQEXIN and LUSETD or LUSET :MTRXIN Converts DMIG entries to matrices MTRXIN ,,MATPOOL, ,,/ {NAME1,NAME2,NAME3,NAME4,NAME5}/ / S,N,NONAME1/S,N,NONAME2/S,N,NONAME3/S,N,NONAME4/ S,N,NONAME5/ 0 /////////////SKIPOUT $ MTRXIN CASECC,MATPOOL, ,, / / /S,N,NOK2/S,N,NOM2/S,N,NOB2/ S,N,NOK42/S,N,NOA2/ /////////////SKIPOUT $EQEXIN EQDYN    LUSET LUSETD     EQEXIN EQDYN   
TFPOOL     K2GGM2GGB2GGK42GGA2GG   K2PPM2PPB2PP      LUSET LUSETD     1 0

2215 MTRXIN Converts DMIG entries to matrices Main Index Form 2b with BGPDTD or BGPDT: Form 3 – Case Control Command selection of load (or rectangular) matrix (IOPT=2). Form 3a with EQEXIN and LUSET: Form 3b with BGPDT:MTRXIN CASECC,MATPOOL, ,, / / /S,N,NOK2/S,N,NOM2/S,N,NOB2/ S,N,NOK42/S,N,NOA2/ /////////////SKIPOUT $ MTRXIN CASECC,MATPOOL,EQEXIN,,/ P2G,,,,/ LUSET/S,N,NOP2G/////2 /////////////SKIPOUT $ MTRXIN CASECC,MATPOOL,BGPDT,,/ P2G,,,,//S,N,NOP2G/////2 /////////////SKIPOUT $BGPDT BGPDTD    
TFPOOL     K2GGM2GGB2GGK42GGA2GG   K2PPM2PPB2PP      1 0

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Converts DMIG entries to matrices2216 Main Index Form 4 – Selection of DMIK, DMIJ and DMIJI by data block names MATKi, MATJi, and MATJIi .
(IOPT = 3, 4, and 5) Form 5 – Selection of stiffness, mass, damping, and loads (or square) matrices by MATNAMi, etc. input parameter values (IOPT=10 through 12). Form 5a with EQDYN or EQEXIN and LUSETD or LUSET:MTRXIN ,,MATPOOL, ,, / , , ,, / /S,N,NOMAT1/S,N,NOMAT2/ S,N,NOMAT3/// /////////////SKIPOUT $AEBGPDTK AEBGPDTJ AEBGPDTI      MATK1 MATJ1 MATI1MATK2 MATJ2 MATI2MATK3 MATJ3 MATI3 S,N,LKSET S,N,LJSET S,N,LISET      3 4 5

2217 MTRXIN Converts DMIG entries to matrices Main Index MTRXIN CASECC,MATPOOL, ,, / , , , , / /S,N,NOMAT1/S,N,NOMAT2/S,N,NOMAT3/ S,N,NOMAT4/S,N,NOMAT5/ / MATNAM1/MATNAM2/MATNAM3/MATNAM4/MATNAM5/ NFEXIT/MATID1/MATID2/MATID3/MATID4/MATID5 /SKIPOUT $EQDYN EQEXIN EQEXIN     TFPOOL

      MATP1 MATG1 RMATG     MATP2 MATG2      MATP3 MATG3      MATP4 MATG4      MATP5 MATG5       LUSETD LUSET LUSET      10 11 12 TFLID

     

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Converts DMIG entries to matrices2218 Main Index Form 5b with BGPDTD or BGPDT: Form 6 – Selection of DMIK, DMIJ, and DMIJI matrices by the MATNAMi input parameter values (IOPT=13 through 15).MTRXIN CASECC,MATPOOL, ,, / , , , , / /S,N,NOMAT1/S,N,NOMAT2/S,N,NOMAT3/ S,N,NOMAT4/S,N,NOMAT5/ / MATNAM1/MATNAM2/MATNAM3/MATNAM4/MATNAM5/ NFEXIT/MATID1/MATID2/MATID3/MATID4/MATID5 /SKIPOUT $ MTRXIN ,,MATPOOL, ,,/ , , ,,/ /S,N,NOMAT1/S,N,NOMAT2/S,N,NOMAT3/// / MATNAM1/MATNAM2/MATNAM3 //////////SKIPOUT $BGPDTD BGPDT BGPDT //////////S KIPOUT        TFPOOL

      MATP1 MATG1 RMATG     MATP2 MATG2      MATP3 MATG3      MATP4 MATG4      MATP5 MATG5       10 11 12 TFLID

      AEBGPDTK AEBGPDTJ AEBGPDTI      MATK1 MATJ1 MATI1MATK2 MATJ2 MATI2MATK3 MATJ3 MATJ3 S,N,LKSET S,N,LJSET S,N,LISET      13 14 15

2219 MTRXIN Converts DMIG entries to matrices Main Index Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:CASECC Table of Case Control command images. MATPOOL Table of Bulk Data entry images related to hydroelastic boundary, heat transfer radiation, virtual mass, DMIG, and DMIAX entries. EQEXIN Equivalence table between external and internal grid/scalar identification numbers. EQDYN Equivalence table between external and internal grid/scalar/extra point identification numbers. (EQEXIN appended with extra point data). BGPDT Table of basic grid point definitions for grid/scalar point data. BGPDTD Table of basic grid point definitions for grid/scalar/extra point data and generated by the DPD module. In other words, BGPDTD is simply BGPDT appended with extra point data. TFPOOL Table of TF Bulk Data entry images. AEBGPDTK Basic grid point definition table for the aerodynamic ks-set degrees of freedom. AEBGPDTJ Basic grid point definition table for the aerodynamic js-set degrees of freedom. AEBGPDTI Basic grid point definition table for the aerodynamic js-set interference degrees of freedom NAMEi Matrices defined on DMIG Bulk Data entries. K2GG, etc. Matrices defined on DMIG Bulk Data entries and referenced by the K2GG, M2GG, B2GG, K2PP , M2PP , B2PP , or P2G Case Control commands. MATPi Matrices defined on DMIG Bulk Data entries and intended for the p-set. MATGi Matrices defined on DMIG Bulk Data entries and intended for the g-set. RMATG Rectangular matrix defined on DMIG Bulk Data entries and may have an arbitrary number of columns but g-set rows, similar to P2G. MATKi Matrices defined on DMIK Bulk Data entries. MATJi Matrices defined on DMIJ Bulk Data entries. MATIi Matrices defined on DMIJI Bulk Data entries. LUSET Input-integer- default=0 . The number of degrees-of-freedom in the g-set. Only required if EQEXIN is specified. LUSETD Input-integer- default=0. The number of degrees-of-freedom in the p-set. Only required if EQDYN is specified. NONAMEi Output-integer-default=-1. NAMEi generation flag. Set to +1 if NAMEi is generated; -1 otherwise.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Converts DMIG entries to matrices2220 Main Index Remarks: 1.Any output data block may be purged. 2.Form 1 is used to input matrices from DMIG entries named in the DMAP statement output section. No Case Control commands are required.NOK2, etc. Output-integer-default=-1. K2GG, etc. generation flag. Set to +1 if K2GG, etc. is generated; -1 otherwise. IOPT Input-integer-default=0. Case Control command selection flag. 0 No Case Control command selection (see Form 1) or K2GG, etc., and TFL Case Control command selection (see Form 2). 1 K2GG, etc. Case Control command selection (see Form 2). 2 P2G Case Control command selection (see Form 3). 3 DMIK selection by output data block name (see Form 4). 4 DMIJ selection by output data block name (see Form 4). 5 DMIJI selection by output data block name (see Form 4). 10 K2PP , M2PP , and B2PP selection by input parameter value (see Form 5). 11 K2GG, M2GG, and B2GG selection by input parameter value (see Form 5). 12 P2G selection by input parameter value (see Form 5). 13 DMIK selection by input parameter value (see Form 6). 14 DMIJ selection by input parameter value (see Form 6). 15 DMIJI selection by input parameter value (see Form 6). LKSET , LJSET , LISETOutput-integer-default=0. Size of ks-set, js-set, and inteference js-set extracted from the AEBGPTK, AEBGPDTJ and AEBGPDTI tables. NOMATi Output-integer-default=1. Generation flag. Set to +1 if MAT* is generated; -1 otherwise. MATNAMi Input-character-default=’ ‘. Matrix name found on DMIG, DMIJ, DMIK, and DMIJI Bulk Data entries. TFLID Input-integer-default=0. T ransfer function set identification number. TFLID is ignored if IOPT=3, 4, 5, 13, 14, or 15. NFEXIT Input-logical-default=TRUE. T ermination flag. If FALSE do not issue User Fatal Message 2070 and do not terminate the module if the matrix is not found. MATIDXi Input-integer-default=-1. Index to the current name in the SET containing the DMIG names. SKIPOUT Input-logical-default=FALSE. If true then just read MATPOOL to set NOMATi flags but don’t write output matrices.

2221 MTRXIN Converts DMIG entries to matrices Main Index 3.Forms 2 and 3 are used to select the matrices with Case Control commands: K2GG, M2GG, B2GG, K2PP, M2PP, B2PP, or P2G. “-2GG” matrices are of dimension g by g. “-2PP” matrices are of dimension p by p. The P2G matrix has g -rows, with the number of columns determined by the several methods used to input rectangular matrices described on the DMIG entry. 4.If the output data blocks are specified on a CALL statement and the DMIIN module is specified in the subDMAP referenced by the CALL statement, then the data block name specified on the CALL statement must be the same as the name specified on the DMIIN module. Examples: 1.Assume the Bulk Data contains two DMIG matrices, named M1 and M2, which reference grid and/or scalar points only. The following set of DMAP instructions will generate these two matrices in matrix format, multiply them together and print the result. MTRXIN ,,MATPOOL,EQEXIN,,/Ml,M2,/LUSET/S,N,NOMl/S,N,NOM2$ IF (NOM1 > -1 AND NOM2 > -1) THEN $ MPYAD M1,M2,/PRODUCT $ MATPRN PRODUCT//$ ENDIF $ 2.Assume the Bulk Data contains two DMIG matrices, MASS and STIFF, which reference grid and/or scalar points only. The following Case Control and DMAP instructions will generate these two matrices in matrix format and add them to the structural mass and stiffness. Case Control: M2GG = MASS K2GG = STIFF DMAP instructions: MTRXIN CASECC,MATPOOL,EQEXIN,,/STIFF,MASS,/ LUSET/S,N,NOSTIFF/S,N,NOMASS//1 $ IF (NOSTIFF > -1) THEN $ ADD KGG,STIFF/KGGNEW $ EQUIVX KGGNEW/KGG/ALWAYS $ ENDIF $ IF (NOMASS > -1) THEN $ ADD MGG,MASS/MGGNEW $ EQUIVX MGGNEW/MGG/ALWAYS $ ENDIF

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Transform M, K, B matrices from “Incremental to total” rotation formulation.2222 Main Index The module NAMG (MSC Nastran Adams Coupled Solution Matrix Generation) calculates the transformed mass, stiffness, damping matrices which are then used for Adams-Nastran coupled solution. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameter:NAMG Transform M, K, B matrices from “Incremental to total” rotation formulation. NAMG BGPDT,USET,SIL,U,V,A,KPP,BPP,MPP,U_I,V_I,A_I/ MT,H,P,CSMTMP,CSBTMP,CSKTMP,CSRTMP / CSFLG/CSDBG/TSTAT /CSLGROT/CSNMDFF/ CSTIME/HSIZE/CSNSKIP$ BGPDT BGPDT DB USET USET DB SIL SIL DB U,V,A U, V, A Vectors, P Size, Current time step KPP , BPP , MPP Stiff/Mass/Damping matrices P size U_I,V_I,A_I U, V, A Vector P Size, Previous converged time step MT T ransformed mass matrix. H T ransformed damping matrix. P T ransformed stiffness matrix. CSMTMP- CSRTMPOnly used for debugging. CSFLG Input-integer-default=0. Coupled solution control flag. CSDBG Input-integer-default=0. Debug flag TSTAT Input-integer-default=0. TSTAT Parameter; =1 Statics; =0 Dynamics CSLGROT Input-integer-default=1. CSLGROT=1 Large or, =2 Small rotation formulation CSNMDFF Input-integer-default=0. CSNMDFF=1 Numerical partials, = 0 Analytic Partials CSTIME Input-real-default=0.0. Current time

item.title: User's Manual P113
item.description:
2223 NAMG Transform M, K, B matrices from “Incremental to total” rotation formulation. Main Index HSIZE Input-real-default=0.0. Time step size CSNSKIP Input-integer-default=0. Only used for debugging.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Outputs operators needed to transform sparse M, K, B matrices from “Incremental to total” rotation formulation.2224 Main Index The module NAMGSM (MSC Nastran Adams Coupled Solution Matrix Generation Sparse Matrix) is the counterpart of NAMG module. NAMGSM prepares the transformation operators needed to perform sparse matrices multiplication in calling subDMAP to finally prepare the transformed mass, stiffness, damping matrices. These matrices are then used for Adams-Nastran coupled solution. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameter:NAMGSM Outputs operators needed to transform sparse M, K, B matrices from “Incremental to total” rotation formulation. NAMGSM BGPDT,SIL,U,V,A/T0,T1,T2,A2/ CSFLG/CSDBG/CSNMDFF/CSFULIN/CSTIME/ HSIZE/PSIZE BGPDT BGPDT DB SIL SIL DB U,V,A U, V, A Vectors, P size, Current Time Step. T0-A2 T ransformation operator required to transform M,B,K. CSFLG Input-integer-default=0. Coupled solution control flag. CSDBG Input-integer-default=0. Debug flag CSNMDFF Input-integer-default=0. CSNMDFF = 1 Numerical partial, = 0 Analytic partials CSFULIN Input-integer-default=0. Unsymmetric decomp flag: 0-Symmetric, 1-Unsymmetric CSTIME Input-real-default=0.0.Current time HSIZE Input-real-default=0.0. Time step size PSIZE Input-integer-default=0. P-Size

2225 NARG Transforms the residual from “incremental to total” rotation formulation. Main Index The module NARG (Nastran Adams Residual Generator) transforms the residual “from incremental to total” rotation formulation for Adams-Nastran coupled solution. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameter:NARG Transforms the residual from “incremental to total” rotation formulation. NARG BGPDT,USET,SIL,RES,U,U_I/RESP/ TSTAT/CSFLG/CSDBG/CSTIME/HSIZE BGPDT BGPDT DB USET USET DB SIL SIL DB RES Residual to be transformed U DISP vector P size, current U_I DISP vector P size, Previous converged step RESP T ransformed residual. TSTAT Input-integer-default=0. TSAT parameters; =1 Statics; =0 Dynamics CSFLG Input-integer-default=0. Coupled solution control flag. CSDBG Input-integer-default=0. Debug flag. CSTIME Input-real-default=0.0. Current time. HSIZE Input-real-default=0.0. Time step size.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Calculates o-set convergence and truncation error parameter.2226 Main Index Based on the value of csFlg this module calculates o-set convergence and truncation error parameter. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameter:NCONVLTE Calculates o-set convergence and truncation error parameter. NCONVLTE DU,DV,U,V,U_I,V_I,UPRED,VPRED,U_MAX,V_MAX, KDML / UP_MAX, VP_MAX / CSFLG / CSDBG / CSOMINLM / CSINTTYP / CSCORTYP / CSCORDEL / CSSTATIC / S, N, CSOCONV / S, N, CSOLTE / CSERRTYP $ DU DU Vector DV DV Vector U,V U and V vector, Current time step U_I,V_I U and V vector, Previous (Converged) time step UPRED,VPRED U and V Predicted at current time step U_MAX,V_MAX U, V Maximum converged values KDML Stiffness DIAG values UP_MAX U vector maximum value, updated (if required) for CSFLG = 11. VP_MAX V vector maximum value, updated (if required) for CSFLG = 11. CSFLG Input-integer-default=0. Coupled solution control flag CSDBG Input-integer-default=0. Debug flag CSOMINLM Input-integer-default=0. Adams - Nastran Coupled simulation O-set minus LM CSINTTYP Input-integer-default=0. Adams Integrator Type: I3=0, SI2=1, HHT=2 CSCORTYP Input-integer-default=0. Adams Corrector Type: Original=0, Modified=1 CSCORDEL Input-integer-default=0.0. Adams Delta T olerance.

2227 NCONVLTE Calculates o-set convergence and truncation error parameter. Main Index Remarks: This dmap module calculates based on the value of csFlg: •for csFlg <> 11 and <> 12: does nothing •for csFlg = 12 : calculates the o-set conv. and the o-set LTE •for csFlg = 11 : updates the Up_max and Vp_max which are o-set sizeCSSTATIC Input-integer-default=0. Static Parameter: Statics=1, Dyanamics=0 CSOCONV Input-integer-default=0. O-Set convergence: Not convergence =0, Converged=1 CSOLTE Input-integer-default=0.0. T runcation error of the O-set CSERRTYP Input-integer-default=0. Adams or Nastran type O-set error Nastran=0, Adams<>0

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Processes displacement vector U.2228 Main Index Processes displacement vector U and if required limits the rotational part of displacement vector at each grid by subtracting 2  from the rotational vectors magnitude in case they are approaching 0.9*2  Time derivatives of rotational vectors (V and A) are then calculated given the angular velocity and angular acceleration of the grid stays the same. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameter:NCSRVLIM Processes displacement vector U. NCSRVLIM BGPDT,SIL,U,V,A/ UR,VR,AR/CSDBG/PSIZE/S,N,DIDLIM$ BGPDT BGPDT DB SIL SIL DB U, V, A U, V and A vector UR, VR, AR U, V and A vector after limiting is applied. CSDBG Input-integer-default=0. Debug flag PSIZE Input-integer-default=0. P-Size DIDLIM Output-logical- default=FALSE. Was limiting done: YES=TRUE, NO=FALSE

2229 NCSTRINC Converts small rotations vector (ddu). Main Index Converts small rotations vector (ddu) from incremental to full rotation formulation. This module is used for Adams-Nastran coupled solution. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameter:NCSTRINC Converts small rotations vector (ddu). NCSTRINC BGPDT,USET,SIL,DDU,U,U_I/CSDINCDU/ TSTAT/CSFLG/CSDBG/CSTIME/HSIZE BGPDT BGPDT DB USET USET DB SIL SIL DB DDU DDU Vector (Incremental), which needs to be converted. U U vector, current step U_I U vector, Previous (Converged) step CSDINCDU DDU Vector converted to full rotation. TSTAT Input-integer-default=0. TSTAT Parameters; =1 Statics; =0 Dynamics CSFLG Input-integer-default=0. Coupled solution control flag CSDBG Input-integer-default=0. Debug flag CSTIME Input-real-default=0.0. Current time. HSIZE Input-real-default=0.0. Time step size.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Nonlinear interpolator2230 Main Index Nonlinear interpolator. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:NDINTERP Nonlinear interpolator NDINTERP CONTVXV,CONTVX/ IFACT,CONTDIF/ NSUPD/MINNUSE/MAXNUSE/STOL $ CONTVXV Assemblage of all controller vectors (NX rows by NV columns). CONTVX Controller vector used to interpolate UXV (NX rows). IFACT Interpolation factor vector (NV rows). CONTVDIF Derivative interpolation factor matrix (NV rows by NX columns). NSUPD Input-integer-default=2. Number of states to use per dimension. MINNUSE Input-integer-default=1. Absolute minimum number of states to use for the interpolation. MAXNUSE Input-integer-default=9999999. Absolute maximum number of states to use for the interpolation. STOL Input-real-default=1.E-02. State matching tolerance.

2231 NEWIFP Reads Bulk Data Section Main Index Reads in the Bulk Data and outputs the finite element model in Family of tables form. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks:NEWIFP Reads Bulk Data Section NEWIFP IFPSDL,IFPDML,IFPDAT0/ GEOM1,EPT,MPT,EDT,DIT,DYNAMIC,GEOM2, GEOM3,GEOM4, UNUSED10, UNUSED11,MATPOOL,AXIC,PVT,DMI, DMINDX,DTI,DTINDX,DEFUSET,EDOM,DEQATN,DEQIND, CONTACT,OINT, UNUSED25,UNUSED26,UNUSED27, IFPFLAG,UNUSED2 9, REJECT,BULKLIST,UBULK,IFPDAT,META,FATIGUE ,COSIM/ S,N,NOGOIFP /BULKQAL1/BULKQAL2/S,N,MAXBULK/ STOCHAST/S,N ,DELPARAM $ IFPSDL File containing the Stream Definition Language IFPDML File containing the Data Mapping Language IFPDAT0 File containing Bulk Data entries from a previous run. GEOM1 Family of tables of Bulk Data entry images related to geometry. EPT Family of tables of Bulk Data entry images related to element properties. MPT Family of tables of Bulk Data entry images related to material properties. EDT Family of tables of Bulk Data entry images related to element deformation, aerodynamics, divergence analysis, and the iterative solver. Also contains SET1 entries. DIT Family of tables of TABLESij Bulk Data entry images. DYNAMICS Family of tables of Bulk Data entry images related to dynamics. GEOM2 Family of tables of Bulk Data entry images related to element connectivity and scalar points. GEOM3 Family of tables of Bulk Data entry images related to static and thermal loads. GEOM4 Family of tables of Bulk Data entry images related to constraints, degree-of-freedom membership and rigid element connectivity. UNUSED10 Unused and may be left blank. UNUSED1 1 Unused and may be left blank. MATPOOL Family of tables of Bulk Data entry images related to hydroelastic boundary, heat transfer radiation, virtual mass, DMIG, and DMIAX entries.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Reads Bulk Data Section2232 Main Index Parameters: .AXIC Family of tables of Bulk Data entry images related to conical shell, hydroelastic, and acoustic cavity analysis. PVT Family of tables containing parameter values from PARAM Bulk Data entry images. DMI Family of tables of all matrices specified on DMI Bulk Data entries. DMINDX Index into DMI. DTI Family of tables of all matrices specified on DTI Bulk Data entries. DTlNDX Index into DTI. DEFUSET Family of tables of DEFUSET Bulk Data entry images. EDOM Family of tables of Bulk Data entries related to design sensitivity and optimization. DEQATN Family of tables of DEQATN Bulk Data entry images. DEQIND Index Family of tables to DEQATN data block. CONTACT Family of tables of Bulk Data entries related to contact regions. OINT Family of P-element output control tables. Contains OUTPUT Bulk Data entries. UNUSED25 Unused and may be left blank. UNUSED 26 Unused and may be left blank. UNUSED27 Unused and may be left blank. IFPFLAG Family of tables of post-NEWIFP module execution flags and errors for each instance of Bulk Data sections instantiated by BEGIN keyword=value Case Control statement. UNUSED2 9 Unused and may be purged. REJECT Family of tables of rejected Bulk Data entries which will be processed by the IFP module. BULKLIST List of Bulk Data sections qualified by BULKQAL1 parameter below. UBULK Table of unsorted Bulk Data entries. IFPDAT File containing all Bulk Data entries merged from IFPDAT0 and found in the current run. META Family of tables of METADATA Bulk Data entries. FATIGUE Family of tables of fatigue-related Bulk Data entries. NOGOIFP Output-logicaldefault=FALSE. Set to TRUE if an error is detected. BULKQAL1 Input-character-default=’BULKNAME’. Name of first qualifier on instance of Bulk Data sections. BULKQAL2 Input-character-default=’BULKID’. Name of second qualifier on instance of Bulk Data sections. MAXBULK Outputintegerdefault=0. Number of Bulk Data sections processed.

2233 NEWIFP Reads Bulk Data Section Main Index Remark: 1.NEWIFP does not stop on error detection, therefore, the DMAP sequence must contain a statement to terminate the run. For example, IF (NOGOIFP) EXIT$STOCHAST Input-integer-default=0. STOCHASTIC Case Control command presence. Set to >0 if STOCHASTIC is present. DELPARAM Output-logical-default=false, A flag of existence of /delete command in the input data file to delete PARAM entries. It will be true if /delete param or /delete all is present

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Print a new page in f06 with three or six line header2234 Main Index Print a new page in f06 with three or six line header. Format: Input Data Blocks: None. Output Data Blocks: None. Parameters:NEWPAGE Print a new page in f06 with three or six line header NEWPAGE //HEADOPT $ HEADOPT Input-integer-default=1. Header option: 1: Three line header 2: Six line header

2235 NHITRDOF Generate NHRMITR SET info and DSET sequential list Main Index Generate data blocks which contain, NHRMITR case control entry’s reference SETs info in expanded form and Dynamics solution set sequential numbers. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:NHITRDOF Generate NHRMITR SET info and DSET sequential list NHITRDOF CASES,USETD,DYNAMICS,BGPDTS/ ITREXDOF,DSETSEQ/ITRDID/ITRNLID $ CASECC Table of Case Control USETD Degree-of-freedom set membership table DYNAMIC Table of bulk data entry images related to dynamics BGPDTS Basic grid point definition table ITREXDOF Control SET info Contains NHRMITR Case in expanded form DSETSEQ Contains DSET GRID, DOF & its DSET sequential number ITRDID Input-integer. NHRMITR(DISP=ITRDID) Case Control entry. Default = 0 ITRNLID Input-integer. NHRMITR(NLLOAD=ITRNLID) Case Control entry. Default = 0

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Create output csv files for displacement and nonlinear load at end of each iteration2236 Main Index Generate CSV output files containing outputs from NHRMITR case control entry. Format: Input Data Blocks: Parameters:NHITROUT Create output csv files for displacement and nonlinear load at end of each iteration NHITROUT ITREXDOF,DSETSEQ,HUDJ,HPNLIFUL// ITRDID/ITRNLID/FREQ $ ITREXDOF Control SET info Contains NHRMITR Case in expanded form DSETSEQ Contains DSET GRID, DOF and its DSET sequential number HUDJ Complex Displacement matrix - Dsize HPNLIFUL Nonlinear Load matrix - Dsize ITRDID Input-integer. NHRMITR(DISP=ITRDID) Case Control entry. Default = 0 ITRNLID Input-integer. NHRMITR(NLLOAD=ITRNLID) Case Control entry. Default = 0 FREQ Iteration frequency

2237 NLCOMB Consolidates tables related to nonlinear elements and applied loads Main Index Consolidates tables related to nonlinear elements and applied loads for the current nonlinear analysis iteration. Format: Input Data Blocks:NLCOMB Consolidates tables related to nonlinear elements and applied loads NLCOMB CASEX,MESTNL,KDICTNL,BKDICT,ETT,PTELEM0,PTELEM,EDT, MPT,EQEXIN,SLT,DLT,BGPDT,APPLOD,DYNAMIC, ESTL,ACTNODS,DLTO/ ELDATAH,DLT1,GPTT1,ESTLT,DLT1COM/ NSKIP/LSTEP/LINC/STATIC/LGDISP/OSTEP/NEWSTEP/ TSTATIC/ $ CASECC Table of Case Control command images. EST Element summary table containing geometric and/or material nonlinear elements. KDICTNL KELMNL dictionary table. BKDICT BKELM dictionary table. ETT Element temperature table. PTELEM0 Table of thermal loads in the elemental coordinate system from prior subcase. PTELEM Table of thermal loads in the elemental coordinate system for the current subcase. UNUSED8 Not used and may be purged. MPT Table of Bulk Data entry images related to material properties. EQEXIN Equivalence table between external and internal grid/scalar identification numbers. SLT Table of static loads. DLT Table of dynamic loads. BGPDT Basic grid point definition table. APPLOD Matrix of applied load amplitudes DYNAMIC Table of Bulk Data entry images related to dynamics. ESTL Linear Element Summary Table ACTNODS (GP_ID,SILi,SILc) T able for all Active Nodes DLTO Table of dynamic loads of the previous load step.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Consolidates tables related to nonlinear elements and applied loads2238 Main Index Output Data Blocks: Parameters:ELDATA T able of combined nonlinear information data. SLT1 T able of static loads updated for nonlinear analysis. DLT1 T able of dynamic loads updated for nonlinear analysis. GPTT1 T able of grid point temperatures (for transient analysis only). ESTLT Combine ESTL and the temperature load related data from ELDATA DLT1COM Combine DLT0 from previous loadcase and DLT1 at current loadcase for follower force NSKIP Input-integer-no default. Subcase record number to read in CASECC. LSTEP Input-integer-no default. Load step. The current iteration step at the subcase level for static solutions. LINC Input-integer-no default. Number of load increments for this subcase. STATIC Input-integer-default=0. Static analysis flag. Set to zero for static analysis and one for dynamic analysis. LGDISP Input-integer-default=0. Large displacement flag. Set to 1 for large displacement analysis. OSTEP Input-integer-default=0. Restart step number. NEWSTEP Input-integer-no default. STEP case flag. -1 Not a new STEP case. 1 New STEP case. 0 Cold start from the first SUBCASE, first STEP case and TIME=0.0. TSTATIC Input-integer-default=0. Static analysis flag. Set to 1 to ignore inertia and damping forces.

2239 NLHARM Computes forces and derivatives of forces in Fourier space Main Index

Computes forces and derivatives of forces in Fourier space . Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:NLHARM Computes forces and derivatives of forces in Fourier space NLHARM HUDI,MFCDISP,MFCVELO,NLPART,NLFTAB,UNUSED6,DIT/ HPNLDIX,HDFDDIX,UNUSED3/ DFFLAG/UVAFLAG/UNUSED3/UNUSED4/DELTA/FREQ/UNUSED7 / S,N,XSM/S,N,XSMDR $ HUDI Matrix of size dimension NLDNN where NLD is the number of nonlinear degrees- of-freedom in the d-set and NN = 2NHARM + 1 = number of Fourier coefficients requested. MFCDISP Matrix of size NNxM where NN is defined above and M is NN + E and E is the number of extra evaluation points to reduce aliasing. MFCVELO Same as MFCDISP above but its size is (NN-1)xM and its used to compute the time domain velocity given the Fourier coefficients. NLPART Partition vector created by ROTRUTL option that identifies the nonlinear subset of the d-set . NLFTAB Table created by ROTRUTL option 8 used to describe all nonlinear applied loads UNUSED6 Unused and may be purged. DIT Table of TABLEij Bulk Data entry images. HPNLDIX Matrix of the Fourier components of the forces HDFDDIX Matrix derivative HPNLDIX with size NGNN by NGNN UNUSED3 Unused and may be purged. DFFLAG Input-integer-default=0. HDFDDIX compute flag. >-1 Compute DFDX -1 Do not compute DFDX UVAFLAG Input-integer-default=0. UVA nonlinear flag. UNUSED3 Input-integer-default=0. Unused and may be left blank. UNUSED4 Input-integer-default=0. Unused and may be left blank. DELTA Input-real-default=0.0. Centered difference in computing HDFDDIX.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Computes forces and derivatives of forces in Fourier space2240 Main Index FREQ Input-real-default=0.0. Frequency value on NLFREQ/NLFREQ1 records. UNUSED7 Input-integer-default=0. Unused and may be left blank. SM Calculated NLRGAP smoothing function value SMDR Calculated derivative of NLRGAP smoothing function

2241 NLHDOUT Generate Partition Frequency List Main Index Generate a new frequency list and a frequency partition based on the NLFREQC field DFOUT entries. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:NLHDOUT Generate Partition Frequency List NLHDOUT CASECC, DYNAMIC, FRL/ FRLPVC, FRLOUT/ S,N,DOUTFLG $ CASECC Table of case control DYNAMIC Table of bulk data entry images related to dynamics FRL Frequency response list FRLPVC Frequency response list partition vector FRLOUT Frequency response list DOUTFLG Output-integer. Flag to partition vector 0: partition vector computed other: null partition vector

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Prepares data for the NLIC run in SOL 4002242 Main Index

Prepares data for the NLIC run in SOL 400. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: None. Parameters:NLICLOOP Prepares data for the NLIC run in SOL 400 NLICLOOP CASECC,NLRSMP//STPPRV/S,N,ICLOOP $ CASECC T able of Case Control command selections. NLRSMAP Nonlinear restart map from the restart step. STPPRV Input-integer-default=0. The previous step identification number. ICLOOP Output-integer-default=0. The output time step at the restart point: =0 Cannot find initial condition’s restart point . <0 Continue from the last STEP case.

item.title: User's Manual P114
item.description:
2243 NLITER Computes nonlinear analysis solution matrices and tables Main Index Computes nonlinear analysis solution matrices and tables. Applicable to static structural or steady state heat transfer analysis. Format: Input Data Blocks:NLITER Computes nonlinear analysis solution matrices and tables NLITER CASECC,CNVTST,PLMAT,YSMAT,KAAL, ELDATA,KELMNL,LLLT,GM,MPT, DIT,MGG,SLT1,CSTM,BGPDT, SIL,USET,RDEST,RECM,KGGNL, ULLT,GPSNT,EDT,DITID,DEQIND, DEQATN,FENL,EPT,PCOMPT,SLTNL / UGNI,FGNL,ESTNLH,CIDATA,QNV, FFGH,MUGNI,MESTNL,DUGNI,BTOPCNV , BTOPSTF,FENL1,MDUGNI,MDPSINI/ S,N,LOADFAC/S,N,CONV/S,N,RSTEP/S,N,NEWP/S,N,NEWK/ S,N,POUTF/S,N,NSKIP/LGDISP/S,N,NLFLAG/S,N,ITERID/ S,N,KMATUP/S,N,LSTEP/S,N,KTIME/S,N,SOLCUR/TABS/ S,N,KFLAG/S,N,NBIS/NORADMAT/S,N,LASTCNMU/SIGMA/ S,N,ARCLG/S,N,ARCSIGN/S,N,TWODIV/LANGLE/S,N,ITOPT/ S,N,ITSEPS/ITSMAX/S,N,PLSIZE/IPAD /IEXT / S,N,ADPCON/PBCONT/S,N,NBCONT/GPFORCE/GNLSTN / UNUSED/K6ROT $ CASECC Table of Case Control command images. CNVTST Convergence test matrix. PLMAT Initial and final load matrices for subcase. YSMAT Initial and final enforced displacement matrices. KAAL Element stiffness matrix for linear elements only reduced to a-set. ELDATA Table of combined nonlinear information data. KELMNL Table of element matrices for stiffness for nonlinear elements. LLLT Lower triangular factor for nonlinear elements including material, slideline, and differential stiffness effects. GM Multipoint constraint transformation matrix, m-set by n-set. MPT Table of Bulk Data entry images related to material properties. DIT Table of TABLEij Bulk Data entry images. MGG Radiation matrix in g-size. SLT1 Table of static loads updated for nonlinear analysis. CSTM Table of coordinate system transformation matrices. BGPDT Basic grid point definition table.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Computes nonlinear analysis solution matrices and tables2244 Main Index Output Data Blocks:SIL Scalar index list. USET Degree-of-freedom set membership table for g-set. RDEST Radiation element summary table. RECM Radiation exchange coefficient matrix. KGGNL Stiffness matrix in g-set for material nonlinear elements only. ULLT Upper triangular factor for nonlinear elements including material, slideline, and differential stiffness effects. GPSNT Grid point shell normal table. EDT T able of Bulk Data entry images related to element deformation, aerodynamics, p- element analysis, divergence analysis, and the iterative solver. Also contains SET1 entries. DITID T able of identification numbers in DIT . DEQIND Index table to DEQATN data block. DEQATN T able of DEQATN Bulk Data entry images. FENL Strain energy and grid point force at every element from the previous load step in nonlinear matrix format. EPT T able of Bulk Data entry images related to element properties. PCOMPT T able containing LAM option input and expanded information from the PCOMP Bulk Data entry. SLTNL SLT with follower forces for CQUADR/CTRIAR elements for both the current and last load step. UGNI Displacement matrix at converged step in the g-set. FGNL Nonlinear element force matrix from the last iteration. ESTNLH Nonlinear element summary table at converged step. CIDATA Miscellaneous data for controlled increment method. QNV Quasi-Newton sweeping vectors. FFGH Follower force for OLOAD output. MUGNI Displacement matrix for stiffness update. MESTNL Nonlinear element summary table at current step. DUGNI Incremental displacement matrix between the last two converged steps. BTOPOCNV Updated contact regions input information table. BTOPOSTF Updated contact regions topological information table. FENL1 Strain energy and grid point force at every element at the current load step in nonlinear matrix format.

2245 NLITER Computes nonlinear analysis solution matrices and tables Main Index Parameters:MDUGNI Matrix of incremental displacements with respect to the last converged step (UI - U0), to be used for LANGLE=3 or for the new CQUADR/CTRIAR elements. MDPSINI Table of incremental rotation parameters with respect to the last converged step to be used for LANGLE=3. LOADFAC Input/output-complex-no default. Load factor. The real part is the load factor for the current iteration, having a fractional value between 0 and 1. CONV Input/output-integer-default=0. Nonlinear analysis convergence flag. On input: 0Initialization. On output: -1 Convergence has not been achieved. 1 Convergence has been achieved. RSTEP Input/output-integer-default=0. Controlled increments counter. NEWP Input/output-integer-default=1. New subcase flag. -1Current subcase has not been completed. 1Current subcase has been completed. NEWK Output-integer-default=1. Stiffness update flag. -1Do not update stiffness. 1Update stiffness. 2Update stiffness, the solution is diverging and MAXBIS has been reached. POUTF Output-integer-default=1. Intermediate output flag. Set to -1 if intermediate output is not requested. NSKIP Input/output-integer-no default. On input: Subcase record number to read in CASECC. On output: Set to -2 if run is to be fatally terminated. LGDISP Input-integer-no default. Large displacement and follower force flag. -1No large displacement and follower force effects will be considered. 1Large displacement and follower force effects will be considered. 2Only large displacement effects will be considered. NLFLAG Output-integer-default=0. ITERID Input/output-integer-no default. Nonlinear analysis iteration count.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Computes nonlinear analysis solution matrices and tables2246 Main Index KMATUP Input/output-integer-default=1. Stiffness matrix update count within the increment. LSTEP Input/output-integer-default=0. Load step. The current iteration step at the subcase level for static solutions. KTIME Input/output-real-no default. CPU time remaining. If KTIME is positive then KTIME is the time remaining at the start of the stiffness update. If negative, no stiffness update was done since the last exit from NLITER. KTIME still holds the negative of the stiffness update time from the last stiffness update. SOLCUR Input/output-integer-default=0. Nonlinear loop identification number. TABS Input-real-default=0.0. Absolute temperature conversion. For example, set to 273.16 when specifying temperatures in Celsius or 459.69 in Fahrenheit. KFLAG Input/output-integer-default=1. Stiffness update flag. Set to -1 to update stiffness before starting bisection. It reflects the NEWK and CONV status at the last converged solution or stiffness update. See Remark 6. NBIS Input/output-integer-default=0. Current bisection counter. NORADMAT Input-integer-default=0. Radiation flag. -2No radiation. -1Initial radiation. 1Single band radiation with constant emissivity. 2Radiation with temperature dependent emissivity. 3Multiple band radiation with constant emissivity. LASTCNMU Input/output-real-default=0.0. Last converged value of the arc-length load factor. SIGMA Input-real-default=1.0. The Stefan-Boltzmann constant. Used to compute radiant heat flux. ARCLG Input/output-real-default=1.0. The arc length at the last converged step. ARCSGN Input/output-integer-default=1. The sign of PDD P at the beginning of the subcase. This is used in restarts in the post-buckling region. TWODIV Input/output-integer-default=0.
