PHI0 Massless eigenvectors. K0 Stiffness associated with PHI0. PHI1 Eigenvectors which contain mass. M1 Mass associated with PHI1. K1 Stiffness associated with PHI1. ZROSTIFF Input. Null stiffness filter criteria. ZROMASS Input. Null mass filter criteria.D AT= BC

2447 RESMOD Perform linear algebra functions to support residual vector calculations Main Index Option P1 = ‘LININD’ Partitions a matrix into linearly independent and dependent sets. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameter: Remarks: 1.If ZROVEC is null then 1.E-06 is used. 2.If M is purged then an identity matrix is assumed. 3. and should satisfy the following conditions: = computational zeros

4.U and M must be real. Option P1 = ‘LDSWEEP’ Sweeps modal loads for load vectors. Format:RESMOD U,M,,,/U0,U1,,,/‘LININD’////ZROVEC $ U Any real matrix. M Mass matrix associated with U. U0 Linearly dependent vector set from U. U1 Linearly independent vector set from U. ZROVEC Input. Null filter criteria. RESMOD LD,PHI,MXX,MQQ,/LDIND,,,,/ ‘LDSWEEP’/NORMFLG $U0 U1 I0TMU0 U1TMU10.0

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Perform linear algebra functions to support residual vector calculations2448 Main Index Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameter: Remarks: 1.The filtered load vectors are: 2.LD, PHI, MXX, and MQQ must be real. Option P1 = ‘USWEEP’ Sweeps a matrix for small vectors. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameter: Remarks: 1.The filtered vectors are:LD Load matrix PHI Eigenvector matrix MXX Mass matrix, physical degrees of freedom. MQQ Mass matrix, modal degrees of freedom. LDIND Filtered load vectors. NORMFLG Input. Normalization flag. Set to -1 to unit normalize load vectors. RESMOD U,PHI,MXX,MQQ,/UIND,,,,/‘USWEEP’/NORMFLG $ U A set of vectors. PHI Modal vectors. MXX Mass matrix, physical degrees of freedom. MQQ Mass matrix, modal degrees of freedom. UIND Filtered vectors. NORMFLG Input. Normalization flag. Set to -1 to unit normalize input vectors.LDIND LDMPHI PHITMPHI  1–PHITLD   – =

2449 RESMOD Perform linear algebra functions to support residual vector calculations Main Index 2.U, PHI, MXX, and MQQ must be real.UIND U PHIMQQPHIT  –1–+ =

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Data block comparison2450 Main Index Compares two data blocks and invokes dependencies. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters:RESTART Data block comparison RESTART DB1,DB2,DLSTIN/DLSTOUT/ INVOKE/SPEXP/DPEXP/NDDLNAM/PRTUNIT/S,N,DIFF $ DBi Data blocks to be compared. DLSTIN A list of data blocks and the associated pathnames. DLSTIN was built as DLSTOUT during prior executions of the RESTART module. DLSTIN is used to invoke the same restart dependencies, but with different qualifiers, as done during previous RESTART comparisons. DLSTOUT A list of data blocks and associated pathnames defined from DB1 that were deleted during this execution of the RESTART module. If DLSTOUT is designated as an APPEND file, then DLSTOUT contains the list of data blocks deleted (or marked for deletion during this) from prior executions of the module. INVOKE Input -logical -default=FALSE. If INVOKE = TRUE then restart deletions are performed. If INVOKE = FALSE (default) then no deletions are performed, but data blocks are marked within DLSTOUT . SPEXP Input-integer-default=6. Single-precision tolerance exponent. T wo single-precision numbers x and y are considered equal if DBEXP Input -logical -default=12. Double-precision tolerance component. T wo double- precision numbers, x and y are considered equal if NDDLNAM Input-character-default=’ ‘. NDDL is the name of the DATABLK statement to use for a description in the comparison that overrides the name of DB1. PRTUNIT Input-integer-default=0. Fortran unit flag to print differences betwee DB1 and DB2. =0 Print to f04.xy– 10SPEXP – xy– 10DBEXP –

2451 RESTART Data block comparison Main Index Remarks: 1.Any or all input data blocks may be purged. 2.If DLSTIN is not purged, the DB1 and DB2 must be purged. 3.If DBI and DB2 are not purged, the DLSTIN must be purged. 4.If INVOKE = TRUE then RESTART also deletes data blocks according to the data dependencies (see DEPEN (Ch. 3)). Only data blocks with the current values of qualifiers for the path given by DBi are deleted. If the paths of DBi and the path of the data block to be deleted differ, then all intersecting qualifiers use the current value and the remaining nonintersecting qualifiers use the wildcard (*) to determine deletion. Example: In this example, GEOM1 and GEOM2 are compared to the restart versions defined in the DBVIEW statement. Changes are marked within the HIST file. Deletions are performed after SEID is set. FILE HIST=APPEND $ PROJVER //’RESTART’/S,N,RESPRJ/S,N,RESVER/S,N,EXIST $ DBVIEW GEOM1R = GEOM1 (WHERE VERSION=RESVER) $ DBVIEW GEOM2R = GEOM2 (WHERE VERSION=RESVER) $ RESTART GEOM1,GEOM1R,/HIST/ $ RESTART GEOM2,GEOM2R,/HIST/ $ SEID = SEDWN $ RESTART,,,HIST//TRUE $<>0 Print to f06. DIFF Output-logical-default=FALSE. Difference flag. Set to TRUE if DB1 and DB2 differ.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Applies the given input rigid body motion to all Nastran physical grids2452 Main Index Applies the given input rigid body motion to all MSC Nastran physical grids by returning the output displacement, velocity and acceleration for all these grids which are consistent with the applied rigid body motion. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block:RIGIDIC Applies the given input rigid body motion to all Nastran physical grids RIGIDIC BGPDT,USET,CSTM,RMOTION,REFLOC / UVARIG/ISMATR/REFGRID/CHKSB $ BGPDT BGPDT DB USET USET DB CSTM CSTM DB RMOTION A 18X1 Vector, (NOTE: These should be machine precision) 1:3 - Translational Displacement Vector 4:6 - Translational Velocity Vector 7:9 - Translational ACC Vector 10:12 - Cartesian rotation vector at reference location 13:15 - Angular velocity vector at reference location 16:18 - Angular acceleration vector at reference location REFLOC Location in basic of reference point at which rigid motion is prescribed. UVARIG U, V, A vector of all the physical grids (G-size) consistent with the applied rigid body motion.

2453 RIGIDIC Applies the given input rigid body motion to all Nastran physical grids Main Index Parameters: Remarks: 1.Only one of the two quantities, REFLOC or REFGRID, may be supplied. If both of them are supplied the module will issue a fatal error. 2.If both REFLOC and REFGRID are not supplied. Then the origin of basic reference frame is assumed to be the reference location.ISMATR Input-logical-default=FALSE. The angular velocity/acceleration are provided in basic reference frame =FALSE Material reference frame =TRUE REFGRID Input-integer-default =-1. Internal grid number of grid reference with respect to which the rigid body motion is applied. CHKSB Input-integer-default=0. Debug flag.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Returns the inertial properties of the MSC Nastran model2454 Main Index Returns the inertial properties of the MSC Nastran model relative to the supplied reference location. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters: Remarks: 1.Only one of the two quantities, REFLOC or REFGRID, may be supplied. If both of them are supplied the module will issue a fatal error. 2.If both REFLOC and REFGRID are not supplied then the inertia properties are calculated relative to the origin of basic reference frame.RIGMASS Returns the inertial properties of the MSC Nastran model RIGMASS BGPDT,OGPWGW,REFLOC/ RINERTIA/REFGRID/CHKSB $ BGPDT BGPDT DB OGPWGW Output DB from GPWG REFLOC Location in basic of reference point relative to which the inertia properties are to be returned. RINERTIA A 18X1 Vector 1:1 - Mass 2:7 - Symmetric part of inertia matrix relative to REFLOC/REFGRID 8:10 - Location of CM relative to RELOC/REFGRID REFGRID Input-integer-default=-1. Internal grid number of grid reference with respect to which the inertia properties are to be calculated. CHKSB Input-integer-default=0. Debug flag.

2455 RMDUPBLK Removes duplicate records from the Bulk Data Main Index Removes duplicate records from the Bulk Data. Format: Input Data Blocks: None. Output Data Blocks: Parameters: Remarks: 1.BULK is both and input and output data block and therefore must be declared as an append file on the FILE statement. For example: 2.The actions taken by this module and tolerance for defining duplicate real numbers are both specified in system cell 402: 3.Only the CORD2C, CORD2R, CORD2S, and GRID Bulk Data entries are checked and candidates for deletion.RMDUPBLK Removes duplicate records from the Bulk Data RMDUPBLK /BULK/S,N,NEWBULK $ BULK Table of all sorted Bulk Data entries. NEWBULK Output-logical-default=FALSE. NEWBULK creation flag. FALSE No TRUE Yes FILE IBULK=APPEND $ RMDUPBLK /IBULK $ < 0.0 Nothing is done and no entries are deleted.

0.0 T olerance checking will be done to determine if the entries are deletable. = 0.0 No tolerance checks will be performed; only physically identical records will be deleted.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Processes radiation exchange coefficients2456 Main Index Processes radiation exchange coefficients to produce temperature heat flux transfer matrices. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:RMG2 Processes radiation exchange coefficients RMG2 EST,MPOOL,MUGNI,KGGNL,MPT,DIT,BGPDT,SIL,USET/ RDEST,RECM,RGG,KGGNL1/ TABS/SIGMA/S,N,NORADMAT/LUSET $ EST Element summary table. MPOOL T able of RADSET, RADLST , and RADMTX Bulk Data entry images MUGNI T emperature matrix for stiffness update. KGGNL Conduction matrix in g-set for material nonlinear elements only. MPT T able of Bulk Data entry images related to material properties. DIT T able of TABLEij Bulk Data entry images. BGPDT Basic grid point definition table. SIL Scalar index list. USET Degree-of-freedom set membership table for g-set. RDEST Radiation element summary table. RECM Radiation exchange coefficient matrix. RGG Radiation transfer matrix in the g-set. KGGNL1 Conduction matrix in g-set for material nonlinear elements only and updated for radiation. TABS Input-real-default=0.0. Absolute temperature conversion. For example, set to 273.16 when specifying temperatures in Celsius or 459.69 in Fahrenheit. SIGMA Input-real-default=0.0. The Stefan-Boltzmann constant. Used to compute radiant heat flux. NORADMAT Input/output-integer-default=-1. Radiation flag. 2No radiation. -1Initial radiation. 1Single band radiation with constant emissivity. 2Radiation with temperature dependent emissivity.

2457 RMG2 Processes radiation exchange coefficients Main Index Remark: If KGGNL is not purged then LUSET is determined from KGGNL.3Multiple band radiation with constant emissivity. LUSET Input-integer-no default. The number of degrees-of-freedom in the g-set.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Removes rotational dofs from reference grids2458 Main Index Remove rotational dofs from reference grid of RBE3 when the grid point is used by solid elements only. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:RMRGDROT Removes rotational dofs from reference grids RMRGDROT geom4,geom2/geom4n/S,N,GM4MOD/S,N,NOGORMRG $ geom4 geom4 datablock geom2 geom2 datablock geom4n geom4 datablock, output. GM4MOD Output-logical-default=FALSE. TRUE indicates some RBE3 entries have been modified. NOGORMRG Output-logical-default=FALSE. TRUE indicates error.

2459 RMSPRMDS Remove spurious modes Main Index Removes apparent spurious complex modes based on user input. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters: Remarks: 1.If RMSPRMDS =YES, then modes with natural frequency less than FREQTOL and damping greater than DAMPTOL are considered to be spurious modes. In addition, if a complex mode has a 0.0 natural frequency, but a non-zero real component, it is considered spurious also if RMZERO=’YES’.
All spurious modes are removed from the updated complex eigenvalue table and a partition vector is created, which can be used to remove them from the matrix containing the eigenvectors.RMSPRMDS Remove spurious modes RMSPRMDS CLAMA/CLAMANEW,PARTVEC/RMSPRMDS/FREQTOL/DAMPTOL/S,N,DIDIT $ CLAMA Complex eigenvalue table before removing spurious modes CLAMANEW Updated complex eigenvalue table after removing spurious modes PARTVEC Partition vector to remove spurious modes from eigenvector matrix RMSPRMDS Input-character-default = ‘NO’ - Flag to remove spurious modes FREQTOL Input-real-default = 1.E-8 - T olerance on natural frequency DAMPTOL Input-real-default = 1.E+8 - Tolerance on damping (modes with damping greater than DAMPTOL might be spurious modes) REMZERO Input-character-default = ‘NO’ - Remove modes with 0.0 natural frequency but non- zero real part of eigenvalue DIDIT Output-logical-default = False - Flag indicating whether there were spurious modes removed

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Generates a lower-triangular matrix LTR of order N used in Monte-Carlo Simulation to randomize the system matrices using the NPVM method.2460 Main Index Generates a lower-triangular matrix LTR of order N used in Monte-Carlo Simulation to randomize the system matrices using the NPVM method. Format: Output Data Block: Parameters: Remarks: 1.Before RNLOWTR can be used in work mode it needs to initialized MKL random stream using, RNDLOWTR /////0//S,N,SEED $ 2.SEED parameter is only relevant in Initialize mode and is ignored in work mode. 3.To deinitialize random stream use, RNDLOWTR /////-1//S,N,SEED $RNDLOWTR Generates a lower-triangular matrix LTR of order N used in Monte-Carlo Simulation to randomize the system matrices using the NPVM method. RNLOWTR /LTR/N/VAR/FACTOR/MODE/DBG/SEED LTR OUTPUT, LOWER TRIANGULAR MATRIX N SIZE OF THE LOWER TRIANGULAR MATRIX VAR STANDARD DEVIATION (SPREAD OR “WIDTH”) OF THE DISTRIBUTION FACTOR OFF DIAGONAL SCALING FACTOR MODE MODE IN WHICH THE MODULE OPERATES 0 = INITIALIZE MKL RANDOM STREAM, -1 = DEINITIALIZE MKL RANDOM STREAM, <> 0/-1 = DEFAULT, WORK MODE DBG DEBUG LEVEL SEED SEED FOR RANDOM NUMBER GENERATOR

2461 ROTENGY Calculate rotor modal energies Main Index Computes both modal strain and kinetic energy of rotors and identifies mode type. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:ROTENGY Calculate rotor modal energies ROTENGY CASES,MDD,KDD,UDR,UDI,UGR,UGI,CLAMA,ROTORDEF,ROTORUSE, ROTMAT,OROENi/ MROTSE,MROTKE,RMODTYP,OROEN/ DDVAL/S,N,RONGFLG $ CASES Table of Case Control command MDD Mass matrix for the d-set KDD Stiffness matrix for the d-set UDR Eigenvector matrix, d-set, Real component UDI Eigenvector matrix, d-set, Imaginary component UGR Eigenvector matrix, rotor g-set, Real component UGI Eigenvector matrix, rotor g-set, Imaginary component CLAMA Diagonal matrix with complex eigenvalues on the diagonal ROTORDEF Table with information about rotorid, axis and transformation matrix ROTORUSE Table of information related to RSPINR, RSPINT, and RGYRO entries ROTMAT Matrix of Rotor g-set family OROENi Table with information about existing rotor modal energies ROTORSE Matrix about rotor strain energies (%,current speed case) ROTORKE Matrix about rotor kinetic energies (%,current speed case) RMODTYP Matrix about rotor mode type (current speed case) OROEN Table with information about rotor modal energies (all speed cases) DDVAL Input, real, current rotor speed in Hz, no default RONGFLG Output, integer, no default. Flag of successful calculation -1 Unsuccessful, no rotor energy output DBs 0 Successful, Generate rotor energy output DBs

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Calculate rotor modal energies2462 Main Index Remarks: 1.ROTENGY is for both direct and modal complex eigenvalue analysis. 2.For the same subcase, the current speed energies are appended to the existing table in OROEN data block description. 3.Mode type identification is only for line rotor (ROTORG), and the meaning of two-character mode type are: FW - Forward Whirl (1) FP - Partial Forward Whirl (2) BW - Backward Whirl (3) BP - Partial Backward Whirl (4) AX - Axial Mode (5) TR - Torsion Mode (6) BE - Pure Bending Mode (7) MX - Mixed Whirl Mode (8) NA - Unidentified (0) XX - Other (static rotor, or 2D/3D rotor,-1)

item.title: User's Manual P125
item.description:
2463 ROTOR1 Generates the initial rotor data Main Index Generate the ROTORDEF data block that contains rotor definition information and a related ROTORWRK data block and writes the rotor dynamics summary to f06. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:ROTOR1 Generates the initial rotor data ROTOR1 BGPDT*, DYNAMIC, CSTM*, SEROT, HARMELPT, ROTAXDB*,SLIST, ROT3ELPT/ ROTORWRK,ROTORDEF,ROTORPVC/ CONFAC/APP/IPRINT/EXTSEID /QUAL /PASUID/IROTBRNT $ BGPDT* Family of Basic Grid Point Definition tables. DYNAMIC Table of Bulk Data entry images related to dynamics. CSTM* Family of coordinate system transformation matrix tables. SEROT List of superelement IDs followed by list of rotor IDs. HARMELPT Harmonic element table. ROTAXDB* Family of ROTAXDB matrices. SLIST Superelement processing list to matrix generation, assembly, and reduction. ROT3ELPT Element property table for 3D Rotors. ROTORWRK Rotor work table. ROTORDEF Rotor definition table. ROTORPVC Rotor partitioning vector. CONFAC Input-real-default=1.0E-6. T olerance for checking proper alignment of grids on axis of symmetry of rotors. APP Input-character-default=‘XXXXXXXX’. Analysis type. ‘CEIGEN’: Complex eigenvalues. ‘FREQRESP’: Frequency response. ‘TRANRESP’: T ransient response. ‘STATICS’: Statics.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Generates the initial rotor data2464 Main Index IPRINT Input-integer-default=1. Rotor summary print flag. 0: Do not print 1: Print (default) EXTSEID Input-integer-default=0. Superelement ID. QUAL Input-character-default=’XXXXXXXX’. Qualifier used to retrieve ROTORDEF data blocks belonging to upstream superelements. PASUID Input-integer-default=0. Part superelement ID. IROTBRNT Input-integer-default=0. ROTBRNT ID in case control.

2465 ROTOR2 Generates rotor data based on RGYRO, RSPINR, RPSINT, and UNBALNC entries Main Index Generate the ROTORUSE data block that contains information about the RGYRO, RSPINR and RSPINT entries. It also generates the UNBCSTM and UNBTAB data blocks containing information about UNBALNC entries. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters: Remark: 1.GEOM3 is required for SYNC frequency response only.ROTOR2 Generates rotor data based on RGYRO, RSPINR, RPSINT, and UNBALNC entries ROTOR2 BGPDT*,DYNAMIC,CSTM*,EPART,EDOM,ROTORDEF,CASES ,GEOM3 / ROTORUSE,UNBCSTM,UBTAB/CONFAC/APP/EFLAG $ BGPDT* Family of Basic Grid Point Definition tables. DYNAMIC Table of Bulk Data entry images related to dynamics. CSTM* Family of coordinate system transformation matrix tables. EPART Partitioning vector from p-set or d-set to e-set. EDOM Table of Bulk Data entries related to design sensitivity and optimization. ROTORDEF Rotor definition table. CASES Table of Case control entries. GEOM3 Table of Bulk Data entry images related to static and thermal loads with DAREA entry images converted to equivalent FORCE and MOMENT entry images. ROTORUSE Table of information related to RSPINR, RSPINT, and RGYRO entries. UNBCSTM 3x3 matrix with coordinate system transformations to go from rotor to global (for the displacements). UNBTAB Table to identify those transformations with one record for each UNBALNC entry. CONFAC Input-real-default=1.0E-6. T olerance for checking proper alignment of grids on axis of symmetry of rotors. APP Input-character-default=‘XXXXXXXX’. Analysis type. ‘CEIGEN’ : Complex eigenvalues. ‘FREQRESP’ : Frequency response. ‘TRANRESP’ : T ransient response. ‘STATICS’ : Statics. EFLAG Input-integer-default=1. E-set existence flag.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Generate the rotor transformation matrix.2466 Main Index Generate the rotor transformation matrix. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters:ROTORTMT Generate the rotor transformation matrix. ROTORTMT BGPDT,HARMELPT/ ROTORTMT/ CONFAC/IPRINT/ROTORID $ BGPDT Basic grid point definition table. HARMELPT Harmonic element table ROTORTMT Rotor transformation matrix CONFAC Input-real-default=1.0E-6. Tolerance for checking proper alignment of grids on axis of symmetry of rotors. IPRINT Input-integer-default=1. Rotor summary print flag. 0: Do not print 1: Print (default) ROTORID Input-integer-default=0. Rotor ID.

2467 ROTRDR1 Creates coriolis and circulation matrices Main Index Creates coriolis and circulation matrices based on rotordynamics user input and also drives DMAP rotor loop. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:ROTRDR1 Creates coriolis and circulation matrices ROTRDR1 BGPDT,CSTM,ROTOR,MG6,ROTORT/ BCGG,TI,VGROT/ S,N,RECNUM/S,N,ROTORID/CONFAC/WTMASS/ S,N,METHSID/S,N,SDAMPSID/S,N,KDAMP/APP/ROTPRNT / S,N,ROTRSEID/S,N,PRTEIG $ BGPDT Basic grid point definition table. CSTM Table of coordinate system transformation matrices. ROTOR Table of rotordynamics user input. MG6 ROTORT Table of rotordynamics user input for transient analysis. BCGG TI VGROT RECNUM Input/output-integer-default=1. ROTORID Input/output-integer-default=0. CONFAC Input-real-default=1.0E-5. WTMASS Input-real-default=0.0. Scale factor on structural mass matrix. METHSID Output-integer-default=0. Eigenvalue extraction entry set identification number. SDAMPSID Output-integer-default=0. Modal damping (TABDMP1) entry set identification number. KDAMP Output-integer-default=0. Viscous modal to structural damping flag. If set to -1, then viscous modal damping (SDAMPING Case Control command) will be included in the stiffness matrix as structural damping: 1 Yes 2 No

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Creates coriolis and circulation matrices2468 Main Index APP Input-character-default=‘XXXXXXXX’. Analysis type. ‘CEIGEN’ Complex eigenvalues. ‘FREQRESP’ Frequency response. ‘‘TRANRESP’ T ransient response. ‘STATICS’ Statics. ROTPRNT Input-integer-default=0. <>0 Print. =0 Do not print. ROTRSEID Input/output-integer-default=0. PRTEIG Output-integer-default=0. Flag to print eigenvalue summary from hybrid damping calculation. 1 Yes 0 No

2469 ROTRDR2 Set parameters for Rotordynamic looping Main Index Set parameters for rotordynamic looping. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: None. Parameters:ROTRDR2 Set parameters for Rotordynamic looping ROTRDR2 , ROTORDEF, ROTORUSE, DYNAMICS //S,N,IRECNUM/APP/FREQTIME/ S,N,IROTOR/S,N,SYNCFLAG/S,N,ALPHA/S,N,BETA/ S,N,GR/S,N,RAVG/ S,N,ALPHAR1/S,N,ALPHAR2/S,N,WR3R/S,N,WR4R/S,N,WRHR/ S,N,SPINFLAG/S,N, ROTRSEID/S,N,FRAMETYP/S,N,ROTTYP/MSGFLAG $ CASECC Table of Case Control command images. DIT Table of TABLEi, entry images. ROTORDEF Table containing info of each rotor (ROTORG/ROTORAX/ROTOR) types, frame, axis, etc. ROTORUSE Table containing info of all RGYRO, RSPINR, RSPINT cards. DYNAMICS Table of bulk data entry images related to Dynamics. IRECNUM Input/output-integer-default=1. APP Input-character-default=’ ‘. FREQTIME Input-real-default=0.0. IROTOR Output-integer-default=0 SYNCFLAG Output-integer-default=0 ALPHA Output-real-default=0.0 BETA Output-real-default=0.0 GR Output-real-default=0.0 RAVG Output-real-default=0.0. ALPHAR1 Output-real-default=0.0. Rayleigh damping coefficient for the rotor.CASECC DIT   

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Set parameters for Rotordynamic looping2470 Main Index ALPHAR2 Output-real-default=0.0. Rayleigh damping coefficient for the rotor. WR3R Output-real-default=0.0 (as specified in RSPINR entry) WR4R Output-real-default=0.0 (as specified in RSPINR entry) WRHR Output-real-default=0.0 (as specified in RSPINR entry) SPINFLAG Output-real-default=1.0 ROTRSEID Output-Integer-default=0 FRAMETYP Output-Integer-default=1 ROTTYP Output-integer-default=0 MSGFLAG Input-integer-default=0

2471 ROTRUTL Perform various utilities for rotordynamics processing. Main Index Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameters:ROTRUTL Perform various utilities for rotordynamics processing. ROTRUTL I1,I2,I3,I4,I5,I6/O1,O2,O3/ P1/P2/P3/P4/P5/P6/P7/P8/P9/P10/P11/P12 /P13/ P14/P15/P16/P17/P18/P19 $ Ii Input data blocks. I1 through I6 are supplied depending on the value P1. Oi Output datablocks depending on the value P1. P1 Input-integer-no default. Option selection described in the table that follows. P2 Input-integer-default=0. Parametric data depending on P1. P3 Input-real-default=0.0. Parametric data depending on P1. P4 Input-integer-default=0. Parametric data depending on P1. P5 Input-character-default=blank. Parametric data depending on P1. P6 Input- integer-default=0. Parametric data depending on P1. P7 Input-real-default=0.0. Parametric data depending on P1. P8 Input-real-default=0.0. Parametric data depending on P1. P9 Input-real-default=1.0. Parametric data depending on P1. P10 Input-real-default=0.0. Parametric data depending on P1. P11 Input-real-default=0.0. Parametric data depending on P1. P12 Input-real-default=0.0. Parametric data depending on P1. P13 Logical-default=False Parametric data depending on P1. P14 Input- Integer- default=0 Parametric data depending on P1. P15 Input- Integer -default=0 Parametric data depending on P1. P16 Input- Integer -default=0 Parametric data depending on P1. P17 Input- Integer -default=0 Parametric data depending on P1. P18 Input- Integer -default=0 Parametric data depending on P1. P19 Input- Integer -default=0 Parametric data depending on P1.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Perform various utilities for rotordynamics processing.2472 Main Index Remarks: Each option corresponds to a different value of the first parameter, P1. The following summary table provides descriptions of the options. List of Options P1 Description Option P1= 1 Compute a mass matrix consistent with the provided inertia forces. Option P1 = 2 Process the data on NLHARM , NHRMPRM and NLFREQi Bulk Data entries to create the excitation frequency list, harmonic output list and read all the analysis parameters. Option P1 = 3 Create asynchronous RGYRO data for a given rotor speed. Option P1 = 4 Modify element properties in EPT in a Campbell loop based on user- supplied values as a function of speed. Option P1 = 5 Extract the rotor ID and superelement ID in which the rotor is located from an RGYRO Bulk Data entry. Option P1 = 6 Count the number of rotors and the number of rotors defined on ROTORSE Bulk Data entries. Option P1 = 7 Convert ROTORSE rotors to ROTORG rotors by modifying the DYNAMIC table. Option P1 = 8 Create a table of the nonlinear force entities (NLRGAP , NOLINi, NLRSFD) activated by the case control, and a D size partition vector for the loaded degrees-of-freedom. Option P1 = 9 Extract a specific harmonic solution from the converged solution of Fourier components. Option P1 = 10 Create the time domain transformation Fourier coefficient matrices corresponding to the requested number of user defined harmonics. Option P1 = 11 Compute the time domain displacement and velocity solutions on the degrees-of-freedom where nonlinear forces are defined. Option P1 = 12 Convert the Fourier components into Bulk Data formatted TIC entries for a specific harmonic. Option P1 = 13 Single value table lookup. Option P1 = 14 Determine convergence and line search parameters. Option P1 = 15 Compute a transformation matrix from rotor coordinate systems to global coordinate systems for unbalance forces. Option P1 = 16 Compute a partitioning vector for unbalance loading. Option P1 = 17 Extract values on the DAMPING Bulk Data entry to DMAP parameters.

2473 ROTRUTL Perform various utilities for rotordynamics processing. Main Index Option P1= 1 Compute a G-size mass matrix consistent a set of inertia forces. Format: Input Data Blocks Output Data Block: Remarks: 1.The input matrix should be G rows by 6 columns with the inertia forces due to acceleration in 6 orthogonal directions. 2.The output matrix is a G size by G size, 3x3 block diagonal matrix. Option P1 = 2 Process the data on NLHARM , NHRMPRM , NLFREQi and NLFREQC Bulk Data entries to create the excitation frequency list, harmonic output list and read all the analysis parameters. Format:Option P1 = 18 Extract values on the HYBDAMP Bulk Data entry to DMAP parameters. Option P1 = 19 Update the output table with the table of user defined rotor speeds in transient analysis. Option P1 = 20 Update the output table with the table of user defined rotor speeds in nonlinear harmonic analysis. ROTRUTL FINRL,BGPDT/MINRL/1 $ FINRL Inertial forces due to unit acceleration. BGPDT Basic Grid Point Definition Table. MINRL Mass matrix consistent with the input inertial forces. ROTRUTL CASECC,DYNAMIC/FRL,OUTLST/2/S,N,NHARM/S,N,SUBFAC S,N,XNLHRED//S,N,XNHPLUS/ S,N,XNLHTOL/S,N,XNLHTWK/
S,N,MFRINT/ / / / / S,N,XMXICODE/S,N,XTICPNCH/ S,N,MNCSF/S,N,NLHDIAG/ S,N,NLHIC/S,N,CONTP / S,N,FREQINI/S,N,STEPINI/S,N, MINSIZE/S,N,MAXSIZE/ S,N,MAXSTEP/S,N,MINFREQ/S,N,MAXFREQ/S,N,DERINC/S,N,PRTOUT / S,N,DECOMP/S,N,HALFCNT $P1 Description

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Perform various utilities for rotordynamics processing.2474 Main Index Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:CASECC Case Control data block containing the NLHARM command. DYNAMIC T able of Bulk Data Entries related to dynamics. NLHARM, NLFREQ, NLFREQ1, NLFREQC and NLHOUT records are read. FRL Frequency response list. OUTLST T able of harmonics from zero to NHARM. NHARM Output-integer. The number of harmonics to include in the solution entered on the NLHARM entry. SUBFAC Output-real. The factor for capturing sub-harmonic response entered on the NLHARM entry. XNLHRED Parameter NLHRED defined in NHRMPRM entry. XNHPLUS Parameter NLHPLUS defined in NHRMPRM entry. XNLHTOL Parameter NLHTOL defined in NHRMPRM entry. XNLHTWK Parameter NLHTWK defined in NHRMPRM entry. MFRINT Parameter MFRINT defined in NHRMPRM entry. XMXICODE Parameter MXICODE0 defined in NHRMPRM entry. XTICPNCH Parameter TICPNCH defined in NHRMPRM entry. MNCSF Parameter MNCSFS defined in NHRMPRM entry. MFRINT Parameter MFRINT defined in NHRMPRM entry. NLHDIAG Parameter NLHDIAG defined in NHRMPRM entry. NLHIC Parameter NLHIC defined in NHRMPRM entry. CONTP Parameter CONTP defined in NHRMPRM entry. FREQINI Output-real-default=0.0. Parameter FREQINI defined in NLFREQC entry. STEPINI Output-real-default=0.0. Parameter STEPINI defined in NLFREQC entry. MINSIZE Output-real-default=0.0. Parameter MINSIZE defined in NLFREQC entry. MAXSIZE Output-real-default=0.0. Parameter MAXSIZE defined in NLFREQC entry. MAXSTEP Output-integer-default=0. Parameter MAXSTEP defined in NLFREQC entry. MINFREQ Output-real-default=0.0. Parameter MINFREQ defined in NLFREQC entry. MAXFREQ Output-real-default=0.0. Parameter MAXFREQ defined in NLFREQC entry. DERINC Output-real-default=0.0. Parameter DERINC defined in NLFREQC entry. PRTOUT Output-logical-default=FALSE. Parameter PRTOUT defined in NLFREQC entry.

2475 ROTRUTL Perform various utilities for rotordynamics processing. Main Index Remarks: 1.The frequency response list is automatically assigned a set ID of 2005. The Case Control must be modified to change word 14 (FEQRESET) to reflect this. Example: Generate a new FRL datablock with the NLFREQi frequencies. Modify word 14 in the case control to correspond to the new NLFREQi set ID. ROTRUTL CASECC,DYNAMIC/FRLNLH,NLHOUT/2/
S,N,NHARM/S,N,SUBFAC $
EQUIVX FRLNLH/FRL/-1 $
PARAML CASECC/CASEFNLH/‘TABREPI’/1/14//2005 $ EQUIVX CASEFNLH/CASECC/-1 $ Option P1 = 3 Create asynchronous RGYRO data for a given rotor speed. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameter: Remarks: 1.The RGYRO entry SYNCFLG field is automatically modified to “ASYNC” and the SPDUNIT field to “FREQ”. Option P1 = 4 Modify element properties in EPT in a Campbell loop based on user-supplied values as a function of speed.PRTOUT Output-logical-default=FALSE. Parameter PRTOUT defined in NLFREQC entry DECOMP Output-logical-default =‘LU’. Parameter DECOMP defined in NHRMPRM entry HALFCNT Output-logical-default=8. Parameter HALFCNT defined in NHRMPRM entry ROTRUTL CASECC,ROTORUSE/ROTORNEW/3//SPEED $ CASECC Case Control table containing the RGYRO command. ROTORUSE Table of RYGRO, RSPINR, and RSPINT data. ROTOR NEW Table of modified RGYRO data. SPEED Input-real. The rotor speed used to modify the SPEED field on the RGYRO entry.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Perform various utilities for rotordynamics processing.2476 Main Index Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameters: Option P1 = 5 Extract the rotor ID and superelement ID in which the rotor is located from an RGYRO entry. Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Blocks: None. Parameters: Remark: 1.If the ROTORUSE table does not exist, REFROTR is set to 0. 2.If the selected RGYRO entry is not found in ROTORUSE, REFROTR is set to -1.ROTRUTL XPT/XPTX/4/PID/DDVALUE/FID/ITYPE $ XPT Element or material property table to modify. XPTX Modified element or material property table. PID Input-integer. The property or material ID to modify. DDVAL Input-real. The new value to assign to the property or material value. FID Input-integer. The word position in XPT output from CAMPREP . ITYPE Input-integer. Modification type output from CAMPREP . ROTRUTL ROTORUSE//5/IRGYRO//S,N,REFROTR/S,N,REFSEID $ $ ROTORUSE T able of modified RGYRO data. IRGYRO Input-integer. The ID of the RGYRO entry. REFROTR Output-integer. The rotor ID defined in the REFROTR field of the selected RGYRO entry. REFSEID Output-integer. The superelement ID defined in the ROTRSEID field of the selected RGYRO entry.

2477 ROTRUTL Perform various utilities for rotordynamics processing. Main Index Option P1 = 6 Count the number of rotors and the number of rotors defined on ROTORSE Bulk Data entries. Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameters: Remark: 1.If no ROTORSE entries are present, NUMROT contains the total number of rotors and SEROT is purged. 2.The linked list in SEROT is sorted by ascending rotor ID. Option P1 = 7 Convert ROTORSE rotors to ROTORG rotors by modifying the DYNAMIC table. Format: Input Data Block:ROTRUTL DYNAMIC/SEROT/6/S,N,NUMROT//S,N,NUMSE $ DYNAMIC Table of bulk data entries related to dynamics containing the ROTORG and ROTORSE entries. SEROT Table containing a linked list of superelement, rotor ID and SEOPT type (from the ROTORSE entry), if ROTORSE entries are present. NUMROT Output-integer. T otal number of all rotors. NUMSE Output-integer. T otal number of ROTORSE type rotors. ROTRUTL DYNAMIC,PRTVEC,SEROT,BGPDT/DYNAMICX/7/INDEX $ DYNAMIC Table of bulk data entries related to dynamics containing the ROTORG and ROTORSE entries. PRTVEC A G size partition vector indicating the locations of the G set or A set DOFs. See remark 1. SEROT Table containing a linked list of superelement ID, rotor ID and SEOPT type (based on the ROTORSE entry). BGPDT Basic grid point definition table .

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Perform various utilities for rotordynamics processing.2478 Main Index Output Data Block: Parameters: Remark: 1.Depending on the value of SEOPT defined on the bulk data ROTORSE entry for a rotor, PRTVEC may be a G size unit vector or a G size A-set partitioning vector. 2.SEROT is output from ROTRUTL option 6. 3.If the rotor selected by INDEX is not in a superelement, the module outputs DYNAMICX unmodified. Option P1 = 8 Create a table of the nonlinear force entities (NLRGAP , NOLINi, NLRSFD) activated by the case control, and a D size partition vector for the loaded DOFs. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks:DYNAMICX Modified dynamic table where the ROTORSE entries have been replaced with ROTORG entries. INDEX Input-integer. A pointer into SEROT to select a rotor ID such that the relevant rows of PRTVEC may be selected. ROTRUTL DYNAMIC,CASECC,BGPDT,EVEC,USETD,DIT/ HARM1,PTVEC/8/S,N,UVAFLAG $ DYNAMIC T able of bulk data entries related to dynamics containing the NLRGAP , NLRSFD and NOLINi entries. CASECC Case control datablock containing the NONLINEAR command. BGPDT Basic Grid Point Definition Table. EVEC A D size partitioning vector with a 1 at every location of an EPOINT. USETD Degree-of-freedom set membership table for the P-set. DIT T able of TABLEij Bulk Data entry images. HARM1 Sorted table describing all nonlinear applied loads (used by the NLHARM module). PTVEC A D size partition vector identifying all DOF loaded by nonlinear forces.

2479 ROTRUTL Perform various utilities for rotordynamics processing. Main Index Parameter: Option P1 = 9 Extract a specific harmonic solution from the converged solution of Fourier components. Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameters: Remark: 1.P1 may be 9 or -9. If -9 is entered, an additional header message is output by the module to standard output.UVAFLAG Output-integer. A bit mask integer describing the content of the nonlinear forces. Bit 1 is used to indicate forces as a function of displacements, bit 2 for forces as a function of velocity and bit 3 for forces as a function of acceleration. Consequently, the following integer values are possible: 0 - None 1 - Displacement only 2 - Velocity only 3 - Displacement and velocity 4 - Acceleration only 5 - Displacement and acceleration 6 - Velocity and acceleration 7 - Displacement, velocity and acceleration ROTRUTL U/UAVG/9/NHARM/FREQ/CON_DIV//ISUBFAC $ U The converged solution of Fourier components. UAVG Complex solution vector of the harmonics. NHARM Input-integer. The number of harmonics in the solution vector. FREQ Input-real. The frequency of the converged solution. CONDIV Input-integer. The number of iterations performed to find the converged solution or before a diverging solution was detected. ISUBFAC Input-integer. The specific harmonic to extract.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Perform various utilities for rotordynamics processing.2480 Main Index 2.Matrix U is a one column, D*(2NHARM + 1) rows real vector, where D is D size. 3.Matrix UAVG is a D size complex vector. Option P1 = 10 Create the time domain transformation Fourier coefficient matrices corresponding to the requested number of user defined harmonics. Format: Input Data Blocks: None. Output Data Blocks: Parameters: Remark: 1.FDMAT is output at size (2NHARM+1) rows and (2NHARM+1+AALIAS) columns. 2.FVMAT is output at size (2NHARM) rows and (2*NHARM+1+AALIAS) columns. 3.FVMAT is normalized to unit frequency. Option P1 = 11 Compute the time domain displacement and velocity solutions on the DOF where nonlinear forces are defined. Format: Input Data Blocks:ROTRUTL /FDMAT,FVMAT/10/NHARM//AALIAS $ FDMAT Fourier coefficient transformation for displacement. FVMAT Fourier coefficient transformation for velocity. NHARM Input-integer. The number of harmonic terms to generate in the coefficients (output from ROTRUTL option 2). AALIAS Input-integer. Anti-aliasing parameter. The number of additional Fourier terms to prevent aliasing. ROTRUTL U,PTVEC,MATRIX,MATRIXV/UT,VT/11 $ U The converged solution of Fourier components. PTVEC A D size partition vector identifying all DOF loaded by nonlinear forces, output from ROTRUTL option 8.

2481 ROTRUTL Perform various utilities for rotordynamics processing. Main Index Output Data Blocks: Remark: 1.FVMAT may be purged, in which case VT will also be purged. Option P1 = 12 Convert the Fourier components into TIC Bulk Data entries for a specific harmonic. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: None. Parameters: Remark: 1.The TIC Bulk Data entries are written to the punch unit. 2.The TIC Bulk Data entries may be used as initial conditions for a transient response analysis. Option P1 = 13 Single value table lookup.FDMAT Fourier coefficient transformation for displacement, output from ROTRUTL option 10. FVMAT Fourier coefficient transformation for velocity, output from ROTRUTL option 10. UT Time domain displacements for the DOF loaded by nonlinear forces. VT Time domain velocities for the DOF loaded by nonlinear forces. ROTRUTL DYNAMIC,BGPDT,EVEC,U//12/TICID/FREQ/NHARM $ DYNAMIC Table of bulk data entries related to dynamics containing any EPOINT entries. BGPDT Basic Grid Point Definition Table. EVEC A D-size partitioning vector with a 1 at every location of an EPOINT . U The converged solution of Fourier components. TICID Input-integer. The set ID of the TIC bulk entries to be generated. FREQ Input-real. The cyclic frequency. NHARM Input-integer. The number of harmonics in the solution vector.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Perform various utilities for rotordynamics processing.2482 Main Index Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Blocks: None. Parameters: Remark: 1.For a successful look up, INFO is set to 0. INFO is set to -1 for “no value” found. Option P1 = 14 Determine convergence and line search parameters. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block:ROTRUTL DIT//13/TABID/S,N,VALUE/S,N,INFO $ DIT T able of TABLEij bulk data entry images. TABID Input-integer. The table ID on which to perform the look up. VALUE Input/output-real. On input, this is the abscissa (X) value of the table. On output, this is the ordinate (Y) value at the corresponding X location. INFO Output-integer. Diagnostic flag. ROTRUTL RESU0,RESU1/HISTORY/14/CODE/NLHTOL $ RESU0 Matrix of system unbalance forces where the residual force is negligible. RESU1 Matrix of trail system unbalance forces. HISTORY History parameters from previous module executions.

item.title: User's Manual P126
item.description:
2483 ROTRUTL Perform various utilities for rotordynamics processing. Main Index Parameters: Remark: 1.Residual force is computed from (Applied loads + Nonlinear forces) – (system forces). 2.NLHTOL may be changed by user definable parameter PARAM,NLHTOL. Option P1 = 15 Process UNBALNC Bulk Data entries. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block:ICODE Input-integer. Decision logic parameter. Used to drive DMAP decision logic. -1= Accept the updated displacement solution and increment, but no need to update the tangent matrix. 0= Do not accept the updated displacement solution. T ry the increment size stored in the output table. 1= Accept the updated displacement solution and increment, and update the tangent matrix. 2 = Accept the updated displacement solution and increment, and the complete solution is found. This frequency has converged. NLHTOL Input-real. Iteration acceptance tolerance (default is 1.0E-5). ROTRUTL UNCSTM,UNTAB/UNGRG/15/I//PEID UNCSTM 3x3 matrix with coordinate system transformations to go from rotor to global (for the displacements). Output from ROTOR2 module. UNTAB Table to identify those transformations better each record in UNTAB is for one UNBALNC entry. There are 5 words per record = (unbalnc_id, seid, rotor_id, g-size). Output from ROTOR2 module. UNGRG g-size rows by 6 columns that gives a rotor-to-global transformation matrices.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Perform various utilities for rotordynamics processing.2484 Main Index Parameters: Option P1 = 16 Process UNBALNC Bulk Data entries. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters:I Input-integer. An integer between 1 and the number of UNBALNC Bulk Data entries. PEID Output-integer. The superelement that UNBALNC can be found in. ROTRUTL CASECC,UNTAB/PTVEC/16/FLAG CASECC Case Control table. Reads word 446 for RGYRO set selection. UNTAB T able to identify those transformations better each record in UNTAB is for one UNBALNC entry. There are 5 words per record = (unbalnc_id, seid, rotor_id, g-size). Output from ROTOR2 module. PTVEC Partitioning vector which has a zero at for every unbalance entry in UNTAB that is selected by RGYRO and a one if not selected. FLAG Input-integer. Action taken: -1: take everything (all zeros in PTVEC) 0: take some but not others +1: take nothing (all ones in PTVEC)

2485 ROTRUTL Perform various utilities for rotordynamics processing. Main Index Option P1 = 17 Extract values from DAMPING Bulk Data entry. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: None. Parameters:ROTRUTL DYNAMIC//17/S,N,DAMPID/S,N,HYBRID/// S,N,ALPHA1/S,N,ALPHA2/S,N,GEFACT/S,N,W3/S,N,W4/ S,N,WH/S,N,ROTSEP DYNAMIC Table containing data on DAMPING Bulk Data entries. DAMPID Input-integer. DAMPING Bulk Data entry ID. <=0: No action is taken.

0: If there is no DAMPING entry in DYNAMIC corresponding to DAMPID, then module will not fail but returns with -DAMPID as the second parameter. HYBRID Output-integer. Identification number of HYBDAMP entry for hybrid damping. ALPHA1 Output-real. Scale factor for mass portion of Rayleigh damping. ALPHA2 Output-real. Scale factor for stiffness portion of Rayleigh damping GEFACT Output-real. Scale factor for material damping. W3 Output-real. Average frequency for calculation of structural damping in transient response. W4 Output-real. Average frequency for calculation of material damping in transient response. WH Output-real. Average frequency for calculation of hybrid ‘structural’ damping in transient response. ROTSEP Output-logical. Inclusion flag for rotor stiffness and mass in the calculation of damping. TRUE: Exclude. FALSE: Include.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Perform various utilities for rotordynamics processing.2486 Main Index Option P1 = 18 Extract values from HYBDAMP Bulk Data entry. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: None. Parameters:ROTRUTL DYNAMIC//1 8/S,N,HYBRIDID//S,N,METHOD/S,N,KDAMP/ S,N,SDAMP///////S,N,PRTEIG DYNAMIC T able containing data on DAMPING Bulk Data entries. HYBRIDID Input-integer. HYBDAMP B ulk Data entry ID. If there is no HYBDAMP entry in DYNAMIC corresponding to HYBRIDID or HYBRIDID ≤ 0, then module will not exit analysis but returns a UFM “ID REFERENCED BY THE HYBDMAP CASE CONTROL COMMAND WAS NOT FOUND”. METHOD Output-integer. Identification number of METHOD entry for modes calculation. SDAMP Output-integer. Identification number of TABDMP1 entry for modal damping specification. KDAMP Output-integer. Selects modal “structural” damping. PRTEIG Output-logical. Controls printout of eigenvalue summary. TRUE: Print FALSE: Do not print.

2487 ROTRUTL Perform various utilities for rotordynamics processing. Main Index Option P1 = 19 Update the output table with the table of user defined rotor speeds in transient analysis. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Remark: 1.UDEFSFD should be declared APPEND on a FILE statement. Option P1 = 20 Update the output table with the table of user defined rotor speeds in nonlinear harmonic analysis. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Remark: 1.UDEFSFD should be declared APPEND on a FILE statement.ROTRUTL BGPDT,ROTORDEF,ROTORUSE/UDEFSFD/19 $ BGPDT Basic Grid Point Definition Table. ROTORDEF Table with information about rotor ID, axis and transformation matrix. ROTORUSE Table of information related to RSPINR, RSPINT, and RGYRO entries. UDEFSFD Updated table of user-defined squeeze film damper (NLRSFD) data. ROTRUTL BGPDT,ROTORDEF,ROTORUSE,CASECC/UDEFSFD/20 $ BGPDT Basic Grid Point Definition Table. ROTORDEF Table with information about rotor ID, axis and transformation matrix. ROTORUSE Table of information related to RSPINR, RSPINT, and RGYRO entries. CASECC Case Control data block containing the NONLINEAR command. UDEFSFD Updated table of user-defined squeeze film damper (NLRSFD) data.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Rotor Super-element Check.2488 Main Index For a given Super-Element ID, check if any of its UP-stream Super-Element has any rotor. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters:ROTseCHK Rotor Super-element Check. ROTseCHK ROTsrs/ ROTseUP/ SEID/S,N,ROTseFLG ROTsrs A table described in “rotsrs.ddl”. ROTseUP A table with 2 words (ROTORID, rotrSEID) for each UP-stream SE that contains any rotor. SEID Integer Input, Current Super-Element ID. ROTseFLG Logical Output, True if any UP-stream SE has rotor.

2489 ROTseCUP List all the rotors defined in upstream superelements. Main Index To create ROTsrs table by looping through all Super-Elements and chain up to find rotor IDs in all UP- stream Super-Elements. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters: None.ROTseCUP List all the rotors defined in upstream superelements. ROTseCUP ROTORDEF,SLIST/ ROTsrs/ ROTORDEF Rotor Definition Table. SLIST Super-element List Table. ROTsrs A table described in “rotsrs.ddl”.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Converts transient response motion for plotting2490 Main Index Converts transient response motion to response spectra output suitable for plotting. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters: Example: Excerpt from subDMAP SEDRCVR: DO WHILE ( RECORD<>-1 ) $ RSPEC FRL,OUGV2,SPSEL/OXRESP/S,N,RECORD $ IF ( RECORD>=0 ) THEN $ IF ( RSPRINT>=0 ) OFP OXRESP//S,N,CARDNO $ XYTRAN XYCDBDR,OXRESP,,,,/XYPLTSS/‘RSPEC’/‘PSET’/ S,N,PFILE/S,N,CARDNO/S,N,NOXYPLT/TABID $ IF ( NOXYPLT>=0 ) XYPLOT XYPLTSS// $ ENDIF $ RECORD>=0 ENDDO $ RECORD<>-1 RSPEC Converts transient response motion for plotting RSPEC FRL,OUG2,SPSEL,OVG2/ OXRESP/ S,N,SPSELREC/DVAFLAG $ FRL Frequency response list. OUG2 T able of displacements in SORT1 format from transient response analysis. SPSEL T able of response spectra generation correlation selections. OVG2 T able of velocities in SORT2 format. OXRESP T able of response spectra in SORT2 format. SPSELREC Input/output-integer-default=0. Last record number processed in SPSEL. Set to -1 when processing last record. DVAFLAG Input-integer-default=-1. Flag indicating velocities are contained in separate data blocks and any associated outputs follow suit. -1Velocities are contained in OUG2. 1Velocities are contained in OVG2

2491 RSTBNM Reset the values of various frequency parameters because of changing BUSHNM from YES to N O Main Index Reset the values of the PFexis, fp, and newmx parameters. It also remove the GPFDR output request. Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Block: Parameter:RSTBNM Reset the values of various frequency parameters because of changing BUSHNM from YES to NO RSTBNM CASECCI/ CASECCO/ S,N,MODCCC $ CASECCI Case Control T able CASECCO Modified Case Control T able MODCCC Flag indicating if CASECC data block is modified.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Check duplicate param entries.2492 Main Index Check duplicate param entries between a restart run and its initial run. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: No Parameters:RSTCHKPV Check duplicate param entries. RSTCHKPV PVT*,PVT0//ITOLEXP/S,N,NUMDUP $ PVT* Input PVT datablock of the restart run. PVT0 Input PVT datablock from the initial run. ITOLEXP Input-integer-default=8. Precision tolerance exponent. T wo numbers x and y are considered equal if NUMDUP Output-integer number of duplicate param entries found.XY– XY+ 10ITOLEXP –

2493 SBRESV Compute residual vector for real coupled modes Main Index Compute residual vector for real coupled modes using subspace iteration method followed by SBSPITR. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:SBRESV Compute residual vector for real coupled modes SBRESV VR,VL,PAN,VAFS,KSAA,KFAA,ASFX,CK, CH,KXX,MXX,RUX,RPX , MSAA, MFAA /RSV1,RSV2 / NCM/EIGMIN/TOL/NOSMS/NOSMF/NOSMSB/NOSMFB /APPFLG/SMALLEIG / $ VR Right eigenvector VL Left eigenvector PAN PG filtered and normalized VAFS Structure/Fluid partition vector KSAA Structural stiffness matrix KFAA Fluid stiffness matrix ASFX Acoustic coupling term CK Cholesky decomposition of KSAA CH Cholesky decomposition of KFAA KXX Total structure and fluid coupled stiffness matrix MXX Total structure and fluid coupled mass matrix RUX Partition vector consistent with Projection matrix for nonsingular structure matrix KSAA RPX Partition vector consistent with Projection matrix for nonsingular fluid matrix KFAA MSAA Structural mass matrix MFAA Fluid mass matrix RSV1 Dependent residual vector RSV2 Independent residual vector NCM Input-integer-default=0. Number of modes found EIGMIN Input-real-default=0.0. Minimum eigenvalue for residual vector TOL Input-real-default=0.0. Eigenvalue difference tolerance NOSMS Input-integer-default=-1. Number of rigid body vectors (-1 IF NONE) NOSMF Input-integer-default=-1. Number of constant pressure vectors (-1 IF NONE)

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Compute residual vector for real coupled modes2494 Main Index NOSMSB Input-integer-default=-1. Number of constant pressure vector after added mobility NOSMFB Input-integer-default=-1. Number of rigid body vector after added flexibility APPFLG Input-integer-default=0. Flag to skip inertia relief effect. (If APPFLG > 0, consider only static load effects). SMALLEIG Input-real-default=0.0. Eigenvalue threshold for residual vector to filter null value.

2495 SBSPITR Solves real coupled modes and corresponding coupled eigenvectors Main Index Solves real coupled modes and corresponding coupled eigenvectors using subspace iteration method. Format: Input Data Blocks:SBSPITR Solves real coupled modes and corresponding coupled eigenvectors SBSPITR KSAA,KFAA,MSAA,MFAA,AAA,VAFS,YSTRT,HKBAR, LYY,XUS,XUE,JP,JUHAT,RUX,RROOTS,RROOTF, XPS,RP, PHSA,PHFA,LAMMATS,LAMMATF/ CLAMAX,VR,VL,LAMMATP,CH,CK,CM,FORFACH, BACKFACH,FORFACK,BACKFACK,PHIP,ASFXT / NCMODES/TOL/MAXIT/S,N,NCM/‘SM’/NOSMS/NOSMF/NOSM SB/NOSMX/ NSINGM/NOASET/EIGCF1/EIGCF2/IEVLOCK KSAA Structural stiffness matrix KFAA Fluid stiffness matrix MSAA Structural mass matrix MFAA Fluid mass matrix AAA Acoustic coupling matrix VAFS Structure/Fluid partition vector YSTRT Initial guess vector for subspace iteration method HKBAR Modified nonsingular KFAA (for FORMUL=MF) / nonsingular KSAA (for FORMUL = SM) by rigid body or constant pressure LYY LU Decomposition of nonsingular KSAA (for FORMUL=MF) or nonsingular KFAA (for FORMUL = SM) by rigid body or constant pressure XUS Rigid body partition vector XUE Orthogonalized constant pressure partition vector JPBAR Projection matrix for nonsingular structure matrix KSAA JUHAT Projection matrix for nonsingular fluid matrix KFAA RUX Partition vector consistent with JPBAR RROOTS Rigid body modes computed RROOTF Constant pressure modes computed XPS Constant pressure partition vector RP Partition vector consistent with JUHAT PHSA Structural mode shape (including RESVEC) PHFA Fluid mode shape (including RESVEC)

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Solves real coupled modes and corresponding coupled eigenvectors2496 Main Index Output Data Blocks : Parameters:LAMMATS Structure eigenvalue in diagonal matrix form LAMMATF Fluid eigenvalue in diagonal matrix form LAMAC Eigenvalues in matrix from subspace iteration method including rigid body and constant pressure modes VR Right eigenvector VL Left eigenvector LAMAP Eigenvalues in matrix form from previous iteration CH LU decomposition of HKBAR matrix CK LU Decomposition of nonsingular KSAA (for FORMULA=MF) or nonsingular KFAA (for FORMULA = SM) by rigid body or constant pressure CM LL^T Decomposition of mass matrix, MSAA (for FORMULA=MF) or MFAA (for FORMULA=MF) FORFACH Forward FBS factor for CH BACKFACH Backward FBS factor for CH FORFACK Forward FBS factor for CK BACKFACK Backward FBS factor for CK PHIP Eigenvector from the previous iteration (debugging purpose) ASFXT Coupling term NCMODE Input-integer-default = 0. Number of real coupled modes requested TOL Input-real - default = 0.0. Tolerance for subspace iteration convergence test MAXIT Input-integer-default = 0. Maximum number of subspace iteration method NCM Output-integer-default=0. Number of real coupled modes converged. NCM ≤ NCMODE FORMUL Input-character-default=‘MF’. Formula selection for subspace iteration method MF: Mobility Flexibility formulation SM: Stiffness Mass formulation NOSMS Input-integer-default=-1. Number of rigid body vectors (-1 IF NONE) NOSMF Input-integer-default=-1. Number of constant pressure vectors (-1 IF NONE) NOSMFB Input-integer-default=-1. Number of constant pressure vector after added mobility NOSMX Input-integer-default=-1. -1 IF BOTH NOSMF = -1 AND NOSMFB = -1

2497 SBSPITR Solves real coupled modes and corresponding coupled eigenvectors Main Index Remarks: 1.The coupled modes computation uses a subspace iteration method which may use one of two possible formulations called the MF (Mobility-Flexibility) or SM (Stiffness-Mass) formulations. Both formulations lead to the same results, but may exhibit different computation times. The decision of which method to use for a particular model needs more testing, but is currently based on the ratio of structure size and fluid size and the existence of rigid body or constant pressure modes. The user may force one or other of the methods by defining the parameter SBSPFORM. For example, the force the MF method, define PARAM,SBSPFORM,MF; for the SM method, define PARAM,SBSPFORM,SM.NSINGM Input-integer-default=0. The number of total singular vector found. NOASET Input-integer-default=0. The number of degrees of freedom in the A-set. EIGCF1 Input-Real - default = 0.0. The lower frequency range of interest. EIGCF2 Input-Real - default = 0.0. The upper frequency range of interest. IEVLOCK Input-Integer - default = 0. The flag for eigenvector locking.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Matrix element extractor2498 Main Index Extracts a specified element from a matrix for use as a parameter. Format: Input Data Block: Output Data Blocks: None. Parameters: Remarks: 1.If the input is purged, the module returns with a VALUE = (0.,0.). 2.See also PARAML A//’DMI’ option. 3.Prior to Version 2001, VALUED was a single precision parameter. To convert an old DMAP that uses the pre-Version 2001format, see Example 2. 4.If IROW (or ICOL) is greater than the umber of rows (or columns) in A then IROW or (ICOL) will reset to -1 and CDVALUE remains unchanged from its value prior to calling SCALAR. Examples: 1.Extract the matrix element in row 1 and column 2 of matrix A and assigns it to the parameter VALUE. SCALAR A//1/2/S,N,VALUE $ 2.Convert a pre-Version 2001 SCALAR module call to the current version. SCALAR A//1/2/S,N,CDVALUE $ $ Add following statements TYPE PARM,,CS,N,CSVALUE $ CSVALUE = SINGL(CDVALUE) $ 3.Read the values from a matrix V of unknown length into a parameter.SCALAR Matrix element extractor SCALAR A//S,N,NROW/S,N,NCOL/S,N,VALUED $ A Any matrix (real or complex). IROW Input/output-integer-default=1. Row number of element to be extracted from [A]. See Remark 4. ICOL Input/output-integer-default=1. Column number of element. See Remark 4. VALUED Output-complex double precision-default=(0.D0,0.D0). Contents of element at IROW-th row and ICOL-th column in matrix [A].

2499 SCALAR Matrix element extractor Main Index TYPE PARM,,I,N,II $ LOOP COUNTER TYPE PARM,,I,N,VI=1 $ SELECTS COLUMN TO SEARCH DO WHILE (II>=0) $ STOP WHEN II NEGATIVE II = II + 1 $ SCALAR V//1/S,N,II/S,N,VI $ II RESET TO -II WHEN AT END OF MATRIX. IF (II>0) MESSAGE //‘INDEX’/II/‘VALUE’/VI $ ENDDO $

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Calculates nondimensional stability and control derivatives2500 Main Index Calculates and prints the nondimensional stability and control derivatives and the intercepts of the quasi- steady stability derivatives. Format: Input Data Blocks:SDP Calculates nondimensional stability and control derivatives SDP CASEA,AECTRL,AERO,CSTMA,EDT, AEDBUXV,AEMONPT,MONITOR,MPARV,MPAERV,MPAEUV, MPSRV,MPSERV,MPSIERV,MPSEUV,MPSIEUV,UXTRIM,AEDBINDX, PRBDOFS/ STBDER,UXDIFV, UXREF, OSTBDRVT,OHNGDRVT / MACH/Q/AECONFIG/SYMXY/SYMXZ/LPRINT / NDSUPD/NDMINNSU/NDMAXNSU/NDSTOL/MASSID $ CASEA A single record (subcase) of CASECC for aerodynamic analysis. AECTRL T able of aerodynamic model’s control definition. AERO T able of control information for aerodynamic analysis. CSTMA T able of aerodynamic coordinate system transformation matrices for g-set + ks-set grid points. EDT Element deformation table. Contains aerodynamic model records. AEDBUXV Matrix of vehicle states. AEMONPT Aerodynamic monitor points. MONITOR Structural monitor points. MPARV Rigid monitor point loads on aerodynamic model. MPAERV Elastic restrained monitor point loads on aerodynamic model. MPAEUV Elastic unrestrained monitor point loads on aerodynamic model. MPSRV Rigid splined monitor point loads on structural model. MPSERV Elastic restrained monitor point loads on structural model. MPSIRV Inertial restrained monitor point loads on structural model. MPSEUV Elastic unrestrained monitor point loads on structural model. MPSIUV Inertial unrestrained monitor point loads on structural model. UXTRIM UX vector at trim. AEDBINDX Aeroelastic database index for monitor point data. PRBDOFS Partitioning matrix to partition the “active” URDDI from the “inactive”. Active URRDI are assigned a 1.0 value and are connected to the SUPORT degrees-of- freedom.

2501 SDP Calculates nondimensional stability and control derivatives Main Index Output Data Block: Parameters: Remark: Each stability derivative has four forms based on: The aerodynamic model without any consideration of the structural model. The aerodynamics after they have been transferred to the structure but before any elastic effects are computed. The aerodynamics after they have been transferred to the structure and elastic deformations have been included. It is assumed that the model is restrained at the support points for this derivative. The aerodynamics after they have been transferred to the structure and elastic deformations have been included. Movement of the supported degrees of freedom is included in this derivative.STBDER Table of aerostatic stability derivatives for a single subcase. UXDIFV Derivative interpolation factors matrix at UX = UXREF . UXREF Reference controller values. OSTBDRVT Stability and control derivatives. OHNGDRVT Hinge moment derivatives. MACH Input-real-default=no default. Mach number. Q Input-real-default=no default. Dynamic pressure. AECONFIG Input-character-no default. Aerodynamic configuration. SYMXY Input-integer-no default. Aerodynamic x-y symmetry flag. SYMXZ Input-integer-no default. Aerodynamic x-z symmetry flag. LPRINT Input-logical-default=TRUE. Print flag for stability derivatives. NDSUPD Input-integer-default= 2. Number of states to use per dimension for nonlinear interpolation NDMINNSU Input-integer-default=1. Absolute minimum number of states to use for nonlinear interpolation. NDMAXNSU Input-integer-default= 9999999. Absolute maximum number of states to use for nonlinear interpolation. NDSTOL Input-real-default=0.001. State matching tolerance for nonlinear interpolation. MASSID Input-integer-default=-1. Mass case identification number.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Computes solution and single-point forces2502 Main Index Computes and appends the solution (displacements, velocities, acceleration) and single-point forces of constraint at the g-set for each boundary condition. Also appends applied loads. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks: Parameters:SDR1 Computes solution and single-point forces SDR1 USET,PG,UL,UOO,YS,GOA,GM,PS,KFS,KSS,QR,KGG/ UG,PGT,QG/ NSKIP/APP/NOQG /H5UG $ USET Degree-of-freedom set membership table for g-set. PG Static load matrix applied to the g-set. UL Displacement matrix in l-set. UOO Displacement matrix in o-set due to applied loads on the o-set with the a- set fixed (set to zero). YS Matrix of enforced displacements or temperatures. GOA Omitted degree-of-freedom transformation matrix, o-set by a-set. GM Multipoint constraint transformation matrix, m-set by n-set. PS Static load matrix partitioned to the s-set. KFS Stiffness matrix partition (f-set by s-set) from KNN. KSS Stiffness matrix partition (s-set by s-set) from KNN. QR Matrix of determinate support forces. KGG Stiffness matrix in g-set which is used to compute the Lagrange multiplers. UG Displacement matrix in the g-set appended for all boundary conditions. PGT Static load matrix applied to the g-set appended for all boundary conditions. QG Single-point constraint forces of constraint matrix in the g-set appended for all boundary conditions. NSKIP Input-integer-no default. The first subcase of the current boundary condition. APP Input-character-no default. Analysis type. Allowable values:

item.title: User's Manual P127
item.description:
2503 SDR1 Computes solution and single-point forces Main Index Method: Static Analysis In the case of static analysis, SDR1 recovers dependent displacements (4-94) (4-95) where (4-96) Enforced displacements are combined with (4-97) (4-98) where’STATICS’ Statics. ‘REIG’ Normal modes. ‘FREQRESP’ Frequency response. ‘TRANRESP’ T ransient response. ‘CEIGEN’ Complex eigenvalues. ‘MMREIG’ Normal modes for matrix method. ‘BKL0’ Pre-buckling (statics). ‘BKL1’ Buckling. ‘DYNAMIC’ Dynamics. NOQG Input-integer-default=0. Single point forces of constraint matrix creation flag. Default of 1 requests computation of the forces. Specify -1 to request no computation. H5UG Input-integer-default=0. Set to 1 to write UG in H5 ul urua ua uouf uo Goatua uoo + = uf uf Ysun un umug

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Computes solution and single-point forces2504 Main Index (4-99) and recovers single point forces of constraint (4-100) Eigenvalue Analysis In the case of eigenvalue analysis SDR1 recovers dependent components of the eigenvectors (4-101) (4-102) (4-103) (1) (4-104) and single-point forces of constraint (4-105) If PARAM,DYNSPCF ,NEW (default) then the single-point forces are computed as follows: (4-106) Remarks: 1.If NSKIP is greater than 1 and the outputs are declared APPEND on the FILE statement than the outputs will be appended to outputs from prior executions of SDR1. 2.PG, YS, QR, and PS may be purged. 3.If PG is present, PGT must be present. 4.UOO must be present if the o-set exists and APP is equal to ‘STATICS’ or ‘BLK0’. 5.GM must be present if the m-set exists. 6.KFS must be present if the s-set exists and QG is present. 7.KSS must be present if YS is present, the s-set exists, and QG is present. 8.UOO, KSS and YS are ignored if APP is not equal to ‘STATICS’ or ‘BLK0’.um Gmnun = qs KfsTufKssYs Ps – + = o Goaa = a o—– f = f s—– n = m Gmnn = n m—— g = qs KfsTf = qs Ksf2Msf – f =

2505 SDR1 Computes solution and single-point forces Main Index 9.See Section 9.4.11 of the MSC Nastran Reference Guide for further discussion of the matrix operations in SDR1. 10. SDR1 can also process matrices with extra points.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Creates data recovery output tables2506 Main Index Creates tables based on output requests for forces of single-point and multipoint forces of constraint, applied loads, displacements, velocities, accelerations, element stresses, element strains, and element forces. These output tables are suitable for printing, plotting, and various other postprocessing. Format: Input Data Blocks:SDR2 Creates data recovery output tables SDR2 CASECC, CSTM ,MPT ,DIT , ,

, ETT ,OL ,BGPDT ,PG , QG ,UG ,EST ,XYCDB , UNUSED15 , UNUSED16,UNUSED17 , GPSNT ,DEQATN ,DEQIND , DITID ,PCOMPT ,GPKE ,EDT ,VG , AG ,QMG ,MMCDB ,ESTMG ,GRPSTM , MTSTM ,MTSTM1 ,MTSTM2 ,MTSTM3 ,MTSTM4 , MMTX ,MMTXR ,MMTX1 ,NLVECM ,VCCTM , GCOMM ,N2M ,UNUSED ,PBRMS0 ,CPLDIN1 , CPLDTEMP,HRMSP ,NLRSMP ,UGNI ,QS2SGN , QS2SGT ,ELAFG ,UGDSX ,UGSRE / OPG ,OQG ,OUG ,OES ,OEF , PUG ,OVG ,OAG ,OQMG ,OGPKE1 , OSTR ,OMM ,OTEMPP ,OCOMP ,OQS2SGN , QS2SGT , FENLXX ,O ELAFG ,OUGDS ,OUGRD , OEFTBD ,OFPMDPOS/ APP /S,N,SORTFLAG/NOCOMP/ACOUSTIC/DVAFLAG/ HTFLOW /CFO /ACOUT /PREFDB /TABS / SIGMA / UNUSED12/UNUSED13/ BSKIP /W3 / W4 /LANGLE /OMID /G /S,N,OCID/ QRCOMP /TANALY /NUMCPLDY/CBUSH /LGDISP0 / SEID /LGPFRC /FSFLG /HRMFRQ /SUBFAC /LOADFACT/ IMPFID $ CASECC T able of Case Control command images. CSTM T able of coordinate system transformation matrices. MPT T able of Bulk Data entry images related to material properties. DIT T able of TABLEij Bulk Data entry images. EQEXIN Equivalence table between external and internal grid/scalar identification numbers. See Remark 5. EQDYN Equivalence table between external and internal grid/scalar/extra point identification numbers. (EQEXIN appended with extra point data.) SIL Scalar index list.EQEXIN EQDYN    SIL SILD

2507 SDR2 Creates data recovery output tables Main Index SILD Scalar index list for the p-set. See Remark 5. ETT Element temperature table. OL Complex or real eigenvalue summary table, transient response time output list or frequency response frequency output list. BGPDT Basic grid point definition table. PG Static load matrix applied to the g-set. QG Single-point (or mutipoint-QMG) constraint forces of constraint matrix in the g-set. UG Displacement matrix in g-set. For the DSVG1 module and transient analysis, UG can also represent velocity or acceleration. EST Element summary table. XYCDB Table of x-y plotting commands. UNUSED15 Unused and may be left blank. UNUSED16 Unused and may be left blank. UNUSED17 Unused and may be left blank. GPSNT Grid point shell normal table. DEQATN Table of DEQATN Bulk Data entry images. DEQIND Index table to DEQATN data block. DITID Table of identification numbers in DIT . PCOMPT Table containing LAM option input and expanded information from the PCOMP Bulk Data entry. GPKE Matrix of grid point kinetic energies. EDT Table of Bulk Data entry images related to element deformation, aerodynamics, p- element analysis, divergence analysis, and the iterative solver. Also contains SET1 entries. VG Velocity matrix in g-set. AG Acceleration matrix in g-set. QMG Multipoint constraint forces of constraint matrix in the g-set. MMCDB Table of MAXMIN(DEF) specifications. Datablocks for Advanced Nonlinear Element ESTMG, GRPSTM, MTSTM, MMTX, etc. Field 29-42 CPLDIN1 Multi-Physics Input Datablock (UPVNLH from other physics) CPLDTEMP Multi-Physics Input Datablock … Initial T emperature from heat pass NLRSMP R.S. MAP (used by NLRESTART , NLIC,…)

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Creates data recovery output tables2508 Main Index Output Data Blocks: Parameters:QS2SGN Matrix of S2S glued contact normal nodal forces and moments QS2SGT Matrix of S2S glued contact tangential nodal forces and moments ELAFG Matrix of Elastic Forces UGDSX Dynamic Stiffness Matrix for g set UGSRE Relative Displacement Matrix for g set OPG T able of applied loads in SORT1 or SORT2 format. OQG T able of single forces-of-constraint in SORT1 or SORT2 format. OUG T able of displacements in SORT1 or SORT2 format. OES T able of element stresses in SORT1 or SORT2 format. OEF T able of element forces in SORT1 or SORT2 format. PUG Matrix of translational displacements for plotting purposes. OVG T able of velocities in SORT1 or SORT2 format. OAG T able of accelerations in SORT1 or SORT2 format. OQMG T able of multipoint forces-of-constraint in SORT1 or SORT2 format. OGPKE1 T able of grid point kinetic energies in SORT1 format. OSTR T able of element strains in SORT1 or SORT2 format. OMM T able of maximum/minimum in SORT1 or SORT2 format OTEMPP TOP/BOT/MID temperature OCOMP OFP Table for Marc Composite Output (Linear Perturbation) OQS2SGN OFP Table of S2S glued contact normal forces/moments OQS2SGT OFP Table of S2S glued contact tangential forces/moments FENLxx OFP Table for GPFORCE of MARC elements OELAFG OFP table of Elastic Forces
OUGDS OFP table of Dynamic Stiffness OUGRD OFP table of Relative Displacement OEFTBD OFP Table of TBD matrix OFPMDPOS OFP data position data for modules APP Input-character-no default. Analysis type. Allowable values: ‘STATICS’ Statics. ‘REIGEN’ Normal modes.

2509 SDR2 Creates data recovery output tables Main Index ‘FREQRESP’ Frequency response. ‘TRANRESP’ T ransient response. ‘CEIGEN’ Complex eigenvalues. ‘MMREIG’ Normal modes for matrix method. ‘BKL0’ Pre-buckling (statics). ‘BKL1’ Buckling. ‘NLST’ Nonlinear statics. ‘GNST’ Geometric nonlinear statics. ‘NLTR’ Geometric nonlinear transient. SORTFLAG Input/Output-Default=1. SORT1/SORT2 format flag. If 1 on input then: The columns of UG, QG, and QMG correspond to frequencies, time steps, or eigenvalues, etc., depending on APP and output will be in SORT2 format Then on output: set to 1 if (1) SORT2 format is requested or XYCDB exists, or (2) APP=’TRANRESP’ with no SORT1 requests; -1 otherwise. If 2 on input then: The rows of UG, QG, and QMG correspond to frequencies, time steps, or eigenvalues, etc., depending on APP and output will be in SORT2 format. If APP = ‘TRANRESP’ then UG, VG, and AG must be input separately. Then on output: set to -1 if XYCDB does not exist and (1) SORT1 format is requested or (2) APP<>’TRANRESP’ with no SORT2 requests; 1 otherwise. NOCOMP Input-Integer-Default=1. 0Compute stresses for all elements. 1Compute stresses for non-composite elements only. 2Compute element forces and strain curvatures ofr composite elements in the set referenced by STRESS=sid. 3Compute element forces and strain curvatures ofr composite elements using the set referenced by STRAIN=sid. ACOUSTIC Input-integer-default=0. Fluid-structure analysis flag. If set to 2 then acoustic pressure is computed for fluid elements. 0No fluid elements exist. 1Penalty or fluid acoustic elements exists. 2Fluid/structure coupling exists.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Creates data recovery output tables2510 Main Index DVAFLAG Input-integer-default=-1. Flag indicating velocities and accelerations will be output in separate data blocks. -1Velocities and acceleratons are contained in OUG. 1Velocities and acceleratons are contained in OVG and OAG. HTFLOW Input-integer-default=-1. Heat flow output flag. -1Do not compute heat flow. 1Compute heat flow. CFO Input-integer-default=-1. Connector force output flag. -1 General SDR2 output. 1 Process connector force output only. ACOUT Input-character-default=‘PEAK’. Type of acoustic pressure output in fluid-structural analysis. ‘RMS’ Root-mean-square. ‘PEAK’ Peak. PREFDB Input-real-default=1.0. Peak pressure reference for pressure level in units of dB or dBA. TABS Input-real-default=0.0. Absolute temperature conversion. For example, set to 273.16 when specifying temperatures in Celsius or 459.69 in Fahrenheit. SIGMA Input-real-default=0.0. The Stefan-Boltzmann constant. Used to compute radiant heat flux. UNUSED12 Input-integer-default=-1 . Unused and may be left blank. UNUSED13 Output-logical-default=FALSE . Unused and may be left blank. BSKIP Input-logical-default=TRUE. Pre-buckling subcase skip flag. If TRUE, then skip the first subcase in CASECC. W3 Input-real-default=0. Scale factor denominator for including stiffness in viscous damping for transient analysis. Usually input by user parameter. W4 Input-real-default=0. Scale factor denominator for including non-uniform structural damping in viscous damping for transient analysis. Usually input by user parameter. LANGLE Input-integer-default=1. Large rotation calculation method: 1Gimbal angle. 2Rotation vector. OMID Input-character-default=‘NO’ Material output coordinate system flag. If OMID=‘YES’ then stresses, strains, and forces are output in the material coordinate system of CQUAD4, CTRIA3, CQUAD8, and CTRIA6 elements. G Input-real-default=0. Uniform structural damping coefficient. Usually input by user parameter.

2511 SDR2 Creates data recovery output tables Main Index Remarks: 1.Any output may be purged. 2.CSTM may be purged if no coordinate systems are referenced, or if stresses and/or forces are not requested. 3.MPT and EST may be purged if there are no requests for element stresses, strains, or forces. 4.DIT may be purged if no stress or force requests are present or if no temperature dependent materials are referenced. 5.SDR2 can also process p-set matrices (UP, QP, and PP instead of UG, QG, and PG) as long as EQDYN and SILD are specified. Otherwise, SILD may be purged.OCID Output-integer-default=0. Print flag for coordinate system identification number in grid point output. The following bits in OCID are set to 1 based on user output requests. 1Displacements. 2Applied loads. 3spcforces and mpcforces. 7Eigenvectors. 10 Velocities. 11 Accelerations. QRCOMP Input-integer-default=0. Flag to control the process of composite elements in SOL 400. 0Original flow. 1Process composite QR/TR with NONLIN=T; Process all other composite elements with NONLIN=F . NUMCPLDY Input-integer. Number of multi-physics passes in subcase. CBUSH Input-integer. Flag for rigid elements. LGDISP0 Input-integer. Geometry nonlinearity flag. SEID Input-integer-default= 0. ID of Super-element. LGPFRC Input-integer-default= 0. Flag for GPFORCE presence with Marc element. FSFLG Input-integer-default= 0. Flag for fluid/structure Eigenvector for OUG datablock. HRMFRQ Integer-input-default=0. Number of harmonics in SOL 128. SUBFAC Real-input-default= 1.0. Subfactor defined in NLHARM entry. LOADFACT Input-real-default=0.0. Nonlinear static analysis load factor at which a nonlinear buckling eigensolution is performed. The IDENT records for all outputs will contain this value at word 7 and LOADFACT will appear in the f06 and pch files of the outputs. IMPFID Input-integer-default=0. Imperfection ID.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Creates data recovery output tables2512 Main Index 6.ETT may be purged if no thermal loading exists, or there are no requests for stresses or forces. 7.EDT may be purged if there are no element requests for forces or stresses, or if there are no enforced element deformations in the problem. 8.BGPDT may be purged if all displacement (global) coordinate systems are in the basic coordinate system and if there are no requests for element stresses, strains, or forces exist. However, PUG will not be computed. 9.LAMA or CLAMA may not be purged if an eigenvalue or frequency response problem exists. 10. EQEXIN and XYCDB may be purged. 11. If SORT2 format is desired for the outputs then the parameter SORTFLAG must be set to 2 and the input data blocks UG, QG, and QMG must be in their transposed form.

2513 SDR3 Converts tables in SORT1 (or SORT2) format to SORT2 (or SORT1) format Main Index Converts tables in SORT1 (or SORT2) format to SORT2 (or SORT1) format. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Block: Parameters: Remark: The SORT1 format created by modules like SDR2 is sorted accordingly: element type subcase ( or time step, frequency, etc. element identification number But the SORT1 format which has been reordered from SORT2 inputs by SDR3 is sorted accordingly: subcase ( or time step, frequency, etc. element type element identification numberSDR3 Converts tables in SORT1 (or SORT2) format to SORT2 (or SORT1) format SDR3 OFP1,OFP2,OFP3,OFP4,OFP5,OFP6/ OFP1X,OFP2X,OFP3X,OFP4X,OFP5X,OFP6X/ OCMPTBL $ OFPi Output table in SORT1 (or SORT2) format. OFPiX Output table in SORT2 (or SORT1) format. OCMPTBL Input-Integer-Default=0. Output table in SORT1 contains composite plies. 0 For regular Non-Composite table processing. 1 Force layered composite table processing.

MSC Nastran DMAP Programmer’s Guide Calculates laminar stresses2514 Main Index Calculates laminar stresses, or strains, and failure indices in composite elements. Format: Input Data Blocks: Output Data Blocks:SDRCOMP Calculates laminar stresses SDRCOMP CASECC,MPT,EPT,ETT,EST, ,DIT,BGPDT,PCOMPT/ OES1C, ,OEFIT,OEF1AA,OPLYSR,OGPLYSS,OGPLYFI,OGPS R, OEXTFIB / STRNFLG/DESOPT/LOADFAC/SRCOMPS/APPFLAG/SRTFLAG/PCOMPRM / IMPFID
CASECC T able of Case Control command images. MPT T able of Bulk Data entry images related to material properties. EPT T able of Bulk Data entry images related to element properties. ETT Element temperature table. EST Element summary table. OES1A T able of element strain/curvatures in SORT1 format for the composite elements only. OSCRMS T able of composite element ply root mean square (RMS) stresses, created by RANDOM module. OEF1A T able of element forces in SORT1 format for the composite elements only. DIT T able of TABLEij Bulk Data entry images. BGPDT Basic grid point definition table. PCOMPT T able containing LAM option input and expanded information from the PCOMP Bulk Data entry.
